sinaiticus.text: VISION ONE.

verses.text: VISION ONE.

sinaiticus.text: The master, who reared me, had sold me to one Rhoda in Rome.

verses.text: The master, who reared me, had sold me to one Rhoda in Rome.

sinaiticus.text: After many years, I met her again, and began to love her as a sister.

verses.text: After many years, I met her again, and began to love her as a sister.

sinaiticus.text: After a certain time I saw her bathing in the river Tiber;

verses.text: After a certain time I saw her bathing in the river Tiber;

sinaiticus.text: and I gave her my hand, and led her out of the river.

verses.text: and I gave her my hand, and led her out of the river.

sinaiticus.text: So, seeing her beauty, I reasoned in my heart, saying, Happy were I, if I had such an one to wife both in beauty and in character.

verses.text: So, seeing her beauty, I reasoned in my heart, saying, Happy were I, if I had such an one to wife both in beauty and in character.

sinaiticus.text: I merely reflected on this and nothing more.

verses.text: I merely reflected on this and nothing more.

sinaiticus.text: After a certain time, as I was journeying to Cumae, and glorifying God’s creatures for their greatness and splendour and power, as I walked I fell asleep.

verses.text: After a certain time, as I was journeying to Cumae, and glorifying God’s creatures for their greatness and splendour and power, as I walked I fell asleep.

sinaiticus.text: And a Spirit took me, and bore me away through a pathless tract, through which no man could pass

verses.text: And a Spirit took me, and bore me away through a pathless tract, through which no man could pass

sinaiticus.text: for the place was precipitous, and broken into clefts by reason of the waters.

verses.text: for the place was precipitous, and broken into clefts by reason of the waters.

sinaiticus.text: When then I had crossed the river, I came into the level country, and knelt down, and began to pray to the Lord and to confess my sins.

verses.text: When then I had crossed the river, I came into the level country, and knelt down, and began to pray to the Lord and to confess my sins.

sinaiticus.text: Now, while I prayed, the heaven was opened, and I see the lady, whom I had desired, greeting me from heaven, saying, Good morrow, Hermas.

verses.text: Now, while I prayed, the heaven was opened, and I see the lady, whom I had desired, greeting me from heaven, saying, Good morrow, Hermas.

sinaiticus.text: And, looking at her, I said to her, Lady, what doest thou here?

verses.text: And, looking at her, I said to her, Lady, what doest thou here?

sinaiticus.text: Then she answered me, I was taken up, that I might convict thee of thy sins before the Lord.

verses.text: Then she answered me, I was taken up, that I might convict thee of thy sins before the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: I said to her, Dost thou now convict me?

verses.text: I said to her, Dost thou now convict me?

sinaiticus.text: Nay, not so, said she, but hear the words, that I shall say to thee.

verses.text: Nay, not so, said she, but hear the words, that I shall say to thee.

sinaiticus.text: God, Who dwelleth in the heavens, and created out of nothing the things which are, and increased and multiplied them for His holy Church’s sake, is wroth with thee, for that thou didst sin against me.

verses.text: God, Who dwelleth in the heavens, and created out of nothing the things which are, and increased and multiplied them for His holy Church’s sake, is wroth with thee, for that thou didst sin against me.

sinaiticus.text: I answered her and said, Sin, against thee?

verses.text: I answered her and said, Sin, against thee?

sinaiticus.text: In what way?

verses.text: In what way?

sinaiticus.text: Did I ever speak an unseemly word unto thee?

verses.text: Did I ever speak an unseemly word unto thee?

sinaiticus.text: Did I not always regard thee as a goddess?

verses.text: Did I not always regard thee as a goddess?

sinaiticus.text: Did I not always respect thee as a sister?

verses.text: Did I not always respect thee as a sister?

sinaiticus.text: How couldst thou falsely charge me, lady, with such villainy and uncleanness?

verses.text: How couldst thou falsely charge me, lady, with such villainy and uncleanness?

sinaiticus.text: Laughing she saith unto me, The desire after evil entered into

verses.text: Laughing she saith unto me, The desire after evil entered into

sinaiticus.text: Nay, thinkest thou not that it is an evil deed for a righteous man, if the evil desire should enter into his heart?

verses.text: Nay, thinkest thou not that it is an evil deed for a righteous man, if the evil desire should enter into his heart?

sinaiticus.text: It is indeed a sin and a great one too, saith she;

verses.text: It is indeed a sin and a great one too, saith she;

sinaiticus.text: for the righteous man entertaineth righteous purposes.

verses.text: for the righteous man entertaineth righteous purposes.

sinaiticus.text: While then, his purposes are righteous, his repute stands stedfast in the heavens, and he finds the Lord easily propitiated in all that he does.

verses.text: While then, his purposes are righteous, his repute stands stedfast in the heavens, and he finds the Lord easily propitiated in all that he does.

sinaiticus.text: But they that entertain evil purposes in their hearts, bring upon themselves death and captivity,

verses.text: But they that entertain evil purposes in their hearts, bring upon themselves death and captivity,

sinaiticus.text: especially they that claim for themselves this present world, and boast in its riches, and cleave not to the good things that are to come.

verses.text: especially they that claim for themselves this present world, and boast in its riches, and cleave not to the good things that are to come.

sinaiticus.text: Their souls shall rue it, seeing that they have no hope, but have abandoned themselves and their life.

verses.text: Their souls shall rue it, seeing that they have no hope, but have abandoned themselves and their life.

sinaiticus.text: AS soon as she had spoken these words the heavens were shut;

verses.text: AS soon as she had spoken these words the heavens were shut;

sinaiticus.text: myself, If this sin is recorded against me, how can I be saved?

verses.text: myself, If this sin is recorded against me, how can I be saved?

sinaiticus.text: Or how shall I propitiate God for my sins which are full-blown?

verses.text: Or how shall I propitiate God for my sins which are full-blown?

sinaiticus.text: Or with what words shall I entreat the Lord that He may be propitious unto me?

verses.text: Or with what words shall I entreat the Lord that He may be propitious unto me?

sinaiticus.text: While I was advising and discussing these matters in my heart,

verses.text: While I was advising and discussing these matters in my heart,

sinaiticus.text: I see before me a great white chair of snow-white wool and there came an aged lady in glistening raiment, having a book in her hands,

verses.text: I see before me a great white chair of snow-white wool and there came an aged lady in glistening raiment, having a book in her hands,

sinaiticus.text: and she sat down alone, and she saluted me, Good morrow, Hermas.

verses.text: and she sat down alone, and she saluted me, Good morrow, Hermas.

sinaiticus.text: Then I grieved and weeping, said, Good morrow, lady.

verses.text: Then I grieved and weeping, said, Good morrow, lady.

sinaiticus.text: And she said to me, Why so gloomy, Hermas, thou that art patient and good-tempered, and art always smiling?

verses.text: And she said to me, Why so gloomy, Hermas, thou that art patient and good-tempered, and art always smiling?

sinaiticus.text: Why so downcast in thy looks, and far from cheerful?

verses.text: Why so downcast in thy looks, and far from cheerful?

sinaiticus.text: And I said to her, Because of an excellent lady saying that I had sinned against her.

verses.text: And I said to her, Because of an excellent lady saying that I had sinned against her.

sinaiticus.text: Then she said, Far be this thing from the servant of God ! Nevertheless the thought did enter into thy heart concerning her.

verses.text: Then she said, Far be this thing from the servant of God ! Nevertheless the thought did enter into thy heart concerning her.

sinaiticus.text: Now to the servants of God such a purpose bringeth sin.

verses.text: Now to the servants of God such a purpose bringeth sin.

sinaiticus.text: For it is an evil and mad purpose to overtake a devout spirit that hath been already approved,

verses.text: For it is an evil and mad purpose to overtake a devout spirit that hath been already approved,

sinaiticus.text: that it should desire an evil deed, and especially if it be Hermas the temperate, who abstaineth from every evil desire, and is full of all simplicity and of great guilelessness.

verses.text: that it should desire an evil deed, and especially if it be Hermas the temperate, who abstaineth from every evil desire, and is full of all simplicity and of great guilelessness.

sinaiticus.text: Yet it is not for this that God is wroth with thee, but that thou mayest convert thy family, that hath done wrong against the Lord and against you their parents.

verses.text: Yet it is not for this that God is wroth with thee, but that thou mayest convert thy family, that hath done wrong against the Lord and against you their parents.

sinaiticus.text: But out of fondness for thy children thou didst not admonish thy family, but didst suffer it to become fearfully corrupt.

verses.text: But out of fondness for thy children thou didst not admonish thy family, but didst suffer it to become fearfully corrupt.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the Lord is wroth with thee.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord is wroth with thee.

sinaiticus.text: But He will heal all thy past sins, which have been committed in thy family;

verses.text: But He will heal all thy past sins, which have been committed in thy family;

sinaiticus.text: for by reason of their sins and iniquities thou hast been corrupted by the affairs of this world.

verses.text: for by reason of their sins and iniquities thou hast been corrupted by the affairs of this world.

sinaiticus.text: But the great mercy of the Lord had pity on thee and thy family, and will strengthen thee, and establish thee in His glory.

verses.text: But the great mercy of the Lord had pity on thee and thy family, and will strengthen thee, and establish thee in His glory.

sinaiticus.text: Only be not thou careless, but take courage, and strengthen thy family.

verses.text: Only be not thou careless, but take courage, and strengthen thy family.

sinaiticus.text: For as the smith hammering his work conquers the task which he wills, so also doth righteous discourse repeated daily conquer all evil.

verses.text: For as the smith hammering his work conquers the task which he wills, so also doth righteous discourse repeated daily conquer all evil.

sinaiticus.text: Cease not therefore to reprove thy children;

verses.text: Cease not therefore to reprove thy children;

sinaiticus.text: for I know that if they shall repent with all their heart, they shall be written in the books of life with the saints.

verses.text: for I know that if they shall repent with all their heart, they shall be written in the books of life with the saints.

sinaiticus.text: After these words of hers had ceased, she saith unto me, Wilt thou listen to me as I read?

verses.text: After these words of hers had ceased, she saith unto me, Wilt thou listen to me as I read?

sinaiticus.text: Then say I, Yes, lady.

verses.text: Then say I, Yes, lady.

sinaiticus.text: She saith to me, Be attentive, and hear the glories of God.

verses.text: She saith to me, Be attentive, and hear the glories of God.

sinaiticus.text: I listened with attention and with wonder to that which I had no power to remember;

verses.text: I listened with attention and with wonder to that which I had no power to remember;

sinaiticus.text: for all the words were terrible, such as man cannot bear.

verses.text: for all the words were terrible, such as man cannot bear.

sinaiticus.text: The last words however I remembered, for they were suitable for us and gentle.

verses.text: The last words however I remembered, for they were suitable for us and gentle.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, the God of Hosts, Who by His invisible and mighty power and by His great wisdom created the world,

verses.text: Behold, the God of Hosts, Who by His invisible and mighty power and by His great wisdom created the world,

sinaiticus.text: and by His glorious purpose clothed His creation with comeliness,

verses.text: and by His glorious purpose clothed His creation with comeliness,

sinaiticus.text: and by His strong word fixed the heaven,

verses.text: and by His strong word fixed the heaven,

sinaiticus.text: and founded the earth upon the waters and by His own wisdom and providence formed His Holy Church, which also He blessed- behold,

verses.text: and founded the earth upon the waters and by His own wisdom and providence formed His Holy Church, which also He blessed- behold,

sinaiticus.text: He removeth the heavens and the mountains and the hills and the seas,

verses.text: He removeth the heavens and the mountains and the hills and the seas,

sinaiticus.text: and all things are made level for His elect,

verses.text: and all things are made level for His elect,

sinaiticus.text: that He may fulfil to them the promise which He promised with great glory and rejoicing, if so be that they shall keep the ordinances of God, which they received, with great faith.

verses.text: that He may fulfil to them the promise which He promised with great glory and rejoicing, if so be that they shall keep the ordinances of God, which they received, with great faith.

sinaiticus.text: When then she finished reading and arose from her chair, there came four young men, and they took away the chair, and departed towards the East.

verses.text: When then she finished reading and arose from her chair, there came four young men, and they took away the chair, and departed towards the East.

sinaiticus.text: Then she calleth me unto her, and she touched my breast, and saith to me, Did my reading please thee?

verses.text: Then she calleth me unto her, and she touched my breast, and saith to me, Did my reading please thee?

sinaiticus.text: And I say unto her, Lady, these last words please me, but the former were difficult and hard.

verses.text: And I say unto her, Lady, these last words please me, but the former were difficult and hard.

sinaiticus.text: Then she spake to me, saying, These last words are for the righteous, but the former are for the heathen and the rebellious.

verses.text: Then she spake to me, saying, These last words are for the righteous, but the former are for the heathen and the rebellious.

sinaiticus.text: While she yet spake with me, two men appeared, and took her by the arms, and they departed, whither the chair also had gone towards the East.

verses.text: While she yet spake with me, two men appeared, and took her by the arms, and they departed, whither the chair also had gone towards the East.

sinaiticus.text: VISION TWO.

verses.text: VISION TWO.

sinaiticus.text: and I called to mind my last years vision as I walked;

verses.text: and I called to mind my last years vision as I walked;

sinaiticus.text: and again a Spirit taketh me, and carrieth me away to the same place as last year.

verses.text: and again a Spirit taketh me, and carrieth me away to the same place as last year.

sinaiticus.text: When then I arrived at the place, I fell upon my knees, and began to pray to the Lord, and to glorify His name, for that he counted me worthy, and made known unto me my former sins.

verses.text: When then I arrived at the place, I fell upon my knees, and began to pray to the Lord, and to glorify His name, for that he counted me worthy, and made known unto me my former sins.

sinaiticus.text: But after I had risen up from prayer, I behold before me the aged lady, whom also I had seen last year, walking and reading a little book.

verses.text: But after I had risen up from prayer, I behold before me the aged lady, whom also I had seen last year, walking and reading a little book.

sinaiticus.text: And she saith to me, Canst thou report these things to the elect of God?

verses.text: And she saith to me, Canst thou report these things to the elect of God?

sinaiticus.text: I say unto her, Lady, I cannot recollect so much;

verses.text: I say unto her, Lady, I cannot recollect so much;

sinaiticus.text: but give me the little book, that I may copy it.

verses.text: but give me the little book, that I may copy it.

sinaiticus.text: Take it, saith she, and be sure and return it to me.

verses.text: Take it, saith she, and be sure and return it to me.

sinaiticus.text: I took it, and retiring to a certain spot in the country I copied it letter for letter:

verses.text: I took it, and retiring to a certain spot in the country I copied it letter for letter:

sinaiticus.text: for I could not make out the syllables.

verses.text: for I could not make out the syllables.

sinaiticus.text: When then I had finished the letters of the book, suddenly the book was snatched out of my hand;

verses.text: When then I had finished the letters of the book, suddenly the book was snatched out of my hand;

sinaiticus.text: Now after fifteen days, when I had fasted and entreated the Lord earnestly, the knowledge of the writing was revealed to me.

verses.text: Now after fifteen days, when I had fasted and entreated the Lord earnestly, the knowledge of the writing was revealed to me.

sinaiticus.text: And this is what was written:

verses.text: And this is what was written:

sinaiticus.text: the Lord, and have betrayed their parents through great wickedness, yea, they have got the name of betrayers of parents, and yet they did not profit by their betrayal;492

verses.text: the Lord, and have betrayed their parents through great wickedness, yea, they have got the name of betrayers of parents, and yet they did not profit by their betrayal;492

sinaiticus.text: and they still further added to their sins wanton deeds and reckless wickedness;

verses.text: and they still further added to their sins wanton deeds and reckless wickedness;

sinaiticus.text: and so the measure of their transgressions was filled up.

verses.text: and so the measure of their transgressions was filled up.

sinaiticus.text: But make these words known to all thy children, and to thy wife who shall be as thy sister;

verses.text: But make these words known to all thy children, and to thy wife who shall be as thy sister;

sinaiticus.text: for she too refraineth not from using her tongue, wherewith she doeth evil.

verses.text: for she too refraineth not from using her tongue, wherewith she doeth evil.

sinaiticus.text: But, when she hears these words, she will refrain, and will find mercy.

verses.text: But, when she hears these words, she will refrain, and will find mercy.

sinaiticus.text: After that thou hast made known unto them All these words,

verses.text: After that thou hast made known unto them All these words,

sinaiticus.text: which the Master commanded me that they should be revealed unto thee, then all their sins which they sinned aforetime are forgiven to them;

verses.text: which the Master commanded me that they should be revealed unto thee, then all their sins which they sinned aforetime are forgiven to them;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and to all the saints that have sinned unto this day, if they repent with their whole heart, and remove double-mindedness from their heart.

verses.text: yea, and to all the saints that have sinned unto this day, if they repent with their whole heart, and remove double-mindedness from their heart.

sinaiticus.text: For the Master sware by His own glory, as concerning His elect;

verses.text: For the Master sware by His own glory, as concerning His elect;

sinaiticus.text: that if, now that this day has been set as a limit, sin shall hereafter be committed, they shall not find salvation;

verses.text: that if, now that this day has been set as a limit, sin shall hereafter be committed, they shall not find salvation;

sinaiticus.text: for repentance for the righteous hath an end;

verses.text: for repentance for the righteous hath an end;

sinaiticus.text: the days of repentance are accomplished for all the saints;

verses.text: the days of repentance are accomplished for all the saints;

sinaiticus.text: whereas for the Gentiles there is repentance until the last day.

verses.text: whereas for the Gentiles there is repentance until the last day.

sinaiticus.text: Thou shalt therefore say unto the rulers of the Church, that they direct their paths in righteousness, that they may receive in full the promises with abundant glory.

verses.text: Thou shalt therefore say unto the rulers of the Church, that they direct their paths in righteousness, that they may receive in full the promises with abundant glory.

sinaiticus.text: Ye therefore that work righteousness be stedfast, and be not double-minded, that ye may have admission with the holy angels.

verses.text: Ye therefore that work righteousness be stedfast, and be not double-minded, that ye may have admission with the holy angels.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are ye, as many as endure patiently the great tribulation that cometh, and as many as shall not deny their life.

verses.text: Blessed are ye, as many as endure patiently the great tribulation that cometh, and as many as shall not deny their life.

sinaiticus.text: For the Lord sware concerning His Son, that those who denied their Lord should be rejected from their life, even they that are now about to deny Him in the coming days;

verses.text: For the Lord sware concerning His Son, that those who denied their Lord should be rejected from their life, even they that are now about to deny Him in the coming days;

sinaiticus.text: But do thou, Hermas, no longer bear a grudge against thy children, neither suffer thy sister to have her way,

verses.text: But do thou, Hermas, no longer bear a grudge against thy children, neither suffer thy sister to have her way,

sinaiticus.text: so that they with a righteous chastisement, unless thou bear a grudge against them thyself.

verses.text: so that they with a righteous chastisement, unless thou bear a grudge against them thyself.

sinaiticus.text: The bearing of a grudge worketh death.

verses.text: The bearing of a grudge worketh death.

sinaiticus.text: But thou, Hermas, hast had great tribulations of thine own, by reason of the transgressions of thy family, because thou hadst no care

verses.text: But thou, Hermas, hast had great tribulations of thine own, by reason of the transgressions of thy family, because thou hadst no care

sinaiticus.text: For thou wast neglectful of them, and wast mixed up with thine evil transactions.

verses.text: For thou wast neglectful of them, and wast mixed up with thine evil transactions.

sinaiticus.text: But herein is thy salvation, in that thou didst not depart from the living God, and in thy simplicity and thy great continence.

verses.text: But herein is thy salvation, in that thou didst not depart from the living God, and in thy simplicity and thy great continence.

sinaiticus.text: These have saved thee, if thou abidest therein;

verses.text: These have saved thee, if thou abidest therein;

sinaiticus.text: and they save all who do such things, and walk in guilelessness and simplicity.

verses.text: and they save all who do such things, and walk in guilelessness and simplicity.

sinaiticus.text: These men prevail over all wickedness, and continue unto life eternal.

verses.text: These men prevail over all wickedness, and continue unto life eternal.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are all they that work righteousness.

verses.text: Blessed are all they that work righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: They shall never be destroyed.

verses.text: They shall never be destroyed.

sinaiticus.text: But thou shalt say to Maximus, “Behold tribulation cometh (upon thee), if thou think fit to deny a second time.

verses.text: But thou shalt say to Maximus, “Behold tribulation cometh (upon thee), if thou think fit to deny a second time.

sinaiticus.text: The Lord is nigh unto them that turn unto Him, as it is written in Eldad and Modat, who prophesied to the people in the wilderness.”

verses.text: The Lord is nigh unto them that turn unto Him, as it is written in Eldad and Modat, who prophesied to the people in the wilderness.”

sinaiticus.text: Now, brethren, a revelation was made unto me in my sleep by a youth of exceeding fair form,

verses.text: Now, brethren, a revelation was made unto me in my sleep by a youth of exceeding fair form,

sinaiticus.text: who said to me, Whom thinkest thou the aged woman, from whom thou receivedst the book, to be?

verses.text: who said to me, Whom thinkest thou the aged woman, from whom thou receivedst the book, to be?

sinaiticus.text: I say, The Sibyl.

verses.text: I say, The Sibyl.

sinaiticus.text: Thou art wrong, saith be, she is not.

verses.text: Thou art wrong, saith be, she is not.

sinaiticus.text: Who then is she?

verses.text: Who then is she?

sinaiticus.text: I say.

verses.text: I say.

sinaiticus.text: The Church, saith he.

verses.text: The Church, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: I said unto him, Wherefore then is she aged?

verses.text: I said unto him, Wherefore then is she aged?

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, she was created before all things;

verses.text: Because, saith he, she was created before all things;

sinaiticus.text: therefore is she aged;

verses.text: therefore is she aged;

sinaiticus.text: and for her sake the world was framed.

verses.text: and for her sake the world was framed.

sinaiticus.text: And afterwards I saw a vision in my house.

verses.text: And afterwards I saw a vision in my house.

sinaiticus.text: The aged woman came, and asked me, if I had already given the book to the elders.

verses.text: The aged woman came, and asked me, if I had already given the book to the elders.

sinaiticus.text: I said that I had not given it.

verses.text: I said that I had not given it.

sinaiticus.text: Thou hast done well, she said, for I have words to add.

verses.text: Thou hast done well, she said, for I have words to add.

sinaiticus.text: When then I shall have finished all the words, it shall be made known by thy means to all the elect.

verses.text: When then I shall have finished all the words, it shall be made known by thy means to all the elect.

sinaiticus.text: Thou shalt therefore write two little books, and shalt send one to Clement, and one to Grapte.

verses.text: Thou shalt therefore write two little books, and shalt send one to Clement, and one to Grapte.

sinaiticus.text: So Clement shall send to the foreign cities, for this is his duty;

verses.text: So Clement shall send to the foreign cities, for this is his duty;

sinaiticus.text: while Grapte shall instruct the widows and the orphans.494

verses.text: while Grapte shall instruct the widows and the orphans.494

sinaiticus.text: VISION THREE.

verses.text: VISION THREE.

sinaiticus.text: fasting often, and entreating the Lord to declare unto me the revelation which He promised to show me by the mouth of the aged woman,

verses.text: fasting often, and entreating the Lord to declare unto me the revelation which He promised to show me by the mouth of the aged woman,

sinaiticus.text: that very night the aged woman was seen of me,

verses.text: that very night the aged woman was seen of me,

sinaiticus.text: and she said to me, Seeing that thou art so importunate and eager to know all things, come into the country where thou abidest,

verses.text: and she said to me, Seeing that thou art so importunate and eager to know all things, come into the country where thou abidest,

sinaiticus.text: and about the fifth hour I will appear, and will show thee what thou oughtest to see.

verses.text: and about the fifth hour I will appear, and will show thee what thou oughtest to see.

sinaiticus.text: I asked her, saying, Lady, to what part of the country ?

verses.text: I asked her, saying, Lady, to what part of the country ?

sinaiticus.text: Where thou wilt, saith she.

verses.text: Where thou wilt, saith she.

sinaiticus.text: I selected a beautiful and retired spot;

verses.text: I selected a beautiful and retired spot;

sinaiticus.text: but before I spoke to her and named the spot, she saith to me, I will come, whither thou willest.

verses.text: but before I spoke to her and named the spot, she saith to me, I will come, whither thou willest.

sinaiticus.text: I went then, brethren, into the country, and I counted up the hours, and came to the place where I appointed her to come,

verses.text: I went then, brethren, into the country, and I counted up the hours, and came to the place where I appointed her to come,

sinaiticus.text: and I see an ivory couch placed there, and on the couch there lay a linen cushion, and on the cushion was spread a coverlet of fine linen of flax.

verses.text: and I see an ivory couch placed there, and on the couch there lay a linen cushion, and on the cushion was spread a coverlet of fine linen of flax.

sinaiticus.text: When I saw these things so ordered, and no one in the place,

verses.text: When I saw these things so ordered, and no one in the place,

sinaiticus.text: I was amazed, and a fit of trembling seized me, and my hair stood on end and a fit of shuddering came upon me, because I was alone.

verses.text: I was amazed, and a fit of trembling seized me, and my hair stood on end and a fit of shuddering came upon me, because I was alone.

sinaiticus.text: When then I recovered myself, and remembered the glory of God, and took courage, I knelt down and confessed my sins to the Lord once more, as I had done on the former occasion.

verses.text: When then I recovered myself, and remembered the glory of God, and took courage, I knelt down and confessed my sins to the Lord once more, as I had done on the former occasion.

sinaiticus.text: Then she came with six young men, the same whom I had seen before, and she stood by me, and listened attentively to me, as I prayed and confessed my sins to the Lord.

verses.text: Then she came with six young men, the same whom I had seen before, and she stood by me, and listened attentively to me, as I prayed and confessed my sins to the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And she touched me, and said:

verses.text: And she touched me, and said:

sinaiticus.text: Hermas, make an end of constantly entreating for thy sins;

verses.text: Hermas, make an end of constantly entreating for thy sins;

sinaiticus.text: entreat also for righteousness, that thou mayest take some part forthwith to thy family.

verses.text: entreat also for righteousness, that thou mayest take some part forthwith to thy family.

sinaiticus.text: Then she raiseth me by the hand, and leadeth me to the couch, and saith to the young men, Go ye, and build.

verses.text: Then she raiseth me by the hand, and leadeth me to the couch, and saith to the young men, Go ye, and build.

sinaiticus.text: And after the young men had retired and we were left alone, she saith to me, Sit down here.

verses.text: And after the young men had retired and we were left alone, she saith to me, Sit down here.

sinaiticus.text: Do as I bid thee, saith she, sit down.

verses.text: Do as I bid thee, saith she, sit down.

sinaiticus.text: When then I wanted to sit down on the right side, she would not allow me, but beckoned me with her hand that I should sit on the left side.

verses.text: When then I wanted to sit down on the right side, she would not allow me, but beckoned me with her hand that I should sit on the left side.

sinaiticus.text: As then I was musing thereon, and was sad because she would not permit me to sit on the right side, she saith to me, Art thou sad, Hermas?

verses.text: As then I was musing thereon, and was sad because she would not permit me to sit on the right side, she saith to me, Art thou sad, Hermas?

sinaiticus.text: The place on the right side is for others, even for those who have already been well-pleasing to God, and have suffered for the Names sake.

verses.text: The place on the right side is for others, even for those who have already been well-pleasing to God, and have suffered for the Names sake.

sinaiticus.text: But thou lackest much that thou shouldest sit with them;

verses.text: But thou lackest much that thou shouldest sit with them;

sinaiticus.text: but as thou abidest in thy simplicity, even so continue, and thou shalt sit with them, thou and as many as shall have done their deeds, and have suffered what they suffered.

verses.text: but as thou abidest in thy simplicity, even so continue, and thou shalt sit with them, thou and as many as shall have done their deeds, and have suffered what they suffered.

sinaiticus.text: What did they suffer?

verses.text: What did they suffer?

sinaiticus.text: say I.

verses.text: say I.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith she.

verses.text: Listen, saith she.

sinaiticus.text: Stripes, imprisonments, great tribulations, crosses, wild beasts, for the Names sake.

verses.text: Stripes, imprisonments, great tribulations, crosses, wild beasts, for the Names sake.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore to them belongs the right side of the Holiness-to them, and to all who shall suffer for the Name.

verses.text: Therefore to them belongs the right side of the Holiness-to them, and to all who shall suffer for the Name.

sinaiticus.text: But for the rest is the left side.

verses.text: But for the rest is the left side.

sinaiticus.text: Howbeit, to both, to them that sit on the right, and to them that sit on the left, are the same gifts, and the same promises, only they sit on the right and have a certain glory.

verses.text: Howbeit, to both, to them that sit on the right, and to them that sit on the left, are the same gifts, and the same promises, only they sit on the right and have a certain glory.

sinaiticus.text: Thou indeed art very desirous to sit on the right with them, but thy shortcomings are many;

verses.text: Thou indeed art very desirous to sit on the right with them, but thy shortcomings are many;

sinaiticus.text: yet thou shalt be purified from thy shortcomings;

verses.text: yet thou shalt be purified from thy shortcomings;

sinaiticus.text: When she had said this, she wished to depart;

verses.text: When she had said this, she wished to depart;

sinaiticus.text: but, falling at vision which she promised.

verses.text: but, falling at vision which she promised.

sinaiticus.text: Then she again took me by the hand, and raiseth me, and seateth me on the couch at the left hand, while she herself sat on the right.

verses.text: Then she again took me by the hand, and raiseth me, and seateth me on the couch at the left hand, while she herself sat on the right.

sinaiticus.text: And lifting up a certain glistening rod, she saith to me, Seest thou a great thing?

verses.text: And lifting up a certain glistening rod, she saith to me, Seest thou a great thing?

sinaiticus.text: I say to her, Lady, I see nothing.

verses.text: I say to her, Lady, I see nothing.

sinaiticus.text: She saith to me, Look thou;

verses.text: She saith to me, Look thou;

sinaiticus.text: dost thou not see in front of thee a great tower being builded upon the waters, of glistening square stones?496

verses.text: dost thou not see in front of thee a great tower being builded upon the waters, of glistening square stones?496

sinaiticus.text: Now the tower was being builded foursquare by the six young men that came with her.

verses.text: Now the tower was being builded foursquare by the six young men that came with her.

sinaiticus.text: And countless other men were bringing stones, some of them from the deep, and others from the land, and were handing them to the six young men.

verses.text: And countless other men were bringing stones, some of them from the deep, and others from the land, and were handing them to the six young men.

sinaiticus.text: And they took them and builded.

verses.text: And they took them and builded.

sinaiticus.text: The stones that were dragged from the deep they placed in every case,

verses.text: The stones that were dragged from the deep they placed in every case,

sinaiticus.text: just as they were, into the building, for they had been shaped, and they fitted in their joining with the other stones;

verses.text: just as they were, into the building, for they had been shaped, and they fitted in their joining with the other stones;

sinaiticus.text: and they adhered so closely one with another that their joining could not possibly be detected;

verses.text: and they adhered so closely one with another that their joining could not possibly be detected;

sinaiticus.text: and the building of the tower appeared as if it were built of one stone.

verses.text: and the building of the tower appeared as if it were built of one stone.

sinaiticus.text: But of the other stones which were brought from the dry land, some they threw away, and some they put into the building;

verses.text: But of the other stones which were brought from the dry land, some they threw away, and some they put into the building;

sinaiticus.text: and others they broke in pieces, and threw to a distance from the tower.

verses.text: and others they broke in pieces, and threw to a distance from the tower.

sinaiticus.text: Now many other stones were lying round the tower, and they did not use them for the building;

verses.text: Now many other stones were lying round the tower, and they did not use them for the building;

sinaiticus.text: for some of them were mildewed, and others had cracks ill them, and others were too short, and others were white and round, and did not fit into the building.

verses.text: for some of them were mildewed, and others had cracks ill them, and others were too short, and others were white and round, and did not fit into the building.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw other stones thrown to a distance from the tower, and coming to the way, and yet not staying in the way, but rolling to where there was no way;

verses.text: And I saw other stones thrown to a distance from the tower, and coming to the way, and yet not staying in the way, but rolling to where there was no way;

sinaiticus.text: and others falling into the fire and burning there;

verses.text: and others falling into the fire and burning there;

sinaiticus.text: When she had shown me these things, she wished to hurry these things, and yet not to know what the things mean?

verses.text: When she had shown me these things, she wished to hurry these things, and yet not to know what the things mean?

sinaiticus.text: She answered and said unto me, Thou art an over-curious fellow, in desiring to know all that concerns the tower.

verses.text: She answered and said unto me, Thou art an over-curious fellow, in desiring to know all that concerns the tower.

sinaiticus.text: Yea, lady, I said, that I may announce it to any brethren, and that they [may be the more gladdened and] when they hear [these things] may know the Lord in great glory.

verses.text: Yea, lady, I said, that I may announce it to any brethren, and that they [may be the more gladdened and] when they hear [these things] may know the Lord in great glory.

sinaiticus.text: Then said she, Many shall hear;

verses.text: Then said she, Many shall hear;

sinaiticus.text: but when they hear, some of them shall be glad, and others shall weep.

verses.text: but when they hear, some of them shall be glad, and others shall weep.

sinaiticus.text: Yet even these latter, if they hear and repent, shall likewise be glad.

verses.text: Yet even these latter, if they hear and repent, shall likewise be glad.

sinaiticus.text: Hear thou therefore the parables of the tower;

verses.text: Hear thou therefore the parables of the tower;

sinaiticus.text: for I will reveal all things unto thee.

verses.text: for I will reveal all things unto thee.

sinaiticus.text: for these revelations have an end, seeing that they have been completed.

verses.text: for these revelations have an end, seeing that they have been completed.

sinaiticus.text: Nevertheless thou wilt not cease asking for revelations;

verses.text: Nevertheless thou wilt not cease asking for revelations;

sinaiticus.text: for thou art shameless.

verses.text: for thou art shameless.

sinaiticus.text: The tower, which thou seest building, is myself, the Church, which was seen of thee both now and aforetime.

verses.text: The tower, which thou seest building, is myself, the Church, which was seen of thee both now and aforetime.

sinaiticus.text: Ask, therefore, what thou willest concerning the tower, and I will reveal it unto thee, that thou mayest rejoice with the saints.

verses.text: Ask, therefore, what thou willest concerning the tower, and I will reveal it unto thee, that thou mayest rejoice with the saints.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto her, Lady, since thou didst hold me worthy once for all, that thou shouldest reveal all things to me, reveal them.

verses.text: I say unto her, Lady, since thou didst hold me worthy once for all, that thou shouldest reveal all things to me, reveal them.

sinaiticus.text: Then she saith to me, Whatsoever is possible to be revealed to thee, shall be revealed.

verses.text: Then she saith to me, Whatsoever is possible to be revealed to thee, shall be revealed.

sinaiticus.text: Only let thy heart be with God, and doubt not in thy mind about that which thou seest.

verses.text: Only let thy heart be with God, and doubt not in thy mind about that which thou seest.

sinaiticus.text: I asked her, Wherefore is the tower builded upon waters, lady?

verses.text: I asked her, Wherefore is the tower builded upon waters, lady?

sinaiticus.text: I told thee so before, said she, and indeed thou dost enquire diligently.

verses.text: I told thee so before, said she, and indeed thou dost enquire diligently.

sinaiticus.text: So by thy enquiry thou discoverest the truth.

verses.text: So by thy enquiry thou discoverest the truth.

sinaiticus.text: Hear then why the tower is builded upon waters;

verses.text: Hear then why the tower is builded upon waters;

sinaiticus.text: it is because your life is saved and shall be saved by water.

verses.text: it is because your life is saved and shall be saved by water.

sinaiticus.text: I answered and said unto her,

verses.text: I answered and said unto her,

sinaiticus.text: Lady, this thing is great and These are the holy angels of GOD, that were created first of all, unto whom the Lord delivered all His creation to increase and to build it, and to be masters of all creation.

verses.text: Lady, this thing is great and These are the holy angels of GOD, that were created first of all, unto whom the Lord delivered all His creation to increase and to build it, and to be masters of all creation.

sinaiticus.text: By their hands therefore the building of the tower will be accomplished.

verses.text: By their hands therefore the building of the tower will be accomplished.

sinaiticus.text: And who are the others who are bringing the stones?

verses.text: And who are the others who are bringing the stones?

sinaiticus.text: They also are holy angels of God;

verses.text: They also are holy angels of God;

sinaiticus.text: but these six are superior to them.

verses.text: but these six are superior to them.

sinaiticus.text: The building of the tower then shall be accomplished, and all alike shall rejoice in the (completed) circle of the tower, and shall glorify God that the building of the tower was accomplished.

verses.text: The building of the tower then shall be accomplished, and all alike shall rejoice in the (completed) circle of the tower, and shall glorify God that the building of the tower was accomplished.

sinaiticus.text: I enquired of her, saying, Lady, I could wish to know concerning the end of the stones, and their power, of what kind it is.

verses.text: I enquired of her, saying, Lady, I could wish to know concerning the end of the stones, and their power, of what kind it is.

sinaiticus.text: She answered and said unto me, It is not that thou of all men art especially worthy that it should be revealed to thee;

verses.text: She answered and said unto me, It is not that thou of all men art especially worthy that it should be revealed to thee;

sinaiticus.text: for there are others before thee, and better than thou art, unto whom these visions ought to have been revealed.498

verses.text: for there are others before thee, and better than thou art, unto whom these visions ought to have been revealed.498

sinaiticus.text: But that the name of God may be glorified,

verses.text: But that the name of God may be glorified,

sinaiticus.text: it hath been revealed to thee, and shall be revealed, for the sake of the doubtful-minded, who question in their hearts whether these things are so or not.

verses.text: it hath been revealed to thee, and shall be revealed, for the sake of the doubtful-minded, who question in their hearts whether these things are so or not.

sinaiticus.text: Tell them that all these things are true, and that there is nothing beside the truth, but that all are stedfast, and valid, and established on a firm foundation.

verses.text: Tell them that all these things are true, and that there is nothing beside the truth, but that all are stedfast, and valid, and established on a firm foundation.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now concerning the stones that go to the building.

verses.text: Hear now concerning the stones that go to the building.

sinaiticus.text: The stones that are squared and white, and that fit together in their joints,

verses.text: The stones that are squared and white, and that fit together in their joints,

sinaiticus.text: these are the apostles and bishops and teachers and deacons,

verses.text: these are the apostles and bishops and teachers and deacons,

sinaiticus.text: who walked after the holiness of God,

verses.text: who walked after the holiness of God,

sinaiticus.text: and exercised their office of bishop and teacher and deacon in purity and sanctity for the elect of God, some of them already fallen on sleep, and others still living.

verses.text: and exercised their office of bishop and teacher and deacon in purity and sanctity for the elect of God, some of them already fallen on sleep, and others still living.

sinaiticus.text: And because they always agreed with one another, they both had peace among themselves and listened one to another.

verses.text: And because they always agreed with one another, they both had peace among themselves and listened one to another.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore their joinings fit together in the building of the tower.

verses.text: Therefore their joinings fit together in the building of the tower.

sinaiticus.text: But they that are dragged from the deep, and placed in the building, and that fit together in their joinings with the other stones that are already builded in, who are they?

verses.text: But they that are dragged from the deep, and placed in the building, and that fit together in their joinings with the other stones that are already builded in, who are they?

sinaiticus.text: These are they that suffered for the name of the Lord.

verses.text: These are they that suffered for the name of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: But the other stones that are brought from the dry land, I would fain know who these are, lady.

verses.text: But the other stones that are brought from the dry land, I would fain know who these are, lady.

sinaiticus.text: She said, Those that go to the building, and yet are not hewn, these the Lord hath approved because they walked in the uprightness of the Lord, and rightly performed His commandments.

verses.text: She said, Those that go to the building, and yet are not hewn, these the Lord hath approved because they walked in the uprightness of the Lord, and rightly performed His commandments.

sinaiticus.text: But they that are brought and placed in the building, who are they?

verses.text: But they that are brought and placed in the building, who are they?

sinaiticus.text: They are young in the faith, and faithful;

verses.text: They are young in the faith, and faithful;

sinaiticus.text: but they are warned by the angels to do good, because wickedness was found in them.

verses.text: but they are warned by the angels to do good, because wickedness was found in them.

sinaiticus.text: But those whom they rejected and threw away, who are they?

verses.text: But those whom they rejected and threw away, who are they?

sinaiticus.text: These have sinned, and desire to repent, therefore they were not cast to a great distance from the tower, because they will be useful for the building, if they repent.

verses.text: These have sinned, and desire to repent, therefore they were not cast to a great distance from the tower, because they will be useful for the building, if they repent.

sinaiticus.text: They then that shall repent, if they repent, will be strong in the faith, if they repent now while the tower is building.

verses.text: They then that shall repent, if they repent, will be strong in the faith, if they repent now while the tower is building.

sinaiticus.text: But if the building shall be finished, they have no more any place,

verses.text: But if the building shall be finished, they have no more any place,

sinaiticus.text: But wouldst thou know about them that are broken in pieces, and cast away far from the tower?

verses.text: But wouldst thou know about them that are broken in pieces, and cast away far from the tower?

sinaiticus.text: These are the sons of wickedness was absent from them.

verses.text: These are the sons of wickedness was absent from them.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore they have not salvation, for they are not useful for building by reason of their wickednesses.

verses.text: Therefore they have not salvation, for they are not useful for building by reason of their wickednesses.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore they were broken up and thrown far away by reason of the wrath of the Lord, for they excited Him to wrath.

verses.text: Therefore they were broken up and thrown far away by reason of the wrath of the Lord, for they excited Him to wrath.

sinaiticus.text: But the rest whom thou hast seen lying in great numbers, not going to the building, of these they that are mildewed are they that knew the truth, but did not abide in it, nor cleave to the saints.

verses.text: But the rest whom thou hast seen lying in great numbers, not going to the building, of these they that are mildewed are they that knew the truth, but did not abide in it, nor cleave to the saints.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have the cracks, who are they?

verses.text: But they that have the cracks, who are they?

sinaiticus.text: These are they at peace among themselves;

verses.text: These are they at peace among themselves;

sinaiticus.text: who have an appearance of peace, but when they depart from one another, their wickednesses abide in their hearts.

verses.text: who have an appearance of peace, but when they depart from one another, their wickednesses abide in their hearts.

sinaiticus.text: These are the cracks which the stones have.

verses.text: These are the cracks which the stones have.

sinaiticus.text: But they that are broken off short, these have believed, and have their greater part in righteousness, but have some parts of lawlessness;

verses.text: But they that are broken off short, these have believed, and have their greater part in righteousness, but have some parts of lawlessness;

sinaiticus.text: But the white and round stones, which did not fit into the building, who are they, lady?

verses.text: But the white and round stones, which did not fit into the building, who are they, lady?

sinaiticus.text: She answered and said to me, How understandest nothing?

verses.text: She answered and said to me, How understandest nothing?

sinaiticus.text: These are they that have faith, but have also riches of this world.

verses.text: These are they that have faith, but have also riches of this world.

sinaiticus.text: When tribulation cometh, they deny their Lord by reason of their riches and their business affairs.

verses.text: When tribulation cometh, they deny their Lord by reason of their riches and their business affairs.

sinaiticus.text: And I answered and said unto her, When then, lady, will they be useful for the building ?

verses.text: And I answered and said unto her, When then, lady, will they be useful for the building ?

sinaiticus.text: When, she replied, their wealth, which leadeth their souls astray, shall be cut away, then will they be useful for God.

verses.text: When, she replied, their wealth, which leadeth their souls astray, shall be cut away, then will they be useful for God.

sinaiticus.text: For just as the round stone, unless it be cut away, and lose some portion of itself, cannot become square,

verses.text: For just as the round stone, unless it be cut away, and lose some portion of itself, cannot become square,

sinaiticus.text: so also they that are rich in this world, unless their riches be cut away, cannot become useful to the lord.

verses.text: so also they that are rich in this world, unless their riches be cut away, cannot become useful to the lord.

sinaiticus.text: Learn first from thyself.

verses.text: Learn first from thyself.

sinaiticus.text: When thou hadst riches, thou wast useless;

verses.text: When thou hadst riches, thou wast useless;

sinaiticus.text: but now thou art useful and profitable unto life.

verses.text: but now thou art useful and profitable unto life.

sinaiticus.text: But the other stones which thou sawest cast far away from the tower and falling into the way and rolling out of the way into believed,

verses.text: But the other stones which thou sawest cast far away from the tower and falling into the way and rolling out of the way into believed,

sinaiticus.text: but by reason of their double heart they abandon their true way.

verses.text: but by reason of their double heart they abandon their true way.

sinaiticus.text: Thus thinking that they can find a better way, they go astray and are sore distressed, as they walk about in the regions where there is no way.

verses.text: Thus thinking that they can find a better way, they go astray and are sore distressed, as they walk about in the regions where there is no way.

sinaiticus.text: But they that fall into the fire and are burned,

verses.text: But they that fall into the fire and are burned,

sinaiticus.text: these are they that finally rebelled from the living God,

verses.text: these are they that finally rebelled from the living God,

sinaiticus.text: and it no more entered into their hearts to repent by reason of the lusts of their wantonness and of the wickednesses which they wrought.

verses.text: and it no more entered into their hearts to repent by reason of the lusts of their wantonness and of the wickednesses which they wrought.

sinaiticus.text: But the others, which fall near the waters and yet cannot roll into the water, wouldest thou know who are they?

verses.text: But the others, which fall near the waters and yet cannot roll into the water, wouldest thou know who are they?

sinaiticus.text: These are they that heard the word, and would be baptized unto the name of the Lord.

verses.text: These are they that heard the word, and would be baptized unto the name of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Then, when they call to their remembrance the purity of the truth, they change their minds, and go back again after their evil desires.

verses.text: Then, when they call to their remembrance the purity of the truth, they change their minds, and go back again after their evil desires.

sinaiticus.text: So she finished the explanation of the tower.

verses.text: So she finished the explanation of the tower.

sinaiticus.text: Still importunate, I asked her further, whether for all these stones that were rejected and would not fit into the building of the tower there was repentance, and they had a place in this tower.

verses.text: Still importunate, I asked her further, whether for all these stones that were rejected and would not fit into the building of the tower there was repentance, and they had a place in this tower.

sinaiticus.text: They can repent, she said, but they cannot be fitted into this tower.

verses.text: They can repent, she said, but they cannot be fitted into this tower.

sinaiticus.text: Yet they shall be fitted into another place much more humble, but not until they have undergone torments, and have fulfilled the days of their sins.

verses.text: Yet they shall be fitted into another place much more humble, but not until they have undergone torments, and have fulfilled the days of their sins.

sinaiticus.text: And they shall be changed for this reason, because they participated it, the Righteous Word;

verses.text: And they shall be changed for this reason, because they participated it, the Righteous Word;

sinaiticus.text: and then shall it befall them to be relieved from their torments, if the evil deeds, that they have done, come into their heart;

verses.text: and then shall it befall them to be relieved from their torments, if the evil deeds, that they have done, come into their heart;

sinaiticus.text: When then I ceased asking her concerning all these things, desirous of beholding, I was greatly rejoiced that I should see it.

verses.text: When then I ceased asking her concerning all these things, desirous of beholding, I was greatly rejoiced that I should see it.

sinaiticus.text: She looked upon me, and smiled, and she saith to me, Seest thou seven women round the tower?

verses.text: She looked upon me, and smiled, and she saith to me, Seest thou seven women round the tower?

sinaiticus.text: I see them, lady, say I.

verses.text: I see them, lady, say I.

sinaiticus.text: This tower is supported by them by commandment of the Lord.

verses.text: This tower is supported by them by commandment of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now their employments.

verses.text: Hear now their employments.

sinaiticus.text: The first of them, the woman with the strong hands, is called Faith;

verses.text: The first of them, the woman with the strong hands, is called Faith;

sinaiticus.text: through her are saved the elect of God.

verses.text: through her are saved the elect of God.

sinaiticus.text: And the second, that is girded about and looketh like a man, is

verses.text: And the second, that is girded about and looketh like a man, is

sinaiticus.text: she is the daughter of Faith.

verses.text: she is the daughter of Faith.

sinaiticus.text: Whosoever then shall follow her, becometh happy in his life, for he shall refrain from all evil deeds, believing that, if he refrain from every evil desire, he shall inherit eternal life.

verses.text: Whosoever then shall follow her, becometh happy in his life, for he shall refrain from all evil deeds, believing that, if he refrain from every evil desire, he shall inherit eternal life.

sinaiticus.text: And the others, lady, who be they?

verses.text: And the others, lady, who be they?

sinaiticus.text: They are daughters one of the other.

verses.text: They are daughters one of the other.

sinaiticus.text: The name of the one is Simplicity, of the next, knowledge, of the next, Guilelessness, of the next, Reverence, of the next, Love.

verses.text: The name of the one is Simplicity, of the next, knowledge, of the next, Guilelessness, of the next, Reverence, of the next, Love.

sinaiticus.text: When then thou shalt do all the works of their mother, thou canst live.

verses.text: When then thou shalt do all the works of their mother, thou canst live.

sinaiticus.text: I would fain know, lady, I say, what power each of them possesseth.

verses.text: I would fain know, lady, I say, what power each of them possesseth.

sinaiticus.text: Listen then, saith she, to the powers which they have.

verses.text: Listen then, saith she, to the powers which they have.

sinaiticus.text: Their powers are mastered each by the other, and they follow each other, in the order in which they were born.

verses.text: Their powers are mastered each by the other, and they follow each other, in the order in which they were born.

sinaiticus.text: From Faith is born Continence, from Continence Simplicity, from Simplicity Guilelessness, from Guilelessness Reverence, from Reverence knowledge, from knowledge Love.

verses.text: From Faith is born Continence, from Continence Simplicity, from Simplicity Guilelessness, from Guilelessness Reverence, from Reverence knowledge, from knowledge Love.

sinaiticus.text: Their works then are pure and reverent and divine.

verses.text: Their works then are pure and reverent and divine.

sinaiticus.text: Whosoever therefore shall serve these women, and shall have strength to master their works, shall have his dwelling in the tower with the saints of God.

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall serve these women, and shall have strength to master their works, shall have his dwelling in the tower with the saints of God.

sinaiticus.text: Then I asked her concerning the seasons, whether the consummation is even now.

verses.text: Then I asked her concerning the seasons, whether the consummation is even now.

sinaiticus.text: But she cried aloud, saying, Foolish man, seest thou not that the tower is still a-building?

verses.text: But she cried aloud, saying, Foolish man, seest thou not that the tower is still a-building?

sinaiticus.text: Whensoever therefore the tower shall be finished building, the end cometh;

verses.text: Whensoever therefore the tower shall be finished building, the end cometh;

sinaiticus.text: but it shall be built up quickly.

verses.text: but it shall be built up quickly.

sinaiticus.text: Ask me no more questions:

verses.text: Ask me no more questions:

sinaiticus.text: this reminder is sufficient for you and for the saints, and is the renewal of your spirits.

verses.text: this reminder is sufficient for you and for the saints, and is the renewal of your spirits.

sinaiticus.text: But it was not revealed to thyself alone, but in order that thou mightest show these things unto all.

verses.text: But it was not revealed to thyself alone, but in order that thou mightest show these things unto all.

sinaiticus.text: After three days-for thou must understand first,

verses.text: After three days-for thou must understand first,

sinaiticus.text: and I charge thee, Hermas, first with these words, which I am about to speak to thee-(I charge thee to) tell all these things into the ears of the saints,

verses.text: and I charge thee, Hermas, first with these words, which I am about to speak to thee-(I charge thee to) tell all these things into the ears of the saints,

sinaiticus.text: that hearing them and doing them they may be purified from their wickednesses, and thyself also with them.

verses.text: that hearing them and doing them they may be purified from their wickednesses, and thyself also with them.

sinaiticus.text: Hear me, my children.502

verses.text: Hear me, my children.502

sinaiticus.text: I brought you up in much simplicity and guilelessness and reverence,

verses.text: I brought you up in much simplicity and guilelessness and reverence,

sinaiticus.text: through the mercy of the Lord, Who instilled righteousness into you, that ye might be justified and sanctified from all wickedness and all crookedness.

verses.text: through the mercy of the Lord, Who instilled righteousness into you, that ye might be justified and sanctified from all wickedness and all crookedness.

sinaiticus.text: But ye will not to cease from your wickedness.

verses.text: But ye will not to cease from your wickedness.

sinaiticus.text: Now then hear me and be at peace among your, selves, and have regard one to another, and assist one another,

verses.text: Now then hear me and be at peace among your, selves, and have regard one to another, and assist one another,

sinaiticus.text: and do not partake of the creatures of God alone in abundance, but share them also with those that are in want.

verses.text: and do not partake of the creatures of God alone in abundance, but share them also with those that are in want.

sinaiticus.text: For some men through their much eating bring weakness on the flesh, and injure their flesh:

verses.text: For some men through their much eating bring weakness on the flesh, and injure their flesh:

sinaiticus.text: whereas the flesh of those who have nought to eat is injured by their not having sufficient nourishment, and their body is ruined.

verses.text: whereas the flesh of those who have nought to eat is injured by their not having sufficient nourishment, and their body is ruined.

sinaiticus.text: This exclusiveness therefore is hurtful to you that have and do not share with them that are in want.

verses.text: This exclusiveness therefore is hurtful to you that have and do not share with them that are in want.

sinaiticus.text: Look ye to the judgment that cometh.

verses.text: Look ye to the judgment that cometh.

sinaiticus.text: Ye then that have more than enough, seek out them that are hungry, while the tower is still unfinished;

verses.text: Ye then that have more than enough, seek out them that are hungry, while the tower is still unfinished;

sinaiticus.text: for after the tower is finished, ye will desire to do good, and will find no place for it.

verses.text: for after the tower is finished, ye will desire to do good, and will find no place for it.

sinaiticus.text: Look ye therefore, ye that exult in your wealth,

verses.text: Look ye therefore, ye that exult in your wealth,

sinaiticus.text: lest they that are in want shall moan, and their moaning shall go up unto the Lord, and ye with your [abundance of) good things be shut outside the door of the tower.

verses.text: lest they that are in want shall moan, and their moaning shall go up unto the Lord, and ye with your [abundance of) good things be shut outside the door of the tower.

sinaiticus.text: Now therefore I say unto you that are rulers of the Church, and that occupy the chief seats;

verses.text: Now therefore I say unto you that are rulers of the Church, and that occupy the chief seats;

sinaiticus.text: be not ye like unto the sorcerers.

verses.text: be not ye like unto the sorcerers.

sinaiticus.text: The sorcerers indeed carry their drugs in boxes,

verses.text: The sorcerers indeed carry their drugs in boxes,

sinaiticus.text: but ye carry your drug and your poison in your heart Ye are case- hardened,

verses.text: but ye carry your drug and your poison in your heart Ye are case- hardened,

sinaiticus.text: and ye will not cleanse your hearts and mix your wisdom together in a clean heart, that ye may obtain mercy from the Great King.

verses.text: and ye will not cleanse your hearts and mix your wisdom together in a clean heart, that ye may obtain mercy from the Great King.

sinaiticus.text: Look ye therefore, children, lest these divisions of yours deprive you of your life.

verses.text: Look ye therefore, children, lest these divisions of yours deprive you of your life.

sinaiticus.text: How is it that ye wish to instruct the elect of the Lord, while ye yourselves have no instruction?

verses.text: How is it that ye wish to instruct the elect of the Lord, while ye yourselves have no instruction?

sinaiticus.text: Instruct one another therefore, and have peace among yourselves, that I also may stand gladsome before the Father, and give an account concerning you all to your Lord.

verses.text: Instruct one another therefore, and have peace among yourselves, that I also may stand gladsome before the Father, and give an account concerning you all to your Lord.

sinaiticus.text: When then she ceased speaking with me, the six young men, who were building, came, and took her away to the tower, and other four lifted the couch, and took it also away to the tower.

verses.text: When then she ceased speaking with me, the six young men, who were building, came, and took her away to the tower, and other four lifted the couch, and took it also away to the tower.

sinaiticus.text: I saw not the face of these, for they were turned away.

verses.text: I saw not the face of these, for they were turned away.

sinaiticus.text: And, as she went, I asked her to reveal to me concerning the three forms, in which she had appeared to me.

verses.text: And, as she went, I asked her to reveal to me concerning the three forms, in which she had appeared to me.

sinaiticus.text: She answered and said to me;

verses.text: She answered and said to me;

sinaiticus.text: As concerning these things thou must ask another, that they may be revealed to thee.

verses.text: As concerning these things thou must ask another, that they may be revealed to thee.

sinaiticus.text: Now she was seen of me, brethren, in my first vision of last year, as a very aged woman and seated on a chair.

verses.text: Now she was seen of me, brethren, in my first vision of last year, as a very aged woman and seated on a chair.

sinaiticus.text: In the second vision her face was youthful, but her flesh and her hair were aged, and she spake to me standing;

verses.text: In the second vision her face was youthful, but her flesh and her hair were aged, and she spake to me standing;

sinaiticus.text: and she was more gladsome than before.

verses.text: and she was more gladsome than before.

sinaiticus.text: But in the third vision she was altogether youthful and of exceeding great beauty, and her hair alone was aged;

verses.text: But in the third vision she was altogether youthful and of exceeding great beauty, and her hair alone was aged;

sinaiticus.text: and she was gladsome exceedingly and seated on a couch.

verses.text: and she was gladsome exceedingly and seated on a couch.

sinaiticus.text: Touching these things I was very greatly anxious to learn this revelation.

verses.text: Touching these things I was very greatly anxious to learn this revelation.

sinaiticus.text: And I see the aged woman in a vision of the night, saying to me, Every enquiry needs humility.

verses.text: And I see the aged woman in a vision of the night, saying to me, Every enquiry needs humility.

sinaiticus.text: Fast therefore, and thou shalt receive what thou askest from the Lord.

verses.text: Fast therefore, and thou shalt receive what thou askest from the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: So I fasted one day;

verses.text: So I fasted one day;

sinaiticus.text: and that very night there appeared unto me a young man, and he saith to me, Seeing that thou askest me revelations offhand with entreaty, take heed lest by thy much asking thou injure thy flesh.

verses.text: and that very night there appeared unto me a young man, and he saith to me, Seeing that thou askest me revelations offhand with entreaty, take heed lest by thy much asking thou injure thy flesh.

sinaiticus.text: Sufficient for thee are these revelations.

verses.text: Sufficient for thee are these revelations.

sinaiticus.text: Canst thou see mightier revelations than those thou hast seen?

verses.text: Canst thou see mightier revelations than those thou hast seen?

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him in reply, Sir, this one thing alone I ask, concerning the three forms of the aged woman, that a complete revelation may be vouchsafed me.

verses.text: I say unto him in reply, Sir, this one thing alone I ask, concerning the three forms of the aged woman, that a complete revelation may be vouchsafed me.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me in answer, How long are ye without understanding?

verses.text: He saith to me in answer, How long are ye without understanding?

sinaiticus.text: It is your double-mindedness that maketh you of no understanding, and because your heart is not set towards the Lord.

verses.text: It is your double-mindedness that maketh you of no understanding, and because your heart is not set towards the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he, concerning the three forms, of which thou enquirest.

verses.text: Listen, saith he, concerning the three forms, of which thou enquirest.

sinaiticus.text: In the first vision wherefore did she appear to aged, and already decayed, and had no power by reason of your infirmities and acts of double-mindedness.504

verses.text: In the first vision wherefore did she appear to aged, and already decayed, and had no power by reason of your infirmities and acts of double-mindedness.504

sinaiticus.text: For as aged people, having no longer hope of renewing their youth, expect nothing else but to fall asleep,

verses.text: For as aged people, having no longer hope of renewing their youth, expect nothing else but to fall asleep,

sinaiticus.text: so ye also, being weakened with the affairs of this world, gave yourselves over to repining, and cast not your cares on the Lord;

verses.text: so ye also, being weakened with the affairs of this world, gave yourselves over to repining, and cast not your cares on the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: but your spirit was broken, and ye were aged by your sorrows.

verses.text: but your spirit was broken, and ye were aged by your sorrows.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore then she was seated on a chair, I would fain know, Sir.

verses.text: Wherefore then she was seated on a chair, I would fain know, Sir.

sinaiticus.text: Because every weak person sits on a chair by reason of his weakness, that the weakness of his body may be supported.

verses.text: Because every weak person sits on a chair by reason of his weakness, that the weakness of his body may be supported.

sinaiticus.text: But in the second vision thou sawest her standing, and with her countenance more youthful and more gladsome than before;

verses.text: But in the second vision thou sawest her standing, and with her countenance more youthful and more gladsome than before;

sinaiticus.text: saith he.

verses.text: saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Imagine an old man, who has now lost all hope of himself by reason of his weakness and his poverty, and expecteth nothing else save the last day of his life.

verses.text: Imagine an old man, who has now lost all hope of himself by reason of his weakness and his poverty, and expecteth nothing else save the last day of his life.

sinaiticus.text: Suddenly an inheritance is left him.

verses.text: Suddenly an inheritance is left him.

sinaiticus.text: He heareth the news, riseth up and full of joy clothes himself with strength, and no longer lieth down, but standeth up,

verses.text: He heareth the news, riseth up and full of joy clothes himself with strength, and no longer lieth down, but standeth up,

sinaiticus.text: and his spirit, which was now broken by reason of his former circumstances, is renewed again, and he no longer sitteth, but taketh courage;

verses.text: and his spirit, which was now broken by reason of his former circumstances, is renewed again, and he no longer sitteth, but taketh courage;

sinaiticus.text: so also was it with you, when ye heard the revelation which the Lord revealed unto you.

verses.text: so also was it with you, when ye heard the revelation which the Lord revealed unto you.

sinaiticus.text: For He had compassion on you, and renewed your spirits,

verses.text: For He had compassion on you, and renewed your spirits,

sinaiticus.text: and ye laid aside your maladies, and strength came to you, and ye were made powerful in the faith, and the Lord rejoiced to see you put on your strength.

verses.text: and ye laid aside your maladies, and strength came to you, and ye were made powerful in the faith, and the Lord rejoiced to see you put on your strength.

sinaiticus.text: And therefore He showed you the building of the tower;

verses.text: And therefore He showed you the building of the tower;

sinaiticus.text: But in the third vision ye saw her younger and fair and cometh some piece of good tidings,

verses.text: But in the third vision ye saw her younger and fair and cometh some piece of good tidings,

sinaiticus.text: immediately he forgetteth his former sorrows,

verses.text: immediately he forgetteth his former sorrows,

sinaiticus.text: and admitteth nothing but the tidings which he hath heard, and is strengthened thenceforth unto that which is good, and his spirit is renewed by reason of the joy which he hath received;

verses.text: and admitteth nothing but the tidings which he hath heard, and is strengthened thenceforth unto that which is good, and his spirit is renewed by reason of the joy which he hath received;

sinaiticus.text: so also ye have received a renewal of your spirits by seeing these good things.

verses.text: so also ye have received a renewal of your spirits by seeing these good things.

sinaiticus.text: And whereas thou sawest her seated on a couch, the position is a firm one;

verses.text: And whereas thou sawest her seated on a couch, the position is a firm one;

sinaiticus.text: for the couch has four feet and standeth firmly;

verses.text: for the couch has four feet and standeth firmly;

sinaiticus.text: They then that have fully repented shall be young again, and founded firmly, seeing that they have repented with their whole heart.

verses.text: They then that have fully repented shall be young again, and founded firmly, seeing that they have repented with their whole heart.

sinaiticus.text: There thou hast the revelation entire and complete.

verses.text: There thou hast the revelation entire and complete.

sinaiticus.text: VISION FOUR The fourth vision which I saw, brethren, twenty days after tribulation.

verses.text: VISION FOUR The fourth vision which I saw, brethren, twenty days after tribulation.

sinaiticus.text: I was going into the country by the Campanian Way.

verses.text: I was going into the country by the Campanian Way.

sinaiticus.text: From the high road, it is about ten stades;

verses.text: From the high road, it is about ten stades;

sinaiticus.text: and the place is easy for travelling.

verses.text: and the place is easy for travelling.

sinaiticus.text: While then I am walking alone,

verses.text: While then I am walking alone,

sinaiticus.text: I entreat the Lord that He will accomplish the revelations and the visions which He showed me through His holy Church,

verses.text: I entreat the Lord that He will accomplish the revelations and the visions which He showed me through His holy Church,

sinaiticus.text: that He may strengthen me and may give repentance to His servants which have stumbled,

verses.text: that He may strengthen me and may give repentance to His servants which have stumbled,

sinaiticus.text: that His great and glorious Name may be glorified, for that He held me worthy that He should show me His marvels.

verses.text: that His great and glorious Name may be glorified, for that He held me worthy that He should show me His marvels.

sinaiticus.text: And as I gave glory and thanksgiving to Him, there answered me as it were the sound of a voice, Be not of doubtful mind Hermas.

verses.text: And as I gave glory and thanksgiving to Him, there answered me as it were the sound of a voice, Be not of doubtful mind Hermas.

sinaiticus.text: I began to question in myself and to say, How can I be of doubtful mind, seeing that I am so firmly founded by the Lord, and have seen glorious things?
