verses.text: I began to question in myself and to say, How can I be of doubtful mind, seeing that I am so firmly founded by the Lord, and have seen glorious things?

sinaiticus.text: And I went on a little, brethren, and behold, I see a cloud of dust rising as it were to heaven, and I began t> say within myself, Can it be that cattle are coming, and raising a cloud of dust ?

verses.text: And I went on a little, brethren, and behold, I see a cloud of dust rising as it were to heaven, and I began t> say within myself, Can it be that cattle are coming, and raising a cloud of dust ?

sinaiticus.text: for it was just about a stade from me.

verses.text: for it was just about a stade from me.

sinaiticus.text: As the cloud of dust waxed greater and greater, I suspected that it was something supernatural.

verses.text: As the cloud of dust waxed greater and greater, I suspected that it was something supernatural.

sinaiticus.text: Then the sun shone out a little, and behold, I see a huge beast like some sea-monster, and from its mouth fiery locusts issued forth.

verses.text: Then the sun shone out a little, and behold, I see a huge beast like some sea-monster, and from its mouth fiery locusts issued forth.

sinaiticus.text: And the beast was about a hundred feet in length, and its head was as it were of pottery.

verses.text: And the beast was about a hundred feet in length, and its head was as it were of pottery.

sinaiticus.text: And I began to weep, and to entreat the Lord that He would rescue me from it.

verses.text: And I began to weep, and to entreat the Lord that He would rescue me from it.

sinaiticus.text: And I remembered the word which I had heard, Be not of doubtful mind, Hermas.

verses.text: And I remembered the word which I had heard, Be not of doubtful mind, Hermas.

sinaiticus.text: Having therefore, brethren, put on the faith of the Lord and called to mind the mighty works that He had taught me, I took courage and gave myself up to the beast.

verses.text: Having therefore, brethren, put on the faith of the Lord and called to mind the mighty works that He had taught me, I took courage and gave myself up to the beast.

sinaiticus.text: Now the beast was coming on with such a rush, that it might have ruined a city.506

verses.text: Now the beast was coming on with such a rush, that it might have ruined a city.506

sinaiticus.text: I come near it, and, huge monster as it was, it stretcheth itself on the ground, and merely put forth its tongue, and stirred not at all until I had passed by it.

verses.text: I come near it, and, huge monster as it was, it stretcheth itself on the ground, and merely put forth its tongue, and stirred not at all until I had passed by it.

sinaiticus.text: And the beast had on its head four colours;

verses.text: And the beast had on its head four colours;

sinaiticus.text: Now after I had passed the beast,

verses.text: Now after I had passed the beast,

sinaiticus.text: and had gone forward about thirty feet, behold, there meeteth me a virgin arrayed as if she sandals, veiled up to her forehead, and her head-covering consisted of a turban, and her hair was white.

verses.text: and had gone forward about thirty feet, behold, there meeteth me a virgin arrayed as if she sandals, veiled up to her forehead, and her head-covering consisted of a turban, and her hair was white.

sinaiticus.text: I knew from the former visions that it was the Church, and I became more cheerful.

verses.text: I knew from the former visions that it was the Church, and I became more cheerful.

sinaiticus.text: She saluteth me, saying, Good morrow, my good man;

verses.text: She saluteth me, saying, Good morrow, my good man;

sinaiticus.text: and I saluted her in turn, Lady, good morrow.

verses.text: and I saluted her in turn, Lady, good morrow.

sinaiticus.text: She answered and said unto me, Did nothing meet thee?

verses.text: She answered and said unto me, Did nothing meet thee?

sinaiticus.text: I say unto her, Lady, such a huge beast, that could have destroyed whole peoples :

verses.text: I say unto her, Lady, such a huge beast, that could have destroyed whole peoples :

sinaiticus.text: but, by the power of the Lord and by His great mercy, I escaped it.

verses.text: but, by the power of the Lord and by His great mercy, I escaped it.

sinaiticus.text: Thou didst escape it well, saith she,

verses.text: Thou didst escape it well, saith she,

sinaiticus.text: because thou didst cast thy care upon God, and didst open thy heart to the Lord, believing that thou canst be saved by nothing else but by His great and glorious Name.

verses.text: because thou didst cast thy care upon God, and didst open thy heart to the Lord, believing that thou canst be saved by nothing else but by His great and glorious Name.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the Lord sent His angel, which is over the beasts, whose name is Segri, and shut its mouth, that it might not hurt thee.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord sent His angel, which is over the beasts, whose name is Segri, and shut its mouth, that it might not hurt thee.

sinaiticus.text: Thou hast escaped a great tribulation by reason of thy faith, and because, though thou sawest so huge a beast, thou didst not doubt in thy mind.

verses.text: Thou hast escaped a great tribulation by reason of thy faith, and because, though thou sawest so huge a beast, thou didst not doubt in thy mind.

sinaiticus.text: Go therefore, and declare to the elect of the Lord His mighty works, and tell them that this beast is a type of the great tribulation which is to come.

verses.text: Go therefore, and declare to the elect of the Lord His mighty works, and tell them that this beast is a type of the great tribulation which is to come.

sinaiticus.text: If therefore ye prepare yourselves beforehand,

verses.text: If therefore ye prepare yourselves beforehand,

sinaiticus.text: and repent  unto the Lord with your whole heart, ye shall be able to escape it, if your heart be made pure and without blemish, and if for the remaining days of your life ye serve the Lord blamelessly.

verses.text: and repent  unto the Lord with your whole heart, ye shall be able to escape it, if your heart be made pure and without blemish, and if for the remaining days of your life ye serve the Lord blamelessly.

sinaiticus.text: Cast your cares upon the Lord and He will set them straight.

verses.text: Cast your cares upon the Lord and He will set them straight.

sinaiticus.text: Trust ye in the Lord, ye men of doubtful mind, for He can do all things, yea, He both turneth away His wrath from you, and again He sendeth forth His plagues upon you that are of doubtful mind.

verses.text: Trust ye in the Lord, ye men of doubtful mind, for He can do all things, yea, He both turneth away His wrath from you, and again He sendeth forth His plagues upon you that are of doubtful mind.

sinaiticus.text: Woe to them that hear these words and are disobedient;

verses.text: Woe to them that hear these words and are disobedient;

sinaiticus.text: I asked her concerning the four colours, which the beast had upon its head.

verses.text: I asked her concerning the four colours, which the beast had upon its head.

sinaiticus.text: Then she answered me and said, Again thou art me what these things are.

verses.text: Then she answered me and said, Again thou art me what these things are.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, said she;

verses.text: Listen, said she;

sinaiticus.text: the black is this world in which ye dwell;

verses.text: the black is this world in which ye dwell;

sinaiticus.text: and the fire and blood colour showeth that this world must perish by blood and fire;

verses.text: and the fire and blood colour showeth that this world must perish by blood and fire;

sinaiticus.text: and the golden part are ye that have escaped from this world.

verses.text: and the golden part are ye that have escaped from this world.

sinaiticus.text: For as the gold is tested by the fire and is made useful, so ye also [that dwell in it] are being tested in yourselves.

verses.text: For as the gold is tested by the fire and is made useful, so ye also [that dwell in it] are being tested in yourselves.

sinaiticus.text: Ye then that abide and pass through the fire will be purified by it.

verses.text: Ye then that abide and pass through the fire will be purified by it.

sinaiticus.text: For as the gold loses its dross, so ye also shall cast away all sorrow and tribulation, and shall be purified, and shall be useful for the building of the tower.

verses.text: For as the gold loses its dross, so ye also shall cast away all sorrow and tribulation, and shall be purified, and shall be useful for the building of the tower.

sinaiticus.text: But the white portion is the coming age, in which the elect of God shall dwell;

verses.text: But the white portion is the coming age, in which the elect of God shall dwell;

sinaiticus.text: because the elect of God shall be without spot and pure unto life eternal.

verses.text: because the elect of God shall be without spot and pure unto life eternal.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore cease not thou to speak in the ears of the saints.

verses.text: Wherefore cease not thou to speak in the ears of the saints.

sinaiticus.text: Ye have now the symbolism also of the tribulation which is coming in power.

verses.text: Ye have now the symbolism also of the tribulation which is coming in power.

sinaiticus.text: But if ye be willing, it shall be nought.

verses.text: But if ye be willing, it shall be nought.

sinaiticus.text: Remember ye the things that are written beforehand.

verses.text: Remember ye the things that are written beforehand.

sinaiticus.text: With these words she departed, and I saw not in what direction she departed;

verses.text: With these words she departed, and I saw not in what direction she departed;

sinaiticus.text: for a noise was made;

verses.text: for a noise was made;

sinaiticus.text: REVELATION FIVE.

verses.text: REVELATION FIVE.

sinaiticus.text: As I prayed in the house, and sat on the couch,

verses.text: As I prayed in the house, and sat on the couch,

sinaiticus.text: there entered a skin wrapped about him, and with a wallet on his shoulders and a staff in his hand.

verses.text: there entered a skin wrapped about him, and with a wallet on his shoulders and a staff in his hand.

sinaiticus.text: And he saluted me, and I saluted him in return.

verses.text: And he saluted me, and I saluted him in return.

sinaiticus.text: And he immediately sat down by my side, and he saith unto me, I was sent by the most holy angel, that I might dwell with thee the remaining days of thy life.

verses.text: And he immediately sat down by my side, and he saith unto me, I was sent by the most holy angel, that I might dwell with thee the remaining days of thy life.

sinaiticus.text: I thought he came to tempt me, and I say unto him, Why, who art thou?

verses.text: I thought he came to tempt me, and I say unto him, Why, who art thou?

sinaiticus.text: For I know, say I, unto whom I was delivered.

verses.text: For I know, say I, unto whom I was delivered.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me, Dost thou not recognise me?

verses.text: He saith to me, Dost thou not recognise me?

sinaiticus.text: No, I say.508

verses.text: No, I say.508

sinaiticus.text: I, saith he, am the shepherd, unto whom thou wast delivered.

verses.text: I, saith he, am the shepherd, unto whom thou wast delivered.

sinaiticus.text: While he was still speaking, his form was changed, and I recognised him as being the same, to whom I was delivered;

verses.text: While he was still speaking, his form was changed, and I recognised him as being the same, to whom I was delivered;

sinaiticus.text: and straightway I was confounded, and fear seized me, and I was altogether overwhelmed with distress that I had answered him so wickedly and senselessly.

verses.text: and straightway I was confounded, and fear seized me, and I was altogether overwhelmed with distress that I had answered him so wickedly and senselessly.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said unto me, Be not confounded, but strengthen thyself in my commandments which I am about to command thee.

verses.text: But he answered and said unto me, Be not confounded, but strengthen thyself in my commandments which I am about to command thee.

sinaiticus.text: For I was sent, saith he, that I might show thee again all the things which thou didst see before, merely the heads which are convenient for you.

verses.text: For I was sent, saith he, that I might show thee again all the things which thou didst see before, merely the heads which are convenient for you.

sinaiticus.text: First of all, write down my commandments and my parables;

verses.text: First of all, write down my commandments and my parables;

sinaiticus.text: and the other matters thou shalt write down as I shall show them to thee.

verses.text: and the other matters thou shalt write down as I shall show them to thee.

sinaiticus.text: The reason why, saith he, I command thee to write down first the commandments and parables is, that thou mayest read them off- hand, and mayest be able to keep them.

verses.text: The reason why, saith he, I command thee to write down first the commandments and parables is, that thou mayest read them off- hand, and mayest be able to keep them.

sinaiticus.text: So I wrote down the commandments and parables, as he commanded me.

verses.text: So I wrote down the commandments and parables, as he commanded me.

sinaiticus.text: If then, when ye hear them, ye keep them and walk in them, and do them with a pure heart, ye shall receive from the Lord all things that He promised you;

verses.text: If then, when ye hear them, ye keep them and walk in them, and do them with a pure heart, ye shall receive from the Lord all things that He promised you;

sinaiticus.text: but if, when ye hear them, ye do not repent, but still add to your sins, ye shall receive from the Lord the opposite.

verses.text: but if, when ye hear them, ye do not repent, but still add to your sins, ye shall receive from the Lord the opposite.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE FIRST.

verses.text: MANDATE THE FIRST.

sinaiticus.text: First of all, believe that God is One,

verses.text: First of all, believe that God is One,

sinaiticus.text: even He Who created all non-existence into being, Who comprehendeth all things, being alone incomprehensible.

verses.text: even He Who created all non-existence into being, Who comprehendeth all things, being alone incomprehensible.

sinaiticus.text: Believe Him therefore, and fear Him, and in this fear be continent.

verses.text: Believe Him therefore, and fear Him, and in this fear be continent.

sinaiticus.text: Keep these things,

verses.text: Keep these things,

sinaiticus.text: and thou shall cast off all wickedness from thyself, and shall clothe thyself with every excellence of righteousness, and shall live unto God, if thou keep this commandment.

verses.text: and thou shall cast off all wickedness from thyself, and shall clothe thyself with every excellence of righteousness, and shall live unto God, if thou keep this commandment.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE SECOND.

verses.text: MANDATE THE SECOND.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me;

verses.text: He saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Keep simplicity and be guileless, and thou shall be as little children,

verses.text: Keep simplicity and be guileless, and thou shall be as little children,

sinaiticus.text: First of all, speak evil of no man, neither take pleasure in listening to a slanderer.

verses.text: First of all, speak evil of no man, neither take pleasure in listening to a slanderer.

sinaiticus.text: Otherwise thou that hearest too shalt be responsible for the sin of him that speaketh the evil, if thou believest the slander, which thou hearest;

verses.text: Otherwise thou that hearest too shalt be responsible for the sin of him that speaketh the evil, if thou believest the slander, which thou hearest;

sinaiticus.text: for in believing it thou thyself also wilt have a grudge against thy brother.

verses.text: for in believing it thou thyself also wilt have a grudge against thy brother.

sinaiticus.text: So then shalt thou be responsible for the sin of him that speaketh the evil.

verses.text: So then shalt thou be responsible for the sin of him that speaketh the evil.

sinaiticus.text: Slander is evil;

verses.text: Slander is evil;

sinaiticus.text: it is a restless demon, never at peace, but always having its home among factions.

verses.text: it is a restless demon, never at peace, but always having its home among factions.

sinaiticus.text: Refrain from it therefore, and thou shalt have success at all times with all men.

verses.text: Refrain from it therefore, and thou shalt have success at all times with all men.

sinaiticus.text: But clothe thyself in reverence, wherein is no evil stumbling-block, but all things are smooth and gladsome.

verses.text: But clothe thyself in reverence, wherein is no evil stumbling-block, but all things are smooth and gladsome.

sinaiticus.text: Work that which is good,

verses.text: Work that which is good,

sinaiticus.text: and of thy labours, which God giveth thee, give to all that are in want freely, not questioning to whom thou shall give, and to whom thou shall not give.

verses.text: and of thy labours, which God giveth thee, give to all that are in want freely, not questioning to whom thou shall give, and to whom thou shall not give.

sinaiticus.text: Give to all;

verses.text: Give to all;

sinaiticus.text: for to all God desireth that there should be given of His own bounties.

verses.text: for to all God desireth that there should be given of His own bounties.

sinaiticus.text: They then that receive shall render an account to God why they received it, and to what end;

verses.text: They then that receive shall render an account to God why they received it, and to what end;

sinaiticus.text: for they that receive in distress shall not be judged, but they that receive by false pretence shall pay the penalty.

verses.text: for they that receive in distress shall not be judged, but they that receive by false pretence shall pay the penalty.

sinaiticus.text: He then that giveth is guiltless;

verses.text: He then that giveth is guiltless;

sinaiticus.text: for as he received from the Lord the ministration to perform it, he hath performed it in sincerity, by making no distinction to whom to give or not to give.

verses.text: for as he received from the Lord the ministration to perform it, he hath performed it in sincerity, by making no distinction to whom to give or not to give.

sinaiticus.text: This ministration then, when sincerely performed, becomes glorious in the sight of God.

verses.text: This ministration then, when sincerely performed, becomes glorious in the sight of God.

sinaiticus.text: He therefore that ministereth thus sincerely shall live unto God.

verses.text: He therefore that ministereth thus sincerely shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore keep this commandment, as I have told thee, that thine own repentance and that of thy household may be found to be sincere, and [thy] heart pure and undefiled.

verses.text: Therefore keep this commandment, as I have told thee, that thine own repentance and that of thy household may be found to be sincere, and [thy] heart pure and undefiled.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE THIRD.

verses.text: MANDATE THE THIRD.

sinaiticus.text: Again he saith to me;510

verses.text: Again he saith to me;510

sinaiticus.text: Love truth, and let nothing but truth proceed out of thy mouth, that the Spirit which God made to dwell in this flesh, may be found true in the sight of all men;

verses.text: Love truth, and let nothing but truth proceed out of thy mouth, that the Spirit which God made to dwell in this flesh, may be found true in the sight of all men;

sinaiticus.text: and thus shall the Lord, Who dwelleth in thee, be glorified;

verses.text: and thus shall the Lord, Who dwelleth in thee, be glorified;

sinaiticus.text: for the Lord is true in every word, and with Him there is no falsehood.

verses.text: for the Lord is true in every word, and with Him there is no falsehood.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore that speak lies set the Lord at nought, and become robbers of the Lord, for they do not deliver up to Him the deposit which they received.

verses.text: They therefore that speak lies set the Lord at nought, and become robbers of the Lord, for they do not deliver up to Him the deposit which they received.

sinaiticus.text: For they received of Him a spirit free from lies.

verses.text: For they received of Him a spirit free from lies.

sinaiticus.text: This if they shall return a lying spirit, they have defiled the commandment of the Lord and have become robbers.

verses.text: This if they shall return a lying spirit, they have defiled the commandment of the Lord and have become robbers.

sinaiticus.text: When then I heard these things, I wept bitterly.

verses.text: When then I heard these things, I wept bitterly.

sinaiticus.text: But seeing me weep he saith, Why weepest thou ?

verses.text: But seeing me weep he saith, Why weepest thou ?

sinaiticus.text: Because, Sir, say I, I know not if I can be saved.

verses.text: Because, Sir, say I, I know not if I can be saved.

sinaiticus.text: Why so?

verses.text: Why so?

sinaiticus.text: saith he.

verses.text: saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Because, Sir, I say, never in my life spake I a true word, but I always lived deceitfully with all men and dressed up my falsehood as truth before all men;

verses.text: Because, Sir, I say, never in my life spake I a true word, but I always lived deceitfully with all men and dressed up my falsehood as truth before all men;

sinaiticus.text: and no man ever contradicted me, but confidence was placed in my word.

verses.text: and no man ever contradicted me, but confidence was placed in my word.

sinaiticus.text: How then, Sir, say I, can I live, seeing that I have done these things?

verses.text: How then, Sir, say I, can I live, seeing that I have done these things?

sinaiticus.text: Your supposition, he saith, is right and true,

verses.text: Your supposition, he saith, is right and true,

sinaiticus.text: for it behoved thee as a servant of God to walk in truth, and no complicity with evil should abide with the Spirit of truth, nor bring grief to the Spirit which is holy and true.

verses.text: for it behoved thee as a servant of God to walk in truth, and no complicity with evil should abide with the Spirit of truth, nor bring grief to the Spirit which is holy and true.

sinaiticus.text: Never, Sir, say I, heard I clearly words such as these.

verses.text: Never, Sir, say I, heard I clearly words such as these.

sinaiticus.text: Now then, saith he, thou hearest.

verses.text: Now then, saith he, thou hearest.

sinaiticus.text: Guard them, that the former falsehoods also which thou spakest in thy business affairs may themselves become credible, now that these are found true;

verses.text: Guard them, that the former falsehoods also which thou spakest in thy business affairs may themselves become credible, now that these are found true;

sinaiticus.text: for they too can become trustworthy.

verses.text: for they too can become trustworthy.

sinaiticus.text: If thou keep these things,

verses.text: If thou keep these things,

sinaiticus.text: and from henceforward speak nothing but truth,

verses.text: and from henceforward speak nothing but truth,

sinaiticus.text: thou shalt be able to secure life for thyself And whosoever shall hear this command, and abstain from falsehood, that most pernicious habit, shall live unto God.

verses.text: thou shalt be able to secure life for thyself And whosoever shall hear this command, and abstain from falsehood, that most pernicious habit, shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: I charge thee, saith he, to keep purity,

verses.text: I charge thee, saith he, to keep purity,

sinaiticus.text: and let not a thought enter into thy heart concerning another’s wife, or concerning fornication or concerning any such like evil deeds;

verses.text: and let not a thought enter into thy heart concerning another’s wife, or concerning fornication or concerning any such like evil deeds;

sinaiticus.text: for in so doing thou committest a great sin.

verses.text: for in so doing thou committest a great sin.

sinaiticus.text: But remember thine own wife always, and thou shalt never go wrong.

verses.text: But remember thine own wife always, and thou shalt never go wrong.

sinaiticus.text: For should this desire enter into thine heart, thou wilt go wrong, and should any other as evil as this, thou committest sit,.

verses.text: For should this desire enter into thine heart, thou wilt go wrong, and should any other as evil as this, thou committest sit,.

sinaiticus.text: For this desire in a servant of God is a great sin;

verses.text: For this desire in a servant of God is a great sin;

sinaiticus.text: and if any man doeth this evil deed, he worketh out death for himself Look to it therefore.

verses.text: and if any man doeth this evil deed, he worketh out death for himself Look to it therefore.

sinaiticus.text: Abstain from this desire;

verses.text: Abstain from this desire;

sinaiticus.text: for, Mere holiness dwelleth, there lawlessness ought not to enter into the heart of a righteous man.

verses.text: for, Mere holiness dwelleth, there lawlessness ought not to enter into the heart of a righteous man.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him, Sir, permit me to ask thee a few more questions.

verses.text: I say to him, Sir, permit me to ask thee a few more questions.

sinaiticus.text: Say on, saith he.

verses.text: Say on, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Sir, say I, if a man who has a wife that is faithful in the Lord detect her in adultery, doth the husband sin in living with her?

verses.text: Sir, say I, if a man who has a wife that is faithful in the Lord detect her in adultery, doth the husband sin in living with her?

sinaiticus.text: So long as he is ignorant, saith he, he sinneth not;

verses.text: So long as he is ignorant, saith he, he sinneth not;

sinaiticus.text: but if the husband know of her sin, and the wife repent not, but continue in her fornication, and her husband live with her, he makes himself responsible for her sin and an accomplice in her adultery.

verses.text: but if the husband know of her sin, and the wife repent not, but continue in her fornication, and her husband live with her, he makes himself responsible for her sin and an accomplice in her adultery.

sinaiticus.text: What then, Sir, say I, shall the husband do, if the wife continue in this case?

verses.text: What then, Sir, say I, shall the husband do, if the wife continue in this case?

sinaiticus.text: Let him divorce her, saith he, and let the husband abide alone:

verses.text: Let him divorce her, saith he, and let the husband abide alone:

sinaiticus.text: but if after divorcing his wife he shall marry another, he likewise committeth adultery.

verses.text: but if after divorcing his wife he shall marry another, he likewise committeth adultery.

sinaiticus.text: If then, Sir, say I, after the wife is divorced, she repent and desire to return to her own husband, shall she not be received?

verses.text: If then, Sir, say I, after the wife is divorced, she repent and desire to return to her own husband, shall she not be received?

sinaiticus.text: Certainly, saith he, if the husband receiveth her not, he sinneth and bringeth great sin upon himself;

verses.text: Certainly, saith he, if the husband receiveth her not, he sinneth and bringeth great sin upon himself;

sinaiticus.text: nay, one who hath sinned and repented must be received, yet not often;

verses.text: nay, one who hath sinned and repented must be received, yet not often;

sinaiticus.text: for there is but one repentance for the servants of God.

verses.text: for there is but one repentance for the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: For the sake of her repentance therefore the husband ought not to marry.

verses.text: For the sake of her repentance therefore the husband ought not to marry.

sinaiticus.text: This is the manner of acting enjoined on husband and wife.

verses.text: This is the manner of acting enjoined on husband and wife.

sinaiticus.text: Not only, saith he, is it adultery, if a man pollute his flesh, but whosoever doeth things like unto the heathen committeth adultery.

verses.text: Not only, saith he, is it adultery, if a man pollute his flesh, but whosoever doeth things like unto the heathen committeth adultery.

sinaiticus.text: If therefore in such deeds as these likewise a man continue and repent not, keep away from him, and live not with him.

verses.text: If therefore in such deeds as these likewise a man continue and repent not, keep away from him, and live not with him.

sinaiticus.text: Otherwise, thou also art a partaker of his sin.512

verses.text: Otherwise, thou also art a partaker of his sin.512

sinaiticus.text: For this cause ye were enjoined to remain single, whether husband or wife;

verses.text: For this cause ye were enjoined to remain single, whether husband or wife;

sinaiticus.text: for in such cases repentance is possible.

verses.text: for in such cases repentance is possible.

sinaiticus.text: I, said he, am not giving an excuse that this matter should be concluded thus, but to the end that the sinner should sin no more.

verses.text: I, said he, am not giving an excuse that this matter should be concluded thus, but to the end that the sinner should sin no more.

sinaiticus.text: But as concerning his former sin, there is One who is able to give healing;

verses.text: But as concerning his former sin, there is One who is able to give healing;

sinaiticus.text: I asked him again, saying, Seeing that the Lord held me worthy that thou shouldest always dwell with me, suffer me still to made dense by my former deeds.

verses.text: I asked him again, saying, Seeing that the Lord held me worthy that thou shouldest always dwell with me, suffer me still to made dense by my former deeds.

sinaiticus.text: Make me to understand, for I am very foolish, and I apprehend absolutely nothing.

verses.text: Make me to understand, for I am very foolish, and I apprehend absolutely nothing.

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said unto me, I, saith he, preside over repentance, and I give understanding to all who repent.

verses.text: He answered and said unto me, I, saith he, preside over repentance, and I give understanding to all who repent.

sinaiticus.text: Nay, thinkest thou not, saith he, that this very act of repentance is understanding?

verses.text: Nay, thinkest thou not, saith he, that this very act of repentance is understanding?

sinaiticus.text: To repent is great understanding, saith he.

verses.text: To repent is great understanding, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: For the man that hath sinned understandeth that he hath done evil before the Lord,

verses.text: For the man that hath sinned understandeth that he hath done evil before the Lord,

sinaiticus.text: and the deed which he hath done entereth into his heart, and he repenteth, and doeth no more evil, but doeth good lavishly, and humbleth his own soul and putteth it to torture because it sinned.

verses.text: and the deed which he hath done entereth into his heart, and he repenteth, and doeth no more evil, but doeth good lavishly, and humbleth his own soul and putteth it to torture because it sinned.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then that repentance is great understanding.

verses.text: Thou seest then that repentance is great understanding.

sinaiticus.text: It is on this account therefore, Sir, say I, that I enquire everything accurately of thee;

verses.text: It is on this account therefore, Sir, say I, that I enquire everything accurately of thee;

sinaiticus.text: first, because I am a sinner;

verses.text: first, because I am a sinner;

sinaiticus.text: secondly, because I know not what deeds I must do that I may live, for my sins are many and various.

verses.text: secondly, because I know not what deeds I must do that I may live, for my sins are many and various.

sinaiticus.text: Thou shalt live, saith he, if thou keep my commandments and walk in them;

verses.text: Thou shalt live, saith he, if thou keep my commandments and walk in them;

sinaiticus.text: I will still proceed, Sir, say I, to ask a further question.

verses.text: I will still proceed, Sir, say I, to ask a further question.

sinaiticus.text: Speak on, saith he.

verses.text: Speak on, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: I have heard, Sir, say I, from took place when we went down into the water and obtained remission of our former sins.

verses.text: I have heard, Sir, say I, from took place when we went down into the water and obtained remission of our former sins.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me;

verses.text: He saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Thou hast well heard;

verses.text: Thou hast well heard;

sinaiticus.text: For he that hath received remission of sins ought no longer to sin, but to dwell in purity.

verses.text: For he that hath received remission of sins ought no longer to sin, but to dwell in purity.

sinaiticus.text: But, since thou enquirest all things accurately,

verses.text: But, since thou enquirest all things accurately,

sinaiticus.text: I will declare unto thee this also, so as to give no excuse to those who shall hereafter believe or those who have already believed, on the Lord.

verses.text: I will declare unto thee this also, so as to give no excuse to those who shall hereafter believe or those who have already believed, on the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: For they that have already believed, or shall hereafter believe, have not repentance for sins, but have only remission of their former sins.

verses.text: For they that have already believed, or shall hereafter believe, have not repentance for sins, but have only remission of their former sins.

sinaiticus.text: To those then that were called before these days the Lord has appointed repentance.

verses.text: To those then that were called before these days the Lord has appointed repentance.

sinaiticus.text: For the Lord, being a discerner of hearts and foreknowing all things,

verses.text: For the Lord, being a discerner of hearts and foreknowing all things,

sinaiticus.text: perceived the weakness of men and the manifold wiles of the devil, how that he will be doing some mischief to the servants of God, and will deal wickedly with them.

verses.text: perceived the weakness of men and the manifold wiles of the devil, how that he will be doing some mischief to the servants of God, and will deal wickedly with them.

sinaiticus.text: The Lord then, being very compassionate, had pity on His handiwork, and appointeth this (opportunity of) repentance, and to me was given the authority over this repentance.

verses.text: The Lord then, being very compassionate, had pity on His handiwork, and appointeth this (opportunity of) repentance, and to me was given the authority over this repentance.

sinaiticus.text: But I say unto you, saith he, if after this great and holy calling any one, being tempted of the devil, shall commit sin, he hath only one (opportunity of) repentance.

verses.text: But I say unto you, saith he, if after this great and holy calling any one, being tempted of the devil, shall commit sin, he hath only one (opportunity of) repentance.

sinaiticus.text: But if he sin off-hand and repent, repentance is unprofitable for such a man;

verses.text: But if he sin off-hand and repent, repentance is unprofitable for such a man;

sinaiticus.text: for he shall live with difficulty.

verses.text: for he shall live with difficulty.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him, I was quickened into life again, when I heard these things from thee so precisely.

verses.text: I say unto him, I was quickened into life again, when I heard these things from thee so precisely.

sinaiticus.text: For I know that, if I shall add no more to my sins, I shall be saved.

verses.text: For I know that, if I shall add no more to my sins, I shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: I asked him again, saying, Sir, since once thou dost bear with me, declare unto me this further matter also.

verses.text: I asked him again, saying, Sir, since once thou dost bear with me, declare unto me this further matter also.

sinaiticus.text: Say on, saith and one of them marry, doth the one that marrieth sin?

verses.text: Say on, saith and one of them marry, doth the one that marrieth sin?

sinaiticus.text: He sinneth not, saith he, but if he remain single, he investeth himself with more exceeding honour and with great glory before the Lord;

verses.text: He sinneth not, saith he, but if he remain single, he investeth himself with more exceeding honour and with great glory before the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: yet even if he should marry, he sinneth not.

verses.text: yet even if he should marry, he sinneth not.

sinaiticus.text: Preserve purity and holiness therefore, and thou shalt live unto God.

verses.text: Preserve purity and holiness therefore, and thou shalt live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: All these things, which I speak and shall hereafter speak unto thee, guard from this time forward, from the day when thou vast committed unto me, and I will dwell in thy house.514

verses.text: All these things, which I speak and shall hereafter speak unto thee, guard from this time forward, from the day when thou vast committed unto me, and I will dwell in thy house.514

sinaiticus.text: But for thy former transgressions there shall be remission, if thou keepest my commandments.

verses.text: But for thy former transgressions there shall be remission, if thou keepest my commandments.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE FIFTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE FIFTH.

sinaiticus.text: thou shalt have the mastery over all evil deeds, and shalt work all righteousness.

verses.text: thou shalt have the mastery over all evil deeds, and shalt work all righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: For if thou art long-suffering,

verses.text: For if thou art long-suffering,

sinaiticus.text: the Holy Spirit that abideth in thee shall be pure,

verses.text: the Holy Spirit that abideth in thee shall be pure,

sinaiticus.text: not being darkened by another evil spirit,

verses.text: not being darkened by another evil spirit,

sinaiticus.text: but dwelling in a large room shall rejoice and be glad with the vessel in which he dwelleth, and shall serve God with much cheerfulness, having prosperity in himself.

verses.text: but dwelling in a large room shall rejoice and be glad with the vessel in which he dwelleth, and shall serve God with much cheerfulness, having prosperity in himself.

sinaiticus.text: But if any angry temper approach, forthwith the Holy Spirit, being delicate, is straitened, not having [the) place clear, and seeketh to retire from the place;

verses.text: But if any angry temper approach, forthwith the Holy Spirit, being delicate, is straitened, not having [the) place clear, and seeketh to retire from the place;

sinaiticus.text: for he is being choked by the evil spirit, and has no room to minister unto the Lord, as he desireth, being polluted by angry temper.

verses.text: for he is being choked by the evil spirit, and has no room to minister unto the Lord, as he desireth, being polluted by angry temper.

sinaiticus.text: For the Lord dwelleth in long-suffering, but the devil in angry temper.

verses.text: For the Lord dwelleth in long-suffering, but the devil in angry temper.

sinaiticus.text: Thus that both the spirits then should be dwelling together is inconvenient and evil for that man in whom they dwell.

verses.text: Thus that both the spirits then should be dwelling together is inconvenient and evil for that man in whom they dwell.

sinaiticus.text: For if you take a little wormwood, and pour it into a jar of honey, is not the whole of the honey spoiled, and all that honey ruined by a very small quantity of wormwood?

verses.text: For if you take a little wormwood, and pour it into a jar of honey, is not the whole of the honey spoiled, and all that honey ruined by a very small quantity of wormwood?

sinaiticus.text: For it destroyeth the sweetness of the honey, and it no longer hath the same attraction for the owner, because it is rendered bitter and hath lost its use.

verses.text: For it destroyeth the sweetness of the honey, and it no longer hath the same attraction for the owner, because it is rendered bitter and hath lost its use.

sinaiticus.text: But if the wormwood be not put into the honey, the honey is found sweet and becomes useful to its owner.

verses.text: But if the wormwood be not put into the honey, the honey is found sweet and becomes useful to its owner.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest [then) that long-suffering is very sweet, beyond the sweetness of honey, and is useful to the Lord, and He dwelleth in it.

verses.text: Thou seest [then) that long-suffering is very sweet, beyond the sweetness of honey, and is useful to the Lord, and He dwelleth in it.

sinaiticus.text: But angry temper is bitter and useless.

verses.text: But angry temper is bitter and useless.

sinaiticus.text: If then angry temper be mixed with long-suffering, long-suffering is polluted and the mans intercession is no longer useful to God.

verses.text: If then angry temper be mixed with long-suffering, long-suffering is polluted and the mans intercession is no longer useful to God.

sinaiticus.text: I would fain know, Sir, say I, the working of angry temper, that I may guard myself from it.

verses.text: I would fain know, Sir, say I, the working of angry temper, that I may guard myself from it.

sinaiticus.text: Yea, verily, saith he, if thou guard not thyself from it-thou and thy family-thou hast lost all thy hope.

verses.text: Yea, verily, saith he, if thou guard not thyself from it-thou and thy family-thou hast lost all thy hope.

sinaiticus.text: But guard thyself from it;

verses.text: But guard thyself from it;

sinaiticus.text: Yea, and all men shall hold aloof from it, as many as have repenteth with their whole heart.

verses.text: Yea, and all men shall hold aloof from it, as many as have repenteth with their whole heart.

sinaiticus.text: For I will be with them and will preserve them;

verses.text: For I will be with them and will preserve them;

sinaiticus.text: Hear now, saith he, the working of angry temper, how evil it is,

verses.text: Hear now, saith he, the working of angry temper, how evil it is,

sinaiticus.text: and how it subverteth the servants of God by its own working, lead astray them that are full in the faith, nor can it work upon them, because the power of the Lord is with them;

verses.text: and how it subverteth the servants of God by its own working, lead astray them that are full in the faith, nor can it work upon them, because the power of the Lord is with them;

sinaiticus.text: but them that are empty and double-minded it leadeth astray.

verses.text: but them that are empty and double-minded it leadeth astray.

sinaiticus.text: For when it seeth such men in prosperity it insinuates itself into the heart of the man,

verses.text: For when it seeth such men in prosperity it insinuates itself into the heart of the man,

sinaiticus.text: and for no cause whatever the man or the woman is embittered on account of worldly matters,

verses.text: and for no cause whatever the man or the woman is embittered on account of worldly matters,

sinaiticus.text: either about meats, or some triviality, or about some friend, or about giving or receiving, or about follies of this kind.

verses.text: either about meats, or some triviality, or about some friend, or about giving or receiving, or about follies of this kind.

sinaiticus.text: For all these things are foolish and vain and senseless and inexpedient for the servants of God.

verses.text: For all these things are foolish and vain and senseless and inexpedient for the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: But long-suffering is great and strong,

verses.text: But long-suffering is great and strong,

sinaiticus.text: and has a mighty and vigorous power, and is prosperous in great enlargement, gladsome, exultant, free from care, glorifying the Lord at every season, having no bitterness in itself, remaining always gentle and tranquil.

verses.text: and has a mighty and vigorous power, and is prosperous in great enlargement, gladsome, exultant, free from care, glorifying the Lord at every season, having no bitterness in itself, remaining always gentle and tranquil.

sinaiticus.text: This long-suffering therefore dwelleth with those whose faith is perfect.

verses.text: This long-suffering therefore dwelleth with those whose faith is perfect.

sinaiticus.text: But angry temper is in the first place foolish, fickle and senseless;

verses.text: But angry temper is in the first place foolish, fickle and senseless;

sinaiticus.text: then from foolishness is engendered bitterness, and from bitterness wrath, and from wrath anger, and from anger spite;

verses.text: then from foolishness is engendered bitterness, and from bitterness wrath, and from wrath anger, and from anger spite;

sinaiticus.text: then spite being composed of all these evil elements becometh a great sin and incurable.

verses.text: then spite being composed of all these evil elements becometh a great sin and incurable.

sinaiticus.text: For when all these spirits dwell in one vessel, where the Holy Spirit also dwelleth, that vessel cannot contain them, but overfloweth.

verses.text: For when all these spirits dwell in one vessel, where the Holy Spirit also dwelleth, that vessel cannot contain them, but overfloweth.

sinaiticus.text: The delicate spirit therefore,

verses.text: The delicate spirit therefore,

sinaiticus.text: as not being accustomed to dwell with-an evil spirit nor with harshness, departeth from a man of that kind, and seeketh to dwell with gentleness and tranquility.

verses.text: as not being accustomed to dwell with-an evil spirit nor with harshness, departeth from a man of that kind, and seeketh to dwell with gentleness and tranquility.

sinaiticus.text: Then, when it hath removed from that man, in whom it dwells,

verses.text: Then, when it hath removed from that man, in whom it dwells,

sinaiticus.text: that man becometh emptied of the righteous spirit,

verses.text: that man becometh emptied of the righteous spirit,

sinaiticus.text: and henceforward, being filled with the evil spirits, he is unstable in all his actions,

verses.text: and henceforward, being filled with the evil spirits, he is unstable in all his actions,

sinaiticus.text: being dragged about hither and thither by the evil spirits, and is altogether blinded and bereft of his good intent.516

verses.text: being dragged about hither and thither by the evil spirits, and is altogether blinded and bereft of his good intent.516

sinaiticus.text: Thus then it happeneth to all persons of angry temper.

verses.text: Thus then it happeneth to all persons of angry temper.

sinaiticus.text: Refrain therefore from angry temper, the most evil of evil spirits.

verses.text: Refrain therefore from angry temper, the most evil of evil spirits.

sinaiticus.text: But clothe thyself in long-suffering, and resist angry temper and bitterness, and thou shalt be found in company with the holiness which is beloved of the Lord.

verses.text: But clothe thyself in long-suffering, and resist angry temper and bitterness, and thou shalt be found in company with the holiness which is beloved of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: See then that thou never neglect this commandment;

verses.text: See then that thou never neglect this commandment;

sinaiticus.text: for if thou master this commandment, thou shalt be able likewise to keep the remaining commandments, which I am about to give thee.

verses.text: for if thou master this commandment, thou shalt be able likewise to keep the remaining commandments, which I am about to give thee.

sinaiticus.text: Be strong in them and endowed with power;

verses.text: Be strong in them and endowed with power;

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE SIXTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE SIXTH.

sinaiticus.text: I charged thee, saith he,

verses.text: I charged thee, saith he,

sinaiticus.text: in my first commandment to guard saith he, I wish to show thee their powers also, that thou mayest understand what is the power and effect of each one of them.

verses.text: in my first commandment to guard saith he, I wish to show thee their powers also, that thou mayest understand what is the power and effect of each one of them.

sinaiticus.text: For their effects are twofold.

verses.text: For their effects are twofold.

sinaiticus.text: Now they are prescribed alike to the righteous and the unrighteous.

verses.text: Now they are prescribed alike to the righteous and the unrighteous.

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore trust righteousness, but trust not unrighteousness;

verses.text: Do thou therefore trust righteousness, but trust not unrighteousness;

sinaiticus.text: for the way of righteousness is straight, but the way of unrighteousness is crooked.

verses.text: for the way of righteousness is straight, but the way of unrighteousness is crooked.

sinaiticus.text: But walk thou in the straight path, and leave the crooked one alone.

verses.text: But walk thou in the straight path, and leave the crooked one alone.

sinaiticus.text: For the crooked way has no tracks, but only pathlessness and many stumbling-stones, and is rough and thorny.

verses.text: For the crooked way has no tracks, but only pathlessness and many stumbling-stones, and is rough and thorny.

sinaiticus.text: So it is therefore harmful to those who walk in it.

verses.text: So it is therefore harmful to those who walk in it.

sinaiticus.text: But those who walk in the straight way walk on the level and without stumbling :

verses.text: But those who walk in the straight way walk on the level and without stumbling :

sinaiticus.text: for it is neither rough nor thorny.

verses.text: for it is neither rough nor thorny.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then that it is more expedient to walk in this way.

verses.text: Thou seest then that it is more expedient to walk in this way.

sinaiticus.text: I am pleased, Sir, say I, to walk in this way.

verses.text: I am pleased, Sir, say I, to walk in this way.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now, saith he, concerning faith.

verses.text: Hear now, saith he, concerning faith.

sinaiticus.text: There are two then, Sir, say I, shall I know their workings, seeing that both angels dwell with me?

verses.text: There are two then, Sir, say I, shall I know their workings, seeing that both angels dwell with me?

sinaiticus.text: Hear, saith he, and understand their workings.

verses.text: Hear, saith he, and understand their workings.

sinaiticus.text: The angel of righteousness is delicate and bashful and gentle and tranquil.

verses.text: The angel of righteousness is delicate and bashful and gentle and tranquil.

sinaiticus.text: forthwith he speaketh with thee of righteousness, of purity, of holiness, and of contentment, of every righteous deed and of every glorious virtue.

verses.text: forthwith he speaketh with thee of righteousness, of purity, of holiness, and of contentment, of every righteous deed and of every glorious virtue.

sinaiticus.text: When all these things enter into thy heart, know that the angel of righteousness is with thee.

verses.text: When all these things enter into thy heart, know that the angel of righteousness is with thee.

sinaiticus.text: [These then are the works of the angel of righteousness.]

verses.text: [These then are the works of the angel of righteousness.]

sinaiticus.text: Trust him therefore and his works.

verses.text: Trust him therefore and his works.

sinaiticus.text: Now see the works of the angel of wickedness also.

verses.text: Now see the works of the angel of wickedness also.

sinaiticus.text: First of all, he is quick-tempered and bitter and senseless, and his works are evil, overthrowing the servants of God.

verses.text: First of all, he is quick-tempered and bitter and senseless, and his works are evil, overthrowing the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: Whenever then he entereth into thy heart, know him by his works.

verses.text: Whenever then he entereth into thy heart, know him by his works.

sinaiticus.text: How I shall discern him, Sir, I reply, I know not.

verses.text: How I shall discern him, Sir, I reply, I know not.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he.

verses.text: Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: When a fit of angry temper or bitterness comes upon thee, know that he is in thee.

verses.text: When a fit of angry temper or bitterness comes upon thee, know that he is in thee.

sinaiticus.text: Then the desire of much business and the costliness of many viands and drinking bouts and of many drunken fits and of various luxuries which are unseemly,

verses.text: Then the desire of much business and the costliness of many viands and drinking bouts and of many drunken fits and of various luxuries which are unseemly,

sinaiticus.text: and the desire of women, and avarice, and haughtiness and boastfulness,

verses.text: and the desire of women, and avarice, and haughtiness and boastfulness,

sinaiticus.text: and whatsoever things are akin and like to these-when then these things enter into thy heart, know that the angel of wickedness is with thee.

verses.text: and whatsoever things are akin and like to these-when then these things enter into thy heart, know that the angel of wickedness is with thee.

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore, recognising his works, stand aloof from him, and trust him in nothing, for his works are evil and inexpedient for the servants of God.

verses.text: Do thou therefore, recognising his works, stand aloof from him, and trust him in nothing, for his works are evil and inexpedient for the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: Here then thou hast the workings of both the angels.

verses.text: Here then thou hast the workings of both the angels.

sinaiticus.text: Understand them, and trust the angel of righteousness.

verses.text: Understand them, and trust the angel of righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: But from the angel of wickedness stand aloof, for his teaching is evil in every matter;

verses.text: But from the angel of wickedness stand aloof, for his teaching is evil in every matter;

sinaiticus.text: for though one be a man of faith, and the desire of this angel enter into his heart, that man, or that woman, must commit some sin.

verses.text: for though one be a man of faith, and the desire of this angel enter into his heart, that man, or that woman, must commit some sin.

sinaiticus.text: And if again a man or a woman be exceedingly wicked, and the works of the angel of righteousness come into that mans heart, he must of necessity do something good.

verses.text: And if again a man or a woman be exceedingly wicked, and the works of the angel of righteousness come into that mans heart, he must of necessity do something good.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then, saith he, that it is good to follow the angel of righteousness, and to bid farewell to the angel of wickedness.

verses.text: Thou seest then, saith he, that it is good to follow the angel of righteousness, and to bid farewell to the angel of wickedness.

sinaiticus.text: This commandment declareth what concerneth faith,, that thou mayest trust the works of the angel of righteousness, and doing them mayest live unto God.

verses.text: This commandment declareth what concerneth faith,, that thou mayest trust the works of the angel of righteousness, and doing them mayest live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: But believe that the works of the angel of wickedness are difficult;

verses.text: But believe that the works of the angel of wickedness are difficult;

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE SEVENTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE SEVENTH.

sinaiticus.text: Fear the Lord, saith he, and keep His commandments.

verses.text: Fear the Lord, saith he, and keep His commandments.

sinaiticus.text: So deed, and thy doing shall be incomparable.

verses.text: So deed, and thy doing shall be incomparable.

sinaiticus.text: For whilst thou fearest the Lord, thou shalt do all things well.

verses.text: For whilst thou fearest the Lord, thou shalt do all things well.

sinaiticus.text: But this is the fear wherewith thou oughtest to be afraid, and thou shalt be saved.

verses.text: But this is the fear wherewith thou oughtest to be afraid, and thou shalt be saved.

sinaiticus.text: But fear not the devil;

verses.text: But fear not the devil;

sinaiticus.text: for, if thou fear the Lord, thou shalt be master over the devil, for there is no power in him.

verses.text: for, if thou fear the Lord, thou shalt be master over the devil, for there is no power in him.

sinaiticus.text: [For] in whom is no power, neither is there fear of him;

verses.text: [For] in whom is no power, neither is there fear of him;

sinaiticus.text: but in whom power is glorious, of him is fear likewise.

verses.text: but in whom power is glorious, of him is fear likewise.

sinaiticus.text: For every one that hath power hath fear, whereas he that hath no power is despised of all.

verses.text: For every one that hath power hath fear, whereas he that hath no power is despised of all.

sinaiticus.text: But fear thou the works of the devil, for they are evil.

verses.text: But fear thou the works of the devil, for they are evil.

sinaiticus.text: While then thou fearest the Lord, thou wilt fear the works of the devil, and wilt not do them, but abstain from them.

verses.text: While then thou fearest the Lord, thou wilt fear the works of the devil, and wilt not do them, but abstain from them.

sinaiticus.text: Fear therefore is of two kinds.

verses.text: Fear therefore is of two kinds.

sinaiticus.text: If thou desire to do evil, fear the Lord, and thou shalt not do it.

verses.text: If thou desire to do evil, fear the Lord, and thou shalt not do it.

sinaiticus.text: If again thou desire to do good, fear the Lord and thou shalt do it.

verses.text: If again thou desire to do good, fear the Lord and thou shalt do it.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the fear of the Lord is powerful and great and glorious.

verses.text: Therefore the fear of the Lord is powerful and great and glorious.

sinaiticus.text: Fear the Lord then, and thou shalt live unto Him;

verses.text: Fear the Lord then, and thou shalt live unto Him;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and as many of them that keep His commandments as shall fear Him, shall live unto God.

verses.text: yea, and as many of them that keep His commandments as shall fear Him, shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, didst thou say concerning those that keep His commandments, “They shall live unto God”?

verses.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, didst thou say concerning those that keep His commandments, “They shall live unto God”?

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, every creature feareth the Lord, but not every one keepeth His commandments.

verses.text: Because, saith he, every creature feareth the Lord, but not every one keepeth His commandments.

sinaiticus.text: Those then that fear Him and keep His commandments, they have life unto God;

verses.text: Those then that fear Him and keep His commandments, they have life unto God;

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE EIGHTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE EIGHTH.

sinaiticus.text: I told thee, saith he, that the creatures of God are twofold;

verses.text: I told thee, saith he, that the creatures of God are twofold;

sinaiticus.text: be temperate, but in other things it is not right.

verses.text: be temperate, but in other things it is not right.

sinaiticus.text: Make known unto me, Sir, say I, in what things it is right to be temperate, and in what things it is not right.

verses.text: Make known unto me, Sir, say I, in what things it is right to be temperate, and in what things it is not right.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he.

verses.text: Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Be temperate as to what is evil, and do it not;

verses.text: Be temperate as to what is evil, and do it not;

sinaiticus.text: but be not temperate as to what is good, but do it.

verses.text: but be not temperate as to what is good, but do it.

sinaiticus.text: For if thou be temperate as to what is good, so as not to do it, thou

verses.text: For if thou be temperate as to what is good, so as not to do it, thou

sinaiticus.text: but if thou be temperate as to what is evil, so as not to do it, thou doest great righteousness.

verses.text: but if thou be temperate as to what is evil, so as not to do it, thou doest great righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: Be temperate therefore in abstaining from all wickedness, and do that which is good.

verses.text: Be temperate therefore in abstaining from all wickedness, and do that which is good.

sinaiticus.text: What kinds of wickedness, Sir, say I, are they from which we must be temperate and abstain?

verses.text: What kinds of wickedness, Sir, say I, are they from which we must be temperate and abstain?

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: from adultery and fornication,

verses.text: from adultery and fornication,

sinaiticus.text: from the lawlessness of drunkenness, from wicked luxury,

verses.text: from the lawlessness of drunkenness, from wicked luxury,

sinaiticus.text: from many viands and the costliness of riches, and vaunting and haughtiness and pride, and from falsehood and evil-speaking and hypocrisy, malice and all blasphemy.

verses.text: from many viands and the costliness of riches, and vaunting and haughtiness and pride, and from falsehood and evil-speaking and hypocrisy, malice and all blasphemy.

sinaiticus.text: These works are the most wicked of all in the life of men.

verses.text: These works are the most wicked of all in the life of men.

sinaiticus.text: From these works therefore the servant of God must be temperate and abstain;

verses.text: From these works therefore the servant of God must be temperate and abstain;

sinaiticus.text: for he that is not temperate so as to abstain from these cannot live unto God.

verses.text: for he that is not temperate so as to abstain from these cannot live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: Listen then to what follows upon these.

verses.text: Listen then to what follows upon these.

sinaiticus.text: Why, are there still other evil deeds, Sir?

verses.text: Why, are there still other evil deeds, Sir?

sinaiticus.text: say I.

verses.text: say I.

sinaiticus.text: Aye, saith he, there are many, from which the servant of God must be temperate and abstain;

verses.text: Aye, saith he, there are many, from which the servant of God must be temperate and abstain;

sinaiticus.text: theft, falsehood, deprivation, false witness, avarice, evil desire, deceit, vain-glory, boastfulness, and whatsoever things are like unto these.

verses.text: theft, falsehood, deprivation, false witness, avarice, evil desire, deceit, vain-glory, boastfulness, and whatsoever things are like unto these.

sinaiticus.text: Thinkest thou not that these things are wrong, yea, very wrong, [saith he,] for the servants of God?

verses.text: Thinkest thou not that these things are wrong, yea, very wrong, [saith he,] for the servants of God?

sinaiticus.text: In all these things he that serveth God must exercise temperance.

verses.text: In all these things he that serveth God must exercise temperance.

sinaiticus.text: Be thou temperate, therefore, and refrain from all these things, that thou mayest live unto God, and be enrolled among those who exercise self-restraint in them.

verses.text: Be thou temperate, therefore, and refrain from all these things, that thou mayest live unto God, and be enrolled among those who exercise self-restraint in them.

sinaiticus.text: These then are the things from which thou shouldest restrain thyself Now hear, saith he, the things, in which thou shouldest not exercise self-restraint, but do them.

verses.text: These then are the things from which thou shouldest restrain thyself Now hear, saith he, the things, in which thou shouldest not exercise self-restraint, but do them.

sinaiticus.text: Exercise no self-restraint in that which is good, but do it.

verses.text: Exercise no self-restraint in that which is good, but do it.

sinaiticus.text: Sir, say I, show me the power of the good also, that I may walk in them and serve them, that doing them it may be possible for me to be saved.

verses.text: Sir, say I, show me the power of the good also, that I may walk in them and serve them, that doing them it may be possible for me to be saved.

sinaiticus.text: Hear, saith he, the works of the good likewise, which thou must do, and towards which thou must exercise no self-restraint.

verses.text: Hear, saith he, the works of the good likewise, which thou must do, and towards which thou must exercise no self-restraint.

sinaiticus.text: First of all, there is faith, fear of the Lord, love, concord, words of righteousness, truth, patience;

verses.text: First of all, there is faith, fear of the Lord, love, concord, words of righteousness, truth, patience;

sinaiticus.text: nothing is better than these it, the life of men.520

verses.text: nothing is better than these it, the life of men.520

sinaiticus.text: If a man keep these, and exercise not self-restraint from them, he becomes blessed in his life.

verses.text: If a man keep these, and exercise not self-restraint from them, he becomes blessed in his life.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now what follow upon these;

verses.text: Hear now what follow upon these;

sinaiticus.text: to minister to widows, to visit the orphans and the needy,

verses.text: to minister to widows, to visit the orphans and the needy,

sinaiticus.text: to ransom the servants of God from their afflictions,

verses.text: to ransom the servants of God from their afflictions,

sinaiticus.text: to be hospitable (for in hospitality benevolence from time to time has a place),

verses.text: to be hospitable (for in hospitality benevolence from time to time has a place),

sinaiticus.text: to resist no man, to be tranquil, to show yourself more submissive than all men,

verses.text: to resist no man, to be tranquil, to show yourself more submissive than all men,

sinaiticus.text: to reverence the aged, to practise righteousness, to observe brotherly feeling,

verses.text: to reverence the aged, to practise righteousness, to observe brotherly feeling,

sinaiticus.text: to endure injury, to be long-suffering, to bear no grudge,

verses.text: to endure injury, to be long-suffering, to bear no grudge,

sinaiticus.text: to exhort those who are sick at soul, not to cast away those that have stumbled from the faith,

verses.text: to exhort those who are sick at soul, not to cast away those that have stumbled from the faith,

sinaiticus.text: but to convert them and to put courage into them, to reprove sinners, not to oppress debtors and indigent persons, and whatsoever actions are like these.

verses.text: but to convert them and to put courage into them, to reprove sinners, not to oppress debtors and indigent persons, and whatsoever actions are like these.

sinaiticus.text: Do these things, saith he, seem to thee to be good?

verses.text: Do these things, saith he, seem to thee to be good?

sinaiticus.text: Why, what, Sir, say I, can be better than these ?

verses.text: Why, what, Sir, say I, can be better than these ?

sinaiticus.text: Then walk in them, saith he, and abstain not from them, and thou shalt live unto God.

verses.text: Then walk in them, saith he, and abstain not from them, and thou shalt live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: Keep this commandment therefore.

verses.text: Keep this commandment therefore.

sinaiticus.text: If thou do good and abstain not from it, thou shalt live unto God;

verses.text: If thou do good and abstain not from it, thou shalt live unto God;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and all shall live unto God who act so.

verses.text: yea, and all shall live unto God who act so.

sinaiticus.text: And again if thou do not evil, and abstain from it, thou shalt live unto God;

verses.text: And again if thou do not evil, and abstain from it, thou shalt live unto God;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and all shall live unto God, who shall keep these commandments, and walk in them.

verses.text: yea, and all shall live unto God, who shall keep these commandments, and walk in them.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE NINTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE NINTH.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me;

verses.text: He saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Remove from thyself a doubtful mind and doubt not at all whether to ask of God, saying within thyself, “ How can I ask a thing of the Lord and receive it, seeing that I have committed so many sins against Him?”

verses.text: Remove from thyself a doubtful mind and doubt not at all whether to ask of God, saying within thyself, “ How can I ask a thing of the Lord and receive it, seeing that I have committed so many sins against Him?”

sinaiticus.text: Reason not thus, but turn to the Lord with thy whole heart,

verses.text: Reason not thus, but turn to the Lord with thy whole heart,

sinaiticus.text: and ask of Him, nothing wavering, and thou shalt know His exceeding compassion, that He will surely not abandon thee, but will fulfil the petition of thy soul.

verses.text: and ask of Him, nothing wavering, and thou shalt know His exceeding compassion, that He will surely not abandon thee, but will fulfil the petition of thy soul.

sinaiticus.text: For God is not as men who bear a grudge, but Himself is without

verses.text: For God is not as men who bear a grudge, but Himself is without

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore cleanse thy heart from all the vanities of this life, and from the things mentioned before;

verses.text: Do thou therefore cleanse thy heart from all the vanities of this life, and from the things mentioned before;

sinaiticus.text: and ask of the Lord, and thou shalt receive all things, and shalt lack nothing of all thy petitions, if thou ask of the Lord nothing wavering.

verses.text: and ask of the Lord, and thou shalt receive all things, and shalt lack nothing of all thy petitions, if thou ask of the Lord nothing wavering.

sinaiticus.text: But if thou waver in thy heart, thou shalt surely receive none of thy petitions.

verses.text: But if thou waver in thy heart, thou shalt surely receive none of thy petitions.

sinaiticus.text: For they that waver towards God, these are the doubtful-minded, and they never obtain any of their petitions.

verses.text: For they that waver towards God, these are the doubtful-minded, and they never obtain any of their petitions.

sinaiticus.text: But they that are complete in the faith make all their petitions trusting in the Lord, and they receive, because they ask without wavering, nothing doubting;

verses.text: But they that are complete in the faith make all their petitions trusting in the Lord, and they receive, because they ask without wavering, nothing doubting;

sinaiticus.text: for every doubtful-minded man, if he repent not, shall hardly be saved.

verses.text: for every doubtful-minded man, if he repent not, shall hardly be saved.

sinaiticus.text: Cleanse therefore thy heart from doubtful-mindedness, and put on faith, for it is strong, and trust God that thou wilt receive all thy petitions which thou askest;

verses.text: Cleanse therefore thy heart from doubtful-mindedness, and put on faith, for it is strong, and trust God that thou wilt receive all thy petitions which thou askest;

sinaiticus.text: and if after asking anything of the Lord, thou receive thy petition somewhat tardily, be not of doubtful mind because thou didst not receive the petition of thy soul at once.

verses.text: and if after asking anything of the Lord, thou receive thy petition somewhat tardily, be not of doubtful mind because thou didst not receive the petition of thy soul at once.

sinaiticus.text: For assuredly it is by reason of some temptation or some transgression, of which thou art ignorant, that thou receivest thy petition so tardily.

verses.text: For assuredly it is by reason of some temptation or some transgression, of which thou art ignorant, that thou receivest thy petition so tardily.

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore cease not to make thy souls petition, and thou shalt receive it.

verses.text: Do thou therefore cease not to make thy souls petition, and thou shalt receive it.

sinaiticus.text: But if thou grow weary, and doubt as thou askest, blame thyself and not Him that giveth unto thee.

verses.text: But if thou grow weary, and doubt as thou askest, blame thyself and not Him that giveth unto thee.

sinaiticus.text: See to this doubtful-mindedness;

verses.text: See to this doubtful-mindedness;

sinaiticus.text: for it is evil and senseless, and uprooteth many from the faith, yea, even very faithful and strong men.

verses.text: for it is evil and senseless, and uprooteth many from the faith, yea, even very faithful and strong men.

sinaiticus.text: For indeed this doubtful-mindedness is a daughter of the devil, and worketh great wickedness against the servants of God.

verses.text: For indeed this doubtful-mindedness is a daughter of the devil, and worketh great wickedness against the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore despise doubtful-mindedness and gain the mastery over it in everything, clothing thyself with faith which is strong and powerful.

verses.text: Therefore despise doubtful-mindedness and gain the mastery over it in everything, clothing thyself with faith which is strong and powerful.

sinaiticus.text: For faith promiseth all things, accomplisheth all things;

verses.text: For faith promiseth all things, accomplisheth all things;

sinaiticus.text: but doubtful-mindedness, as having no confidence in itself, fails in all the works which it doeth.

verses.text: but doubtful-mindedness, as having no confidence in itself, fails in all the works which it doeth.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then, saith he, that faith is from above from the Lord, and hath great power;

verses.text: Thou seest then, saith he, that faith is from above from the Lord, and hath great power;

sinaiticus.text: but doubtful-mindedness as an earthly spirit from the devil, and hath no power.

verses.text: but doubtful-mindedness as an earthly spirit from the devil, and hath no power.

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore serve that faith which hath power, and hold aloof from the doubtful-mindedness which hath no power;

verses.text: Do thou therefore serve that faith which hath power, and hold aloof from the doubtful-mindedness which hath no power;

sinaiticus.text: and thou shalt live unto God;522

verses.text: and thou shalt live unto God;522

sinaiticus.text: yea, and all those shall live unto God who are so minded.

verses.text: yea, and all those shall live unto God who are so minded.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE TENTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE TENTH.

sinaiticus.text: Put away sorrow from thyself, saith he, for she is the sister of doubtful-mindedness and of angry temper.

verses.text: Put away sorrow from thyself, saith he, for she is the sister of doubtful-mindedness and of angry temper.

sinaiticus.text: How, Sir, say I, is she the sister of these?

verses.text: How, Sir, say I, is she the sister of these?

sinaiticus.text: For angry temper seems to me to be one thing, doubtful- mindedness another, sorrow another.

verses.text: For angry temper seems to me to be one thing, doubtful- mindedness another, sorrow another.

sinaiticus.text: Thou art a foolish fellow, saith he,

verses.text: Thou art a foolish fellow, saith he,

sinaiticus.text: [and] perceivest not that sorrow is more evil than all the spirits,

verses.text: [and] perceivest not that sorrow is more evil than all the spirits,

sinaiticus.text: and is most fatal to the servants of God, and beyond all the spirits destroys a man, and crushes out the Holy Spirit, and yet again saves it.

verses.text: and is most fatal to the servants of God, and beyond all the spirits destroys a man, and crushes out the Holy Spirit, and yet again saves it.

sinaiticus.text: I, Sir, say I, am without understanding, and I understand not these parables.

verses.text: I, Sir, say I, am without understanding, and I understand not these parables.

sinaiticus.text: For how it can crush out and again save, I do not comprehend.

verses.text: For how it can crush out and again save, I do not comprehend.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he.

verses.text: Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Those who have never investigated concerning the truth,

verses.text: Those who have never investigated concerning the truth,

sinaiticus.text: nor enquired concerning the deity,

verses.text: nor enquired concerning the deity,

sinaiticus.text: but have merely believed,

verses.text: but have merely believed,

sinaiticus.text: and have been mixed up in business affairs and riches and heathen friendships,

verses.text: and have been mixed up in business affairs and riches and heathen friendships,

sinaiticus.text: and many other affairs of this world-as many, I say, as devote themselves to these things, comprehend not the parables of the deity;

verses.text: and many other affairs of this world-as many, I say, as devote themselves to these things, comprehend not the parables of the deity;

sinaiticus.text: for they are darkened by these actions, and are corrupted and become barren.

verses.text: for they are darkened by these actions, and are corrupted and become barren.

sinaiticus.text: As good vineyards,

verses.text: As good vineyards,

sinaiticus.text: when they are treated with neglect, are made barren by the thorns and weeds of various kinds,

verses.text: when they are treated with neglect, are made barren by the thorns and weeds of various kinds,

sinaiticus.text: so men who after they have believed fall into these many occupations which were mentioned before, lose their understanding and comprehend nothing at all concerning righteousness;

verses.text: so men who after they have believed fall into these many occupations which were mentioned before, lose their understanding and comprehend nothing at all concerning righteousness;

sinaiticus.text: for if they hear concerning the deity and truth, their mind is absorbed in their occupations, and they perceive nothing at all.

verses.text: for if they hear concerning the deity and truth, their mind is absorbed in their occupations, and they perceive nothing at all.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have the fear of God,

verses.text: But they that have the fear of God,

sinaiticus.text: and investigate concerning deity and truth, and direct their heart towards the Lord, perceive and understand everything that is said to them more quickly,

verses.text: and investigate concerning deity and truth, and direct their heart towards the Lord, perceive and understand everything that is said to them more quickly,

sinaiticus.text: because they have the fear of the Lord in themselves;

verses.text: because they have the fear of the Lord in themselves;

sinaiticus.text: Cleave therefore unto the Lord, and thou shalt understand and perceive all things.

verses.text: Cleave therefore unto the Lord, and thou shalt understand and perceive all things.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now, senseless man, saith he, how sorrow crusheth out the Holy Spirit, and again saveth it.
