verses.text: Hear now, senseless man, saith he, how sorrow crusheth out the Holy Spirit, and again saveth it.

sinaiticus.text: When the man of doubtful mind sets his hand to any action, and fails in it owing to his doubtful-mindedness, grief at this entereth into the man, and grieveth the Holy Spirit, and crusheth it out.

verses.text: When the man of doubtful mind sets his hand to any action, and fails in it owing to his doubtful-mindedness, grief at this entereth into the man, and grieveth the Holy Spirit, and crusheth it out.

sinaiticus.text: Then again when angry temper cleaveth to a man concerning any matter,

verses.text: Then again when angry temper cleaveth to a man concerning any matter,

sinaiticus.text: and he is much embittered, again sorrow entereth into the heart of the man that was ill-tempered, and he is grieved at the deed which he hath done, and repenteth that he did evil.

verses.text: and he is much embittered, again sorrow entereth into the heart of the man that was ill-tempered, and he is grieved at the deed which he hath done, and repenteth that he did evil.

sinaiticus.text: This sadness therefore seemeth to bring salvation, because he repented at having done the evil.

verses.text: This sadness therefore seemeth to bring salvation, because he repented at having done the evil.

sinaiticus.text: So both the operations sadden the Spirit;

verses.text: So both the operations sadden the Spirit;

sinaiticus.text: first, the doubtful mind saddens the Spirit, because it succeeded not in its business, and the angry temper again, because it did what was evil.

verses.text: first, the doubtful mind saddens the Spirit, because it succeeded not in its business, and the angry temper again, because it did what was evil.

sinaiticus.text: Thus both are saddening to the Holy Spirit, the doubtful mind and the angry temper.

verses.text: Thus both are saddening to the Holy Spirit, the doubtful mind and the angry temper.

sinaiticus.text: Put away therefore from thyself sadness, and afflict not the Holy Spirit that dwelleth in thee, lest haply He intercede with God [against thee], and depart from thee.

verses.text: Put away therefore from thyself sadness, and afflict not the Holy Spirit that dwelleth in thee, lest haply He intercede with God [against thee], and depart from thee.

sinaiticus.text: For the Spirit of God, that was given unto this flesh, endureth not sadness neither constraint.

verses.text: For the Spirit of God, that was given unto this flesh, endureth not sadness neither constraint.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore clothe thyself in cheerfulness, which hath favour with God always, and is acceptable to Him, and rejoice in it.

verses.text: Therefore clothe thyself in cheerfulness, which hath favour with God always, and is acceptable to Him, and rejoice in it.

sinaiticus.text: For every cheerful man worketh good, and thinketh good, and despiseth sadness;

verses.text: For every cheerful man worketh good, and thinketh good, and despiseth sadness;

sinaiticus.text: but the sad man is always committing sin.

verses.text: but the sad man is always committing sin.

sinaiticus.text: In the first place he committeth sin, because he grieveth the Holy Spirit, which was given to the man being a cheerful spirit;

verses.text: In the first place he committeth sin, because he grieveth the Holy Spirit, which was given to the man being a cheerful spirit;

sinaiticus.text: and in the second place, by grieving the Holy Spirit he doeth lawlessness, in that he doth not intercede with neither confess unto God.

verses.text: and in the second place, by grieving the Holy Spirit he doeth lawlessness, in that he doth not intercede with neither confess unto God.

sinaiticus.text: For the intercession of a sad man hath never at any time power to ascend to the altar of God.

verses.text: For the intercession of a sad man hath never at any time power to ascend to the altar of God.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, say I, doth not the intercession of him that is saddened ascend to the altar?524

verses.text: Wherefore, say I, doth not the intercession of him that is saddened ascend to the altar?524

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, sadness is seated at his heart.

verses.text: Because, saith he, sadness is seated at his heart.

sinaiticus.text: Thus sadness mingled with the intercession doth not suffer the intercession to ascend pure to the altar.

verses.text: Thus sadness mingled with the intercession doth not suffer the intercession to ascend pure to the altar.

sinaiticus.text: For as vinegar when mingled with vine in the same  hath not the same pleasant taste, so likewise sadness mingled with the Holy Spirit hath not the same intercession.

verses.text: For as vinegar when mingled with vine in the same  hath not the same pleasant taste, so likewise sadness mingled with the Holy Spirit hath not the same intercession.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore cleanse thyself from this wicked sadness, and thou shalt live unto God;

verses.text: Therefore cleanse thyself from this wicked sadness, and thou shalt live unto God;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and all they shall live unto God, who shall cast away sadness from themselves and clothe themselves in all cheerfulness.

verses.text: yea, and all they shall live unto God, who shall cast away sadness from themselves and clothe themselves in all cheerfulness.

sinaiticus.text: MANDATE THE ELEVENTH.

verses.text: MANDATE THE ELEVENTH.

sinaiticus.text: He shewed me men seated on a couch, and another man seated on a chair.

verses.text: He shewed me men seated on a couch, and another man seated on a chair.

sinaiticus.text: And he saith to me, Seest thou those that are seated on the couch ?

verses.text: And he saith to me, Seest thou those that are seated on the couch ?

sinaiticus.text: I see them, Sir, say I.

verses.text: I see them, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: These, saith he, are faithful,

verses.text: These, saith he, are faithful,

sinaiticus.text: but he that sitteth on the chair is a false prophet who destroyeth the mind of the servants of God-I mean, of the doubtful-minded, not of the faithful.

verses.text: but he that sitteth on the chair is a false prophet who destroyeth the mind of the servants of God-I mean, of the doubtful-minded, not of the faithful.

sinaiticus.text: These doubtful-minded ones then come to him as to a soothsayer and enquire of him what shall befall them.

verses.text: These doubtful-minded ones then come to him as to a soothsayer and enquire of him what shall befall them.

sinaiticus.text: And he, the false prophet, having no power of a divine Spirit in himself, speaketh with them according to their enquiries [and according to the lusts of their wickedness],

verses.text: And he, the false prophet, having no power of a divine Spirit in himself, speaketh with them according to their enquiries [and according to the lusts of their wickedness],

sinaiticus.text: and filleth their souls as they themselves wish.

verses.text: and filleth their souls as they themselves wish.

sinaiticus.text: For being empty himself he giveth empty answers to empty enquirers;

verses.text: For being empty himself he giveth empty answers to empty enquirers;

sinaiticus.text: for whatever enquiry may be made of him, he answereth according to the emptiness of the man.

verses.text: for whatever enquiry may be made of him, he answereth according to the emptiness of the man.

sinaiticus.text: But he speaketh also some true words for the devil filleth him with his own spirit, if so be he shall be able to break down some of the righteous.

verses.text: But he speaketh also some true words for the devil filleth him with his own spirit, if so be he shall be able to break down some of the righteous.

sinaiticus.text: So many therefore as are strong in the faith of the Lord, clothed with the truth, cleave not to such spirits, but hold aloof from them;

verses.text: So many therefore as are strong in the faith of the Lord, clothed with the truth, cleave not to such spirits, but hold aloof from them;

sinaiticus.text: but as many as are doubters and frequently change their minds, practise soothsaying like the Gentiles, and bring upon themselves greater sin by their idolatries.

verses.text: but as many as are doubters and frequently change their minds, practise soothsaying like the Gentiles, and bring upon themselves greater sin by their idolatries.

sinaiticus.text: For he that consulteth a false prophet on any matter is an idolater and emptied of the truth, and senseless.

verses.text: For he that consulteth a false prophet on any matter is an idolater and emptied of the truth, and senseless.

sinaiticus.text: but, having the power of deity, speaketh all things of itself, because it is from above, even from the power of the divine Spirit.

verses.text: but, having the power of deity, speaketh all things of itself, because it is from above, even from the power of the divine Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: But the spirit which is consulted, and speaketh according to the desires of men, is earthly and fickle, having no power;

verses.text: But the spirit which is consulted, and speaketh according to the desires of men, is earthly and fickle, having no power;

sinaiticus.text: and it speaketh not at all, unless it be consulted.

verses.text: and it speaketh not at all, unless it be consulted.

sinaiticus.text: How then, Sir, say I, shall a man know who of them is a prophet, and who a false prophet?

verses.text: How then, Sir, say I, shall a man know who of them is a prophet, and who a false prophet?

sinaiticus.text: Hear, saith he, concerning both the prophets;

verses.text: Hear, saith he, concerning both the prophets;

sinaiticus.text: and, as I shall tell thee, so shalt thou test the prophet and the false prophet.

verses.text: and, as I shall tell thee, so shalt thou test the prophet and the false prophet.

sinaiticus.text: By his life test the man that hath the divine Spirit.

verses.text: By his life test the man that hath the divine Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: In the first place, he that hath the Spirit, which is from above,

verses.text: In the first place, he that hath the Spirit, which is from above,

sinaiticus.text: is gentle and tranquil and humble-minded,

verses.text: is gentle and tranquil and humble-minded,

sinaiticus.text: and abstaineth from all wickedness and vain desire of this present world,

verses.text: and abstaineth from all wickedness and vain desire of this present world,

sinaiticus.text: and holdeth himself inferior to all men, and giveth no answer to any man when enquired of, nor speaketh in solitude (for neither doth the Holy Spirit speak when a man wisheth Him to speak);

verses.text: and holdeth himself inferior to all men, and giveth no answer to any man when enquired of, nor speaketh in solitude (for neither doth the Holy Spirit speak when a man wisheth Him to speak);

sinaiticus.text: but the man speaketh then when God wisheth him to speak.

verses.text: but the man speaketh then when God wisheth him to speak.

sinaiticus.text: When then the man who hath the divine Spirit cometh into an assembly of righteous men, who have faith in a divine Spirit,

verses.text: When then the man who hath the divine Spirit cometh into an assembly of righteous men, who have faith in a divine Spirit,

sinaiticus.text: and intercession is made to God by the gathering of those men,

verses.text: and intercession is made to God by the gathering of those men,

sinaiticus.text: then the angel of the prophetic spirit, who is attached to him, filleth the man, and the man, being filled with the Holy Spirit, speaketh to the multitude, according as the Lord willeth.

verses.text: then the angel of the prophetic spirit, who is attached to him, filleth the man, and the man, being filled with the Holy Spirit, speaketh to the multitude, according as the Lord willeth.

sinaiticus.text: In this way then the Spirit of the deity shall be manifest.

verses.text: In this way then the Spirit of the deity shall be manifest.

sinaiticus.text: This then is the greatness of the power as touching the Spirit of the deity of the Lord.

verses.text: This then is the greatness of the power as touching the Spirit of the deity of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now, saith he, concerning the earthly and vain spirit, which hath no power but is foolish.

verses.text: Hear now, saith he, concerning the earthly and vain spirit, which hath no power but is foolish.

sinaiticus.text: In, the first place, that man who seemeth to have a spirit exalteth himself,

verses.text: In, the first place, that man who seemeth to have a spirit exalteth himself,

sinaiticus.text: and desireth to have a chief place,

verses.text: and desireth to have a chief place,

sinaiticus.text: and straight-way he is impudent and shameless and talkative and conversant in many luxuries and in many other deceits, and receiveth money for his prophesying, and if he receiveth not, he prophesieth not.

verses.text: and straight-way he is impudent and shameless and talkative and conversant in many luxuries and in many other deceits, and receiveth money for his prophesying, and if he receiveth not, he prophesieth not.

sinaiticus.text: Now can a divine Spirit receive money and prophesy?

verses.text: Now can a divine Spirit receive money and prophesy?

sinaiticus.text: It is not possible for a prophet of God to do this, but the spirit of such prophets is earthly.

verses.text: It is not possible for a prophet of God to do this, but the spirit of such prophets is earthly.

sinaiticus.text: In the next place, it never approacheth an assembly of righteous men;526

verses.text: In the next place, it never approacheth an assembly of righteous men;526

sinaiticus.text: but avoideth them, and cleaveth to the doubtful-minded and empty,

verses.text: but avoideth them, and cleaveth to the doubtful-minded and empty,

sinaiticus.text: and prophesieth to them in corners, and deceiveth them, speaking all things in emptiness to gratify their desires;

verses.text: and prophesieth to them in corners, and deceiveth them, speaking all things in emptiness to gratify their desires;

sinaiticus.text: for they too are empty whom it answereth.

verses.text: for they too are empty whom it answereth.

sinaiticus.text: For the empty vessel placed together with the empty is not broken, but they agree one with the other.

verses.text: For the empty vessel placed together with the empty is not broken, but they agree one with the other.

sinaiticus.text: But when he comes into an assembly full of righteous men who have a Spirit of deity,

verses.text: But when he comes into an assembly full of righteous men who have a Spirit of deity,

sinaiticus.text: and intercession is made from them,

verses.text: and intercession is made from them,

sinaiticus.text: that man is emptied, an(l the earthly spirit fleeth from him, in fear, and that man is struck dumb and is altogether broken in pieces, being unable to utter a word.

verses.text: that man is emptied, an(l the earthly spirit fleeth from him, in fear, and that man is struck dumb and is altogether broken in pieces, being unable to utter a word.

sinaiticus.text: For, if you pack wine or oil into a closet, and place an empty vessel among them, and again desire to unpack the closet,

verses.text: For, if you pack wine or oil into a closet, and place an empty vessel among them, and again desire to unpack the closet,

sinaiticus.text: the vessel which you placed there empty, empty in like manner you will find it.

verses.text: the vessel which you placed there empty, empty in like manner you will find it.

sinaiticus.text: Thus also the empty prophets, whenever they come unto the spirits of righteous men, are found just such as they came.

verses.text: Thus also the empty prophets, whenever they come unto the spirits of righteous men, are found just such as they came.

sinaiticus.text: I have given thee the life of both kinds of prophets.

verses.text: I have given thee the life of both kinds of prophets.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore test, by his life and his works, the man who says that he is moved by the Spirit.

verses.text: Therefore test, by his life and his works, the man who says that he is moved by the Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: But do thou trust the Spirit that cometh from God, and hath power;

verses.text: But do thou trust the Spirit that cometh from God, and hath power;

sinaiticus.text: but in the earthly and empty spirit put no trust at all;

verses.text: but in the earthly and empty spirit put no trust at all;

sinaiticus.text: for in it there is no power, for it cometh from the devil.

verses.text: for in it there is no power, for it cometh from the devil.

sinaiticus.text: Listen to the parable which I shall tell thee.

verses.text: Listen to the parable which I shall tell thee.

sinaiticus.text: Take a stone, and throw it up to heaven-see if thou canst reach it;

verses.text: Take a stone, and throw it up to heaven-see if thou canst reach it;

sinaiticus.text: or again, take a squirt of water, and squirt it up to heaven-see if thou canst bore through the heaven.

verses.text: or again, take a squirt of water, and squirt it up to heaven-see if thou canst bore through the heaven.

sinaiticus.text: How, Sir, say I, can these things be?

verses.text: How, Sir, say I, can these things be?

sinaiticus.text: For both these things which thou hast mentioned are beyond our power.

verses.text: For both these things which thou hast mentioned are beyond our power.

sinaiticus.text: Well then, saith he, just as these things are beyond our power, so likewise the earthly spirits have no power and are feeble.

verses.text: Well then, saith he, just as these things are beyond our power, so likewise the earthly spirits have no power and are feeble.

sinaiticus.text: Now take the power which cometh from above.

verses.text: Now take the power which cometh from above.

sinaiticus.text: The hail is a very small grain, and yet, when it falleth on a mans head, what pain it causeth! Or again, take a drop which falls on the ground from the tiles, and bores through the stone.

verses.text: The hail is a very small grain, and yet, when it falleth on a mans head, what pain it causeth! Or again, take a drop which falls on the ground from the tiles, and bores through the stone.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me;

verses.text: He saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Remove from thyself all evil desire, and clothe thyself in the desire which is good and holy;

verses.text: Remove from thyself all evil desire, and clothe thyself in the desire which is good and holy;

sinaiticus.text: for clothed with this desire thou shalt hate the evil desire, and shalt bridle and direct it as thou wilt.

verses.text: for clothed with this desire thou shalt hate the evil desire, and shalt bridle and direct it as thou wilt.

sinaiticus.text: For the evil desire is wild, and only tamed with difficulty;

verses.text: For the evil desire is wild, and only tamed with difficulty;

sinaiticus.text: for it is terrible, and by its wildness is very costly to men;

verses.text: for it is terrible, and by its wildness is very costly to men;

sinaiticus.text: more especially if a servant of God get entangled in it, and have no understanding, he is put to fearful costs by it.

verses.text: more especially if a servant of God get entangled in it, and have no understanding, he is put to fearful costs by it.

sinaiticus.text: But it is costly to such men as are not clothed in the good desire, but are mixed up with this life.

verses.text: But it is costly to such men as are not clothed in the good desire, but are mixed up with this life.

sinaiticus.text: These men then it hands over to death.

verses.text: These men then it hands over to death.

sinaiticus.text: Of what sort, Sir, say I, are the works of the evil desire, which hand over men to death?

verses.text: Of what sort, Sir, say I, are the works of the evil desire, which hand over men to death?

sinaiticus.text: Make them known to me, that I may hold aloof from them.

verses.text: Make them known to me, that I may hold aloof from them.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, through what works the evil desire bringeth death to the servants of God.

verses.text: Listen, through what works the evil desire bringeth death to the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: Before all is desire for the wife or husband of another, and for extravagance of wealth, and for many needless dainties, and for drinks and other luxuries, many and foolish.

verses.text: Before all is desire for the wife or husband of another, and for extravagance of wealth, and for many needless dainties, and for drinks and other luxuries, many and foolish.

sinaiticus.text: For every luxury is foolish and vain for the servants of God.

verses.text: For every luxury is foolish and vain for the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: These desires then are evil, and bring death to the servants of God.

verses.text: These desires then are evil, and bring death to the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: For this evil desire is a daughter of the devil.

verses.text: For this evil desire is a daughter of the devil.

sinaiticus.text: Ye must, therefore, abstain from the evil desires, that so abstaining ye may live unto God.

verses.text: Ye must, therefore, abstain from the evil desires, that so abstaining ye may live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: But as many as are mastered by them, and resist them not, are done to death utterly;

verses.text: But as many as are mastered by them, and resist them not, are done to death utterly;

sinaiticus.text: for these desires are deadly.

verses.text: for these desires are deadly.

sinaiticus.text: But do thou clothe thyself in the desire of righteousness, and, having armed thyself with the fear of the Lord, resist them.

verses.text: But do thou clothe thyself in the desire of righteousness, and, having armed thyself with the fear of the Lord, resist them.

sinaiticus.text: For the fear of God dwelleth in the good desire.

verses.text: For the fear of God dwelleth in the good desire.

sinaiticus.text: If the evil desire shall see thee armed with the fear of God and resisting itself, it shall flee far from thee, and shall no more be seen of thee, being in fear of thine arms.

verses.text: If the evil desire shall see thee armed with the fear of God and resisting itself, it shall flee far from thee, and shall no more be seen of thee, being in fear of thine arms.

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore, when thou art crowned for thy victory over it, come to the desire of righteousness,

verses.text: Do thou therefore, when thou art crowned for thy victory over it, come to the desire of righteousness,

sinaiticus.text: and deliver to her the victors prize which thou hast received, and serve her, according as she herself desireth.

verses.text: and deliver to her the victors prize which thou hast received, and serve her, according as she herself desireth.

sinaiticus.text: I would fain know, Sir, say I, in what ways I ought to serve the and the fear of the Lord, faith and gentleness, and as many good deeds as are like these.

verses.text: I would fain know, Sir, say I, in what ways I ought to serve the and the fear of the Lord, faith and gentleness, and as many good deeds as are like these.

sinaiticus.text: Practising these thou shalt be well-pleasing as a servant of God, and shalt live unto Him;

verses.text: Practising these thou shalt be well-pleasing as a servant of God, and shalt live unto Him;

sinaiticus.text: So he completed the twelve commandments, and he saith to me;

verses.text: So he completed the twelve commandments, and he saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Thou hast these commandments;

verses.text: Thou hast these commandments;

sinaiticus.text: walk in them, and exhort thy hearers that their ministration, which I give thee, fulfil thou with all diligence to the end, and thou shalt effect much.

verses.text: walk in them, and exhort thy hearers that their ministration, which I give thee, fulfil thou with all diligence to the end, and thou shalt effect much.

sinaiticus.text: For thou shalt find favour among those who are about to repent, and they shall obey thy words.

verses.text: For thou shalt find favour among those who are about to repent, and they shall obey thy words.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him;

verses.text: I say to him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, these commandments are great and beautiful and glorious, and are able to gladden the heart of the man who is able to man, for they are very hard.

verses.text: Sir, these commandments are great and beautiful and glorious, and are able to gladden the heart of the man who is able to man, for they are very hard.

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said unto me;

verses.text: He answered and said unto me;

sinaiticus.text: If thou set it before thyself that they can be kept, thou wilt easily keep them, and they will not be hard;

verses.text: If thou set it before thyself that they can be kept, thou wilt easily keep them, and they will not be hard;

sinaiticus.text: but if it once enter into thy heart that they cannot be kept by a man, thou wilt not keep them.

verses.text: but if it once enter into thy heart that they cannot be kept by a man, thou wilt not keep them.

sinaiticus.text: But now I say unto thee;

verses.text: But now I say unto thee;

sinaiticus.text: if thou keep then, not, but neglect them, thou shalt not have salvation, neither thy children nor thy household, since thou hast already pronounced judgment against thyself that these commandments cannot be kept by a man.

verses.text: if thou keep then, not, but neglect them, thou shalt not have salvation, neither thy children nor thy household, since thou hast already pronounced judgment against thyself that these commandments cannot be kept by a man.

sinaiticus.text: And these things he said to me very angrily, so that I was confounded, and feared him exceedingly;

verses.text: And these things he said to me very angrily, so that I was confounded, and feared him exceedingly;

sinaiticus.text: for his form was changed, so that a man could not endure his anger.

verses.text: for his form was changed, so that a man could not endure his anger.

sinaiticus.text: And when he saw that I was altogether disturbed and confounded, he began to speak more kindly [and cheerfully] to me, and he saith;

verses.text: And when he saw that I was altogether disturbed and confounded, he began to speak more kindly [and cheerfully] to me, and he saith;

sinaiticus.text: Foolish fellow, void of understanding and of doubtful mind,

verses.text: Foolish fellow, void of understanding and of doubtful mind,

sinaiticus.text: perceivest thou not the glory of God, how great and mighty and

verses.text: perceivest thou not the glory of God, how great and mighty and

sinaiticus.text: how that He created the world for mans sake, and subjected all His creation to man, and gave all authority to him, that he should be master over all things under the heaven?

verses.text: how that He created the world for mans sake, and subjected all His creation to man, and gave all authority to him, that he should be master over all things under the heaven?

sinaiticus.text: If then, man is lord of all the creatures of God and mastereth all things, cannot he also master these commandments?

verses.text: If then, man is lord of all the creatures of God and mastereth all things, cannot he also master these commandments?

sinaiticus.text: Aye, saith he, the man that hath the Lord in his heart can master [all things and] all these commandments.

verses.text: Aye, saith he, the man that hath the Lord in his heart can master [all things and] all these commandments.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have the Lord on their lips, while their heart is hardened, and are far from the Lord, to them these commandments are hard and inaccessible.

verses.text: But they that have the Lord on their lips, while their heart is hardened, and are far from the Lord, to them these commandments are hard and inaccessible.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore do ye, who are empty and fickle in the faith, set your Lord in your heart, and ye shall perceive that nothing is easier than these commandments, nor sweeter, nor more gentle.

verses.text: Therefore do ye, who are empty and fickle in the faith, set your Lord in your heart, and ye shall perceive that nothing is easier than these commandments, nor sweeter, nor more gentle.

sinaiticus.text: Be ye converted, ye that walk after the commandments of devil, (the commandments which are so) difficult and bitter and wild and riotous;

verses.text: Be ye converted, ye that walk after the commandments of devil, (the commandments which are so) difficult and bitter and wild and riotous;

sinaiticus.text: and fear not the devil, for there is no power in him against you.

verses.text: and fear not the devil, for there is no power in him against you.

sinaiticus.text: For I will be with you, I, the angel of repentance, who have the mastery over him.

verses.text: For I will be with you, I, the angel of repentance, who have the mastery over him.

sinaiticus.text: The devil hath fear alone, but his fear hath no force.

verses.text: The devil hath fear alone, but his fear hath no force.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him, Sir, listen to a few words from me.

verses.text: I say to him, Sir, listen to a few words from me.

sinaiticus.text: Say what thou wilt, saith he.

verses.text: Say what thou wilt, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Man, Sir, I say, is eager to keep the commandments of strengthened in His commandments, and be subject to them;

verses.text: Man, Sir, I say, is eager to keep the commandments of strengthened in His commandments, and be subject to them;

sinaiticus.text: but the devil is hard and overmastereth them.

verses.text: but the devil is hard and overmastereth them.

sinaiticus.text: He cannot, saith he, overmaster the servants of God, who set their hope on Him with their whole heart.

verses.text: He cannot, saith he, overmaster the servants of God, who set their hope on Him with their whole heart.

sinaiticus.text: The devil can wrestle with them, but he cannot overthrow them.

verses.text: The devil can wrestle with them, but he cannot overthrow them.

sinaiticus.text: If then ye resist him, he will be vanquished, and will flee from you disgraced.

verses.text: If then ye resist him, he will be vanquished, and will flee from you disgraced.

sinaiticus.text: But as many, saith he, as are utterly empty, fear the devil as if he had power.

verses.text: But as many, saith he, as are utterly empty, fear the devil as if he had power.

sinaiticus.text: When a man has filled amply sufficient jars with good wine, and among these jars a few are quite empty, he comes to the jars, and does not examine the full ones, for he knows that they are full;

verses.text: When a man has filled amply sufficient jars with good wine, and among these jars a few are quite empty, he comes to the jars, and does not examine the full ones, for he knows that they are full;

sinaiticus.text: but he examineth the empty ones, fearing lest they have turned sour.

verses.text: but he examineth the empty ones, fearing lest they have turned sour.

sinaiticus.text: For empty jars soon turn sour, and the taste of the wine is spoilt.

verses.text: For empty jars soon turn sour, and the taste of the wine is spoilt.

sinaiticus.text: So also the devil cometh to all the servants of Cod tempting them.530

verses.text: So also the devil cometh to all the servants of Cod tempting them.530

sinaiticus.text: As many then as are complete in the faith, oppose him mightily, and he departeth from them, not having a place where he can find an entrance.

verses.text: As many then as are complete in the faith, oppose him mightily, and he departeth from them, not having a place where he can find an entrance.

sinaiticus.text: So he cometh next to the empty ones, and finding a place goeth into them, and further he doeth what he willeth in them, and they become submissive slaves to him.

verses.text: So he cometh next to the empty ones, and finding a place goeth into them, and further he doeth what he willeth in them, and they become submissive slaves to him.

sinaiticus.text: But I, the angel of repentance, say unto you;

verses.text: But I, the angel of repentance, say unto you;

sinaiticus.text: Fear not the devil;

verses.text: Fear not the devil;

sinaiticus.text: for I was sent, saith he, to be with you who repent with your whole heart, and to strengthen you in the faith.

verses.text: for I was sent, saith he, to be with you who repent with your whole heart, and to strengthen you in the faith.

sinaiticus.text: Believe, therefore, on God, ye who by reason of your sins have despaired of your life, and are adding to your sins, and weighing down your life;

verses.text: Believe, therefore, on God, ye who by reason of your sins have despaired of your life, and are adding to your sins, and weighing down your life;

sinaiticus.text: for if ye turn unto the Lord with your whole heart,

verses.text: for if ye turn unto the Lord with your whole heart,

sinaiticus.text: and work righteousness the remaining days of your life, and serve Him rightly according to His will, He will give healing to your former sins, and ye shall have power to master the works of the devil.

verses.text: and work righteousness the remaining days of your life, and serve Him rightly according to His will, He will give healing to your former sins, and ye shall have power to master the works of the devil.

sinaiticus.text: But of the threatening of the devil fear not at all;

verses.text: But of the threatening of the devil fear not at all;

sinaiticus.text: for he is unstrung, like the sinews of a dead man.

verses.text: for he is unstrung, like the sinews of a dead man.

sinaiticus.text: Hear me therefore, and fear Him, Who is able to do all things, to save and to destroy, and observe these commandments, and ye shall live unto God.

verses.text: Hear me therefore, and fear Him, Who is able to do all things, to save and to destroy, and observe these commandments, and ye shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him, Sir, now am I strengthened in all the ordinances of the Lord, because thou art with me;

verses.text: I say to him, Sir, now am I strengthened in all the ordinances of the Lord, because thou art with me;

sinaiticus.text: and I know that thou wilt crush all the power of the devil, and we shall be masters over him, and shall prevail over all his works.

verses.text: and I know that thou wilt crush all the power of the devil, and we shall be masters over him, and shall prevail over all his works.

sinaiticus.text: And I hope, Sir, that I am now able to keep these commandments which thou hast commanded, the Lord enabling me.

verses.text: And I hope, Sir, that I am now able to keep these commandments which thou hast commanded, the Lord enabling me.

sinaiticus.text: Thou shalt keep them, saith he, if thy heart be found pure with the Lord;

verses.text: Thou shalt keep them, saith he, if thy heart be found pure with the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: PARABLES WHICH HE SPAKE WITH ME.

verses.text: PARABLES WHICH HE SPAKE WITH ME.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me;

verses.text: He saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Ye know that ye, who far from this city.

verses.text: Ye know that ye, who far from this city.

sinaiticus.text: If then ye know your city, in which ye shall dwell, why do ye here prepare fields and expensive displays and buildings and dwelling- chambers which are superfluous?

verses.text: If then ye know your city, in which ye shall dwell, why do ye here prepare fields and expensive displays and buildings and dwelling- chambers which are superfluous?

sinaiticus.text: He, therefore, that prepareth these things for this city does not

verses.text: He, therefore, that prepareth these things for this city does not

sinaiticus.text: O foolish and double-minded and miserable man, perceivest thou not that all these things are foreign, and are under the power of another?

verses.text: O foolish and double-minded and miserable man, perceivest thou not that all these things are foreign, and are under the power of another?

sinaiticus.text: For the lord of this city shall say, “I do not wish thee to dwell in my city;

verses.text: For the lord of this city shall say, “I do not wish thee to dwell in my city;

sinaiticus.text: go forth from this city, for thou dost not conform to my laws.”

verses.text: go forth from this city, for thou dost not conform to my laws.”

sinaiticus.text: Thou, therefore, who hast fields and dwellings and many other possessions,

verses.text: Thou, therefore, who hast fields and dwellings and many other possessions,

sinaiticus.text: when thou art cast out by him, what wilt thou do with thy field and thy house and all the other things that thou preparedst for thyself?

verses.text: when thou art cast out by him, what wilt thou do with thy field and thy house and all the other things that thou preparedst for thyself?

sinaiticus.text: For the lord of this country saith to thee justly, “Either conform to my laws, or depart from my country.”

verses.text: For the lord of this country saith to thee justly, “Either conform to my laws, or depart from my country.”

sinaiticus.text: What then shalt thou do, who art under law in thine own city?

verses.text: What then shalt thou do, who art under law in thine own city?

sinaiticus.text: For the sake of thy fields and the rest of thy possessions wilt thou altogether repudiate thy law, and walk according to the law of this city?

verses.text: For the sake of thy fields and the rest of thy possessions wilt thou altogether repudiate thy law, and walk according to the law of this city?

sinaiticus.text: Take heed, lest it be inexpedient to repudiate thy law;

verses.text: Take heed, lest it be inexpedient to repudiate thy law;

sinaiticus.text: for if thou shouldest desire to return again to thy city, thou shalt surely not be received [because thou didst repudiate the law of thy city], and shalt be shut out from it.

verses.text: for if thou shouldest desire to return again to thy city, thou shalt surely not be received [because thou didst repudiate the law of thy city], and shalt be shut out from it.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed therefore;

verses.text: Take heed therefore;

sinaiticus.text: as dwelling in a strange land prepare nothing more for thyself but a competency which is sufficient for thee,

verses.text: as dwelling in a strange land prepare nothing more for thyself but a competency which is sufficient for thee,

sinaiticus.text: and make ready that,

verses.text: and make ready that,

sinaiticus.text: whensoever the master of this city may desire to cast thee out for thine opposition to his law, thou mayest go forth from his city and depart into thine own city, and use thine own law joyfully, free from all insult.

verses.text: whensoever the master of this city may desire to cast thee out for thine opposition to his law, thou mayest go forth from his city and depart into thine own city, and use thine own law joyfully, free from all insult.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed therefore, ye that serve God and have Him in your heart work the works of God being mindful of His commandments and of the promises which He made, and believe Him that He will perform them, if His commandments be kept.

verses.text: Take heed therefore, ye that serve God and have Him in your heart work the works of God being mindful of His commandments and of the promises which He made, and believe Him that He will perform them, if His commandments be kept.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, instead of fields buy ye souls that are in trouble, as each is able, and visit widows and orphans, and neglect them not;

verses.text: Therefore, instead of fields buy ye souls that are in trouble, as each is able, and visit widows and orphans, and neglect them not;

sinaiticus.text: and spend your riches and all your displays, which ye received from God, on fields and houses of this kind.

verses.text: and spend your riches and all your displays, which ye received from God, on fields and houses of this kind.

sinaiticus.text: For to this end the Master enriched you, that ye might perform these ministrations for Him.

verses.text: For to this end the Master enriched you, that ye might perform these ministrations for Him.

sinaiticus.text: It is much better to purchase fields and houses of this kind, which thou wilt find in thine own city, when thou visitest it.

verses.text: It is much better to purchase fields and houses of this kind, which thou wilt find in thine own city, when thou visitest it.

sinaiticus.text: This lavish expenditure is beautiful and joyous, not bringing sadness or fear, but bringing joy.532

verses.text: This lavish expenditure is beautiful and joyous, not bringing sadness or fear, but bringing joy.532

sinaiticus.text: The expenditure of the heathen then practise not ye;

verses.text: The expenditure of the heathen then practise not ye;

sinaiticus.text: for it is not convenient for you the servants of God.

verses.text: for it is not convenient for you the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: But practise your own expenditure, in which ye can rejoice;

verses.text: But practise your own expenditure, in which ye can rejoice;

sinaiticus.text: and do not corrupt, neither touch that which is another mans, nor lust after it;

verses.text: and do not corrupt, neither touch that which is another mans, nor lust after it;

sinaiticus.text: for it is wicked to lust after other men’s possessions.

verses.text: for it is wicked to lust after other men’s possessions.

sinaiticus.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

verses.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

sinaiticus.text: As I walked in the field, and noticed an elm and a vine,

verses.text: As I walked in the field, and noticed an elm and a vine,

sinaiticus.text: and was distinguishing them and their fruits, the shepherd appeareth thinking, [Sir,] say I, about the elm and the vine, that they are excellently suited the one to the other.

verses.text: and was distinguishing them and their fruits, the shepherd appeareth thinking, [Sir,] say I, about the elm and the vine, that they are excellently suited the one to the other.

sinaiticus.text: These two trees, saith he, are appointed for a type to the servants of God.

verses.text: These two trees, saith he, are appointed for a type to the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: I would fain know, say I, the type contained in these trees, of which thou speakest.

verses.text: I would fain know, say I, the type contained in these trees, of which thou speakest.

sinaiticus.text: Seest thou, saith he, the elm and the vine?

verses.text: Seest thou, saith he, the elm and the vine?

sinaiticus.text: I see them, Sir, say I.

verses.text: I see them, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: This vine, saith he, beareth fruit, but the elm is an unfruitful stock.

verses.text: This vine, saith he, beareth fruit, but the elm is an unfruitful stock.

sinaiticus.text: Yet this vine, except it climb up the elm, cannot bear much fruit when it is spread on the ground;

verses.text: Yet this vine, except it climb up the elm, cannot bear much fruit when it is spread on the ground;

sinaiticus.text: and such fruit as it beareth is rotten, because it is not suspended upon the elm.

verses.text: and such fruit as it beareth is rotten, because it is not suspended upon the elm.

sinaiticus.text: When then the vine is attached to the elm, it beareth fruit both from itself and from the elm.

verses.text: When then the vine is attached to the elm, it beareth fruit both from itself and from the elm.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then that the elm also beareth fruit, not less than the vine, but rather more.

verses.text: Thou seest then that the elm also beareth fruit, not less than the vine, but rather more.

sinaiticus.text: How more, Sir? say I.

verses.text: How more, Sir? say I.

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, the vine, when hanging upon the elm, bears its fruit in abundance, and in good condition;

verses.text: Because, saith he, the vine, when hanging upon the elm, bears its fruit in abundance, and in good condition;

sinaiticus.text: but, when spread on the ground, it beareth little fruit, and that rotten.

verses.text: but, when spread on the ground, it beareth little fruit, and that rotten.

sinaiticus.text: This parable therefore is applicable to the servants of God, to poor and to rich alike.

verses.text: This parable therefore is applicable to the servants of God, to poor and to rich alike.

sinaiticus.text: How, Sir? say I;

verses.text: How, Sir? say I;

sinaiticus.text: instruct me.

verses.text: instruct me.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: the rich man hath much wealth, but in the things of the Lord he is poor, being distracted about his riches, and his confession and

verses.text: the rich man hath much wealth, but in the things of the Lord he is poor, being distracted about his riches, and his confession and

sinaiticus.text: and even that which he giveth is small and weak and hath not power above.

verses.text: and even that which he giveth is small and weak and hath not power above.

sinaiticus.text: When then the rich man goeth up to the poor, and assisteth him in his needs,

verses.text: When then the rich man goeth up to the poor, and assisteth him in his needs,

sinaiticus.text: believing that for what he doth to the poor man he shall be able to obtain a reward with God-because the poor man is rich in intercession [and confession],

verses.text: believing that for what he doth to the poor man he shall be able to obtain a reward with God-because the poor man is rich in intercession [and confession],

sinaiticus.text: and his intercession hath great power with God-the rich man then supplieth all things to the poor man without wavering.

verses.text: and his intercession hath great power with God-the rich man then supplieth all things to the poor man without wavering.

sinaiticus.text: But the poor man being supplied by the rich maketh intercession for him, thanking God for him that gave to him.

verses.text: But the poor man being supplied by the rich maketh intercession for him, thanking God for him that gave to him.

sinaiticus.text: And the other is still more zealous to assist the poor man, that he may he continuous in his life:

verses.text: And the other is still more zealous to assist the poor man, that he may he continuous in his life:

sinaiticus.text: for he knoweth that the intercession of the poor man is acceptable and rich before God.

verses.text: for he knoweth that the intercession of the poor man is acceptable and rich before God.

sinaiticus.text: They both then accomplish their work;

verses.text: They both then accomplish their work;

sinaiticus.text: the poor man maketh intercession, wherein he is rich [which he received of the Lord];

verses.text: the poor man maketh intercession, wherein he is rich [which he received of the Lord];

sinaiticus.text: this he rendereth again to the Lord Who supplieth him with it.

verses.text: this he rendereth again to the Lord Who supplieth him with it.

sinaiticus.text: The rich man too in like manner furnisheth to the poor man, nothing doubting, the riches which he received from the Lord.

verses.text: The rich man too in like manner furnisheth to the poor man, nothing doubting, the riches which he received from the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And this work is great and acceptable with God,

verses.text: And this work is great and acceptable with God,

sinaiticus.text: because  hath understanding concerning his riches, and worketh for the poor man from the bounties of the Lord, and accomplisheth the ministration of the Lord rightly.

verses.text: because  hath understanding concerning his riches, and worketh for the poor man from the bounties of the Lord, and accomplisheth the ministration of the Lord rightly.

sinaiticus.text: In the sight of men then the elm seemeth not to bear fruit,

verses.text: In the sight of men then the elm seemeth not to bear fruit,

sinaiticus.text: and they know not, neither perceive,

verses.text: and they know not, neither perceive,

sinaiticus.text: that if there cometh a drought, the elm having water nurtureth the vine, and the vine having a constant supply of water beareth fruit twofold, both for itself and for the elm.

verses.text: that if there cometh a drought, the elm having water nurtureth the vine, and the vine having a constant supply of water beareth fruit twofold, both for itself and for the elm.

sinaiticus.text: So likewise the poor, by interceding with the Lord for the rich, establish their riches, and again the rich, supplying their needs to the poor, establish their souls.

verses.text: So likewise the poor, by interceding with the Lord for the rich, establish their riches, and again the rich, supplying their needs to the poor, establish their souls.

sinaiticus.text: So then both are made partners in the righteous work.

verses.text: So then both are made partners in the righteous work.

sinaiticus.text: He then that doeth these things shall not be abandoned of God, but shall be written in the books of the living.

verses.text: He then that doeth these things shall not be abandoned of God, but shall be written in the books of the living.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are the rich, who understand also that they are enriched from the Lord.

verses.text: Blessed are the rich, who understand also that they are enriched from the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

verses.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

sinaiticus.text: He showed me many trees which had no leaves, but they seemed to me to be, as it were, withered for they were all alike.534

verses.text: He showed me many trees which had no leaves, but they seemed to me to be, as it were, withered for they were all alike.534

sinaiticus.text: And he all alike, and are withered.

verses.text: And he all alike, and are withered.

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said to me;

verses.text: He answered and said to me;

sinaiticus.text: These trees that thou seest are they that dwell in this world.

verses.text: These trees that thou seest are they that dwell in this world.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, are they as if they were withered, and alike?

verses.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, are they as if they were withered, and alike?

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, neither the righteous are distinguishable, nor the sinners in this world, but they are alike.

verses.text: Because, saith he, neither the righteous are distinguishable, nor the sinners in this world, but they are alike.

sinaiticus.text: For this world is winter to the righteous, and they are not distinguishable, as they dwell with the sinners.

verses.text: For this world is winter to the righteous, and they are not distinguishable, as they dwell with the sinners.

sinaiticus.text: For as in the winter the trees, having shed their leaves, are alike, and are not distinguishable, which are withered,

verses.text: For as in the winter the trees, having shed their leaves, are alike, and are not distinguishable, which are withered,

sinaiticus.text: and which alive, so also in this world neither the just nor the sinners are distinguishable, but they are all alike.

verses.text: and which alive, so also in this world neither the just nor the sinners are distinguishable, but they are all alike.

sinaiticus.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

verses.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

sinaiticus.text: He showed me many trees again, some of them sprouting, and others withered, and he saith to me;

verses.text: He showed me many trees again, some of them sprouting, and others withered, and he saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Seest thou, saith he, these trees?

verses.text: Seest thou, saith he, these trees?

sinaiticus.text: I see them, Sir, say I, some of them sprouting, and others withered.

verses.text: I see them, Sir, say I, some of them sprouting, and others withered.

sinaiticus.text: These trees, saith he, that are sprouting are the righteous, who shall dwell in the world to come;

verses.text: These trees, saith he, that are sprouting are the righteous, who shall dwell in the world to come;

sinaiticus.text: for the world to come is summer to the righteous, but winter to the sinners.

verses.text: for the world to come is summer to the righteous, but winter to the sinners.

sinaiticus.text: When then the mercy of the Lord shall shine forth, then they that serve Cod shall be made manifest;

verses.text: When then the mercy of the Lord shall shine forth, then they that serve Cod shall be made manifest;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and all men shall be made manifest.

verses.text: yea, and all men shall be made manifest.

sinaiticus.text: For as in summer the fruits of each several tree are made manifest,

verses.text: For as in summer the fruits of each several tree are made manifest,

sinaiticus.text: and are recognised of what sort they are,

verses.text: and are recognised of what sort they are,

sinaiticus.text: so also the fruits of the righteous shall be manifest, and all [even the very smallest] shall be known to be flourishing in that world.

verses.text: so also the fruits of the righteous shall be manifest, and all [even the very smallest] shall be known to be flourishing in that world.

sinaiticus.text: But the Gentiles and the sinners,

verses.text: But the Gentiles and the sinners,

sinaiticus.text: just as thou sawest the trees which were withered,

verses.text: just as thou sawest the trees which were withered,

sinaiticus.text: even such shall they be found, withered and unfruitful in that world, and shall be burnt up as fuel, and shall be manifest, because their practice in their life hath been evil.

verses.text: even such shall they be found, withered and unfruitful in that world, and shall be burnt up as fuel, and shall be manifest, because their practice in their life hath been evil.

sinaiticus.text: For the sinners shall be burned, because they sinned and repented not;

verses.text: For the sinners shall be burned, because they sinned and repented not;

sinaiticus.text: and the Gentiles shall be burned, because they knew not Him that created them.

verses.text: and the Gentiles shall be burned, because they knew not Him that created them.

sinaiticus.text: Do thou therefore bear fruit, that in that summer thy, fruit may be

verses.text: Do thou therefore bear fruit, that in that summer thy, fruit may be

sinaiticus.text: But abstain from overmuch business, and thou shalt never fall into any sin.

verses.text: But abstain from overmuch business, and thou shalt never fall into any sin.

sinaiticus.text: For they that busy themselves overmuch, sin much also, being distracted about their business, and in no wise serving their own Lord.

verses.text: For they that busy themselves overmuch, sin much also, being distracted about their business, and in no wise serving their own Lord.

sinaiticus.text: How then, saith he, can such a man ask anything of the Lord and receive it, seeing that he serveth not the Lord?

verses.text: How then, saith he, can such a man ask anything of the Lord and receive it, seeing that he serveth not the Lord?

sinaiticus.text: [For] they that serve Him, these shall receive their petitions, but they that serve not the Lord, these shall receive nothing.

verses.text: [For] they that serve Him, these shall receive their petitions, but they that serve not the Lord, these shall receive nothing.

sinaiticus.text: But if any one work one single action, he is able also to serve the Lord;

verses.text: But if any one work one single action, he is able also to serve the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: for his mind shall not be corrupted from  the Lord, but he shall serve Him, because he keepeth his mind pure.

verses.text: for his mind shall not be corrupted from  the Lord, but he shall serve Him, because he keepeth his mind pure.

sinaiticus.text: If therefore thou doest these things, thou shalt be able to bear fruit unto the world to come;

verses.text: If therefore thou doest these things, thou shalt be able to bear fruit unto the world to come;

sinaiticus.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

verses.text: ANOTHER PARABLE.

sinaiticus.text: As I was fasting and seated on a certain mountain, and giving thanks to the Lord for all that He had done unto me, I see the morn?

verses.text: As I was fasting and seated on a certain mountain, and giving thanks to the Lord for all that He had done unto me, I see the morn?

sinaiticus.text: “Because, Sir, say I, I am keeping a station.

verses.text: “Because, Sir, say I, I am keeping a station.

sinaiticus.text: What, saith he, is a station?

verses.text: What, saith he, is a station?

sinaiticus.text: I am fasting, Sir, say I.

verses.text: I am fasting, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: And what, saith he, is this fast?

verses.text: And what, saith he, is this fast?

sinaiticus.text: As I was accustomed, Sir, say I, so I fast.

verses.text: As I was accustomed, Sir, say I, so I fast.

sinaiticus.text: Ye know not, saith he, how to fast unto the Lord, neither is this a fast, this unprofitable fast which ye make unto Him.

verses.text: Ye know not, saith he, how to fast unto the Lord, neither is this a fast, this unprofitable fast which ye make unto Him.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, sayest thou this?

verses.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, sayest thou this?

sinaiticus.text: I tell thee, saith he, that this is not a fast, wherein ye think to fast;

verses.text: I tell thee, saith he, that this is not a fast, wherein ye think to fast;

sinaiticus.text: but I will teach thee what is a complete fast and acceptable to the Lord.

verses.text: but I will teach thee what is a complete fast and acceptable to the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: God desireth not such a vain fast;

verses.text: God desireth not such a vain fast;

sinaiticus.text: for by so fasting unto God thou shalt do nothing for righteousness.

verses.text: for by so fasting unto God thou shalt do nothing for righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: But fast thou such a fast as this;

verses.text: But fast thou such a fast as this;

sinaiticus.text: do no wickedness in thy life, and serve the Lord with a pure heart;

verses.text: do no wickedness in thy life, and serve the Lord with a pure heart;

sinaiticus.text: observe His commandments and walk in His ordinances, and let no evil desire rise up in thy heart;

verses.text: observe His commandments and walk in His ordinances, and let no evil desire rise up in thy heart;

sinaiticus.text: but believe God.

verses.text: but believe God.

sinaiticus.text: Then, if thou shalt do these things, and fear Him, and control thyself from every evil deed, thou shalt live unto God;536

verses.text: Then, if thou shalt do these things, and fear Him, and control thyself from every evil deed, thou shalt live unto God;536

sinaiticus.text: and if thou do these things, thou shalt accomplish a great fast, and one acceptable to God.

verses.text: and if thou do these things, thou shalt accomplish a great fast, and one acceptable to God.

sinaiticus.text: Hear the parable which I shall tell thee relating to fasting.

verses.text: Hear the parable which I shall tell thee relating to fasting.

sinaiticus.text: A certain man had an estate, and many slaves, and a portion of his estate he planted as a vineyard;

verses.text: A certain man had an estate, and many slaves, and a portion of his estate he planted as a vineyard;

sinaiticus.text: and choosing out a certain slave who was trusty and well-pleasing (and) held in honour, he called him to him and saith unto him:

verses.text: and choosing out a certain slave who was trusty and well-pleasing (and) held in honour, he called him to him and saith unto him:

sinaiticus.text: “Take this vineyard, and fence it [till I come], but do nothing else to the vineyard.

verses.text: “Take this vineyard, and fence it [till I come], but do nothing else to the vineyard.

sinaiticus.text: Now keep this my commandment, and thou shalt be free in my house.”

verses.text: Now keep this my commandment, and thou shalt be free in my house.”

sinaiticus.text: Then the master of the servant went away to travel abroad.

verses.text: Then the master of the servant went away to travel abroad.

sinaiticus.text: When then he had gone away, the servant took and fenced the vineyard;

verses.text: When then he had gone away, the servant took and fenced the vineyard;

sinaiticus.text: and having finished the fencing of the vineyard, he noticed that the vineyard was full of weeds.

verses.text: and having finished the fencing of the vineyard, he noticed that the vineyard was full of weeds.

sinaiticus.text: So he reasoned within himself, saying, “ This command of my lord I have carried out.

verses.text: So he reasoned within himself, saying, “ This command of my lord I have carried out.

sinaiticus.text: I will next dig this vineyard, and it shall be neater when it is digged;

verses.text: I will next dig this vineyard, and it shall be neater when it is digged;

sinaiticus.text: and when it hath no weeds it will yield more fruit, because not choked by the weeds.”

verses.text: and when it hath no weeds it will yield more fruit, because not choked by the weeds.”

sinaiticus.text: He took and digged the vineyard, and all the weeds that were in the vineyard he plucked up.

verses.text: He took and digged the vineyard, and all the weeds that were in the vineyard he plucked up.

sinaiticus.text: And that vineyard became very neat and flourishing, when it had no weeds to choke it.

verses.text: And that vineyard became very neat and flourishing, when it had no weeds to choke it.

sinaiticus.text: After a time the master of the servant came, and he went into the vineyard.

verses.text: After a time the master of the servant came, and he went into the vineyard.

sinaiticus.text: And seeing the vineyard fenced neatly, and digged as well, and [all] the weeds plucked up, and the vines flourishing, he rejoiced [exceedingly] at what his servant had done.

verses.text: And seeing the vineyard fenced neatly, and digged as well, and [all] the weeds plucked up, and the vines flourishing, he rejoiced [exceedingly] at what his servant had done.

sinaiticus.text: So he called his beloved son, who was his heir,

verses.text: So he called his beloved son, who was his heir,

sinaiticus.text: and the friends who were his advisers, and told them what he had commanded his servant, and how much he had found done.

verses.text: and the friends who were his advisers, and told them what he had commanded his servant, and how much he had found done.

sinaiticus.text: And they rejoiced with the servant at the testimony which his master had borne to him.

verses.text: And they rejoiced with the servant at the testimony which his master had borne to him.

sinaiticus.text: And he saith to them;

verses.text: And he saith to them;

sinaiticus.text: “I promised this servant his freedom, if he should keep the commandment which I commanded him;

verses.text: “I promised this servant his freedom, if he should keep the commandment which I commanded him;

sinaiticus.text: but he kept my commandment and did a good work besides to my

verses.text: but he kept my commandment and did a good work besides to my

sinaiticus.text: For this work therefore which he has done, I desire to make him joint-heir with my son, because, when the good thought struck him, he did not neglect it, but fulfilled it.”

verses.text: For this work therefore which he has done, I desire to make him joint-heir with my son, because, when the good thought struck him, he did not neglect it, but fulfilled it.”

sinaiticus.text: In this purpose the son of the master agreed with him, that the servant should be made joint-heir with the son.

verses.text: In this purpose the son of the master agreed with him, that the servant should be made joint-heir with the son.

sinaiticus.text: After some few days, his master made a feast, and sent to him many dainties from the feast.

verses.text: After some few days, his master made a feast, and sent to him many dainties from the feast.

sinaiticus.text: But when the servant received [the dainties sent to him by the master], he took what was sufficient for him, and distributed the rest to his fellow-servants.

verses.text: But when the servant received [the dainties sent to him by the master], he took what was sufficient for him, and distributed the rest to his fellow-servants.

sinaiticus.text: And his fellow-servants, when they received the dainties, rejoiced, and began to pray for him,

verses.text: And his fellow-servants, when they received the dainties, rejoiced, and began to pray for him,

sinaiticus.text: that he might find greater favour with the master, because he had treated them so handsomely.

verses.text: that he might find greater favour with the master, because he had treated them so handsomely.

sinaiticus.text: All these things which had taken place his master heard, and again rejoiced greatly at his deed.

verses.text: All these things which had taken place his master heard, and again rejoiced greatly at his deed.

sinaiticus.text: So the master called together again his friends and his son, and announced to them the deed that he had done with regard to his dainties which he had received;

verses.text: So the master called together again his friends and his son, and announced to them the deed that he had done with regard to his dainties which he had received;

sinaiticus.text: I say, Sir, I understand not these parables, neither can I apprehend thee, saith he;

verses.text: I say, Sir, I understand not these parables, neither can I apprehend thee, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: and will show thee whatsoever things I shall speak with thee.

verses.text: and will show thee whatsoever things I shall speak with thee.

sinaiticus.text: Keep the commandments of the Lord, and thou shalt be well- pleasing to God, and shalt be enrolled among the number of them that keep His commandments.

verses.text: Keep the commandments of the Lord, and thou shalt be well- pleasing to God, and shalt be enrolled among the number of them that keep His commandments.

sinaiticus.text: But if thou do any good thing outside the commandment of God, thou shalt win for thyself more exceeding glory, and shalt be more glorious in the sight of God than thou wouldest otherwise have been.

verses.text: But if thou do any good thing outside the commandment of God, thou shalt win for thyself more exceeding glory, and shalt be more glorious in the sight of God than thou wouldest otherwise have been.

sinaiticus.text: If then, while thou keepest the commandments of God, thou add these services likewise, thou shalt rejoice, if thou observe them according to my commandment.

verses.text: If then, while thou keepest the commandments of God, thou add these services likewise, thou shalt rejoice, if thou observe them according to my commandment.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him, Sir, whatsoever thou commandest me, I will keep it;

verses.text: I say to him, Sir, whatsoever thou commandest me, I will keep it;

sinaiticus.text: for I know that thou art with me.

verses.text: for I know that thou art with me.

sinaiticus.text: I will be with thee, saith he, because thou hast so great zeal for doing good;

verses.text: I will be with thee, saith he, because thou hast so great zeal for doing good;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and I will be with all, saith he, whosoever have such zeal as this.

verses.text: yea, and I will be with all, saith he, whosoever have such zeal as this.

sinaiticus.text: This fasting, saith he, if the commandments of the Lord are kept, is very good.

verses.text: This fasting, saith he, if the commandments of the Lord are kept, is very good.

sinaiticus.text: This then is the way, that thou shalt keep this fast [which thou art about to observe].538

verses.text: This then is the way, that thou shalt keep this fast [which thou art about to observe].538

sinaiticus.text: First of all, keep thyself from every evil word and every evil desire, and purify thy heart from all the vanities of this world.

verses.text: First of all, keep thyself from every evil word and every evil desire, and purify thy heart from all the vanities of this world.

sinaiticus.text: If thou keep these things, this fast shall be perfect for thee.

verses.text: If thou keep these things, this fast shall be perfect for thee.

sinaiticus.text: And thus shalt thou do.

verses.text: And thus shalt thou do.

sinaiticus.text: Having fulfilled what is written, on that day on which thou fastest thou shalt taste nothing but bread and water;

verses.text: Having fulfilled what is written, on that day on which thou fastest thou shalt taste nothing but bread and water;

sinaiticus.text: and from thy meats, which thou wouldest have eaten,

verses.text: and from thy meats, which thou wouldest have eaten,

sinaiticus.text: thou shalt reckon up the amount of that days expenditure, which thou wouldest have incurred,

verses.text: thou shalt reckon up the amount of that days expenditure, which thou wouldest have incurred,

sinaiticus.text: and shalt give it to a widow, or an orphan, or to one in want,

verses.text: and shalt give it to a widow, or an orphan, or to one in want,

sinaiticus.text: and so shalt thou humble thy soul, that he that hath received from thy humiliation may satisfy his own soul, and may pray for thee to the Lord.

verses.text: and so shalt thou humble thy soul, that he that hath received from thy humiliation may satisfy his own soul, and may pray for thee to the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: If then thou shalt so accomplish this fast, as I have commanded thee, thy sacrifice shall be acceptable in the sight of God, and this fasting shall be recorded;

verses.text: If then thou shalt so accomplish this fast, as I have commanded thee, thy sacrifice shall be acceptable in the sight of God, and this fasting shall be recorded;

sinaiticus.text: and the service so performed is beautiful and joyous and acceptable to the Lord.

verses.text: and the service so performed is beautiful and joyous and acceptable to the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: These things thou shalt so observe, thou and thy children and thy whole household;

verses.text: These things thou shalt so observe, thou and thy children and thy whole household;

sinaiticus.text: and, observing them, thou shalt be blessed;

verses.text: and, observing them, thou shalt be blessed;

sinaiticus.text: I entreated him earnestly,

verses.text: I entreated him earnestly,

sinaiticus.text: that he would show me the parable of the fenced the vineyard, [and of the fence,]

verses.text: that he would show me the parable of the fenced the vineyard, [and of the fence,]

sinaiticus.text: and of the weeds which were plucked up out of the vineyard, and of the son, and of the friends, the advisers.

verses.text: and of the weeds which were plucked up out of the vineyard, and of the son, and of the friends, the advisers.

sinaiticus.text: For I understood that all these things are a parable.

verses.text: For I understood that all these things are a parable.

sinaiticus.text: but he answered and said unto me;

verses.text: but he answered and said unto me;

sinaiticus.text: Thou art exceedingly importunate in enquiries.

verses.text: Thou art exceedingly importunate in enquiries.

sinaiticus.text: Thou oughtest not, to make any enquiry at all;

verses.text: Thou oughtest not, to make any enquiry at all;

sinaiticus.text: for if it be right that a thing be explained unto thee, it shall be explained.

verses.text: for if it be right that a thing be explained unto thee, it shall be explained.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him;

verses.text: I say to him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, whatsoever things thou showest unto me and dost not explain, I shall have seen them in vain, and without understanding what they are.

verses.text: Sir, whatsoever things thou showest unto me and dost not explain, I shall have seen them in vain, and without understanding what they are.

sinaiticus.text: In like manner also, if thou speak parables to me and interpret them not, I shall have heard a thing in vain from thee.

verses.text: In like manner also, if thou speak parables to me and interpret them not, I shall have heard a thing in vain from thee.

sinaiticus.text: Whosoever, saith he, is a servant of God, and hath his own Lord in his heart, asketh understanding of Him,

verses.text: Whosoever, saith he, is a servant of God, and hath his own Lord in his heart, asketh understanding of Him,

sinaiticus.text: and receiveth it, and interpreteth every parable, and the words of the Lord which are spoken in parables are made known unto him.

verses.text: and receiveth it, and interpreteth every parable, and the words of the Lord which are spoken in parables are made known unto him.

sinaiticus.text: But as many as are sluggish and idle in intercession, these hesitate to ask of the Lord.

verses.text: But as many as are sluggish and idle in intercession, these hesitate to ask of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: But the Lord is abundant in compassion, and giveth to them that ask of Him without ceasing.

verses.text: But the Lord is abundant in compassion, and giveth to them that ask of Him without ceasing.

sinaiticus.text: But thou who hast been strengthened by the holy angel, and hast received from him such (powers of) intercession and art not idle, wherefore dost thou not ask understanding of the Lord, and obtain it from Him?

verses.text: But thou who hast been strengthened by the holy angel, and hast received from him such (powers of) intercession and art not idle, wherefore dost thou not ask understanding of the Lord, and obtain it from Him?

sinaiticus.text: I say to him, Sir, I that have thee with me have  need to ask thee and enquire of thee;

verses.text: I say to him, Sir, I that have thee with me have  need to ask thee and enquire of thee;

sinaiticus.text: for thou showest me all things, and speakest with me;

verses.text: for thou showest me all things, and speakest with me;

sinaiticus.text: but if I had seen or heard them apart from thee I should have asked of the Lord, that they might be shown to me.

verses.text: but if I had seen or heard them apart from thee I should have asked of the Lord, that they might be shown to me.

sinaiticus.text: I told thee just now, saith he, that thou art unscrupulous and importunate, in enquiring for the interpretations of the parables.

verses.text: I told thee just now, saith he, that thou art unscrupulous and importunate, in enquiring for the interpretations of the parables.

sinaiticus.text: But since thou art so obstinate, I will interpret to thee the parable of the estate and all the accompaniments thereof, that thou mayest make them known unto all.

verses.text: But since thou art so obstinate, I will interpret to thee the parable of the estate and all the accompaniments thereof, that thou mayest make them known unto all.

sinaiticus.text: Hear now, saith he, and understand them.

verses.text: Hear now, saith he, and understand them.

sinaiticus.text: The estate is this world, and the lord of the estate is He that created all things, and set them in order, and endowed them with power;

verses.text: The estate is this world, and the lord of the estate is He that created all things, and set them in order, and endowed them with power;

sinaiticus.text: and the servant is the Son of God, and the vines are this people whom He Himself planted;

verses.text: and the servant is the Son of God, and the vines are this people whom He Himself planted;

sinaiticus.text: and the fences are the angels of the Lord who keep together His people;

verses.text: and the fences are the angels of the Lord who keep together His people;

sinaiticus.text: and the weeds, which are plucked up from the vineyard, are the transgressions of the servants of God;

verses.text: and the weeds, which are plucked up from the vineyard, are the transgressions of the servants of God;

sinaiticus.text: and the dainties which He sent to him from the feast are the commandments which He gave to His people through His Son;

verses.text: and the dainties which He sent to him from the feast are the commandments which He gave to His people through His Son;

sinaiticus.text: and the friends and advisers are the holy angels which were first created;

verses.text: and the friends and advisers are the holy angels which were first created;

sinaiticus.text: and the absence of the master is the time which remaineth over until His coming.

verses.text: and the absence of the master is the time which remaineth over until His coming.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him;

verses.text: I say to him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, great and marvelous are all things and all things are glorious;

verses.text: Sir, great and marvelous are all things and all things are glorious;

sinaiticus.text: was it likely then, say I, that I could have apprehended them?540

verses.text: was it likely then, say I, that I could have apprehended them?540

sinaiticus.text: Nay, nor can any other man, though he be full of understanding, apprehend them.

verses.text: Nay, nor can any other man, though he be full of understanding, apprehend them.

sinaiticus.text: Yet again, Sir, say I, explain to me what I am about to enquire of thee.

verses.text: Yet again, Sir, say I, explain to me what I am about to enquire of thee.

sinaiticus.text: Say on, he saith, if thou desirest anything.

verses.text: Say on, he saith, if thou desirest anything.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, said he;

verses.text: Listen, said he;

sinaiticus.text: the Son of God is not represented in the guise of a I;

verses.text: the Son of God is not represented in the guise of a I;

sinaiticus.text: I comprehend not.

verses.text: I comprehend not.

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, God planted the vineyard, that is, He created the people, and delivered them over to His Son.

verses.text: Because, saith he, God planted the vineyard, that is, He created the people, and delivered them over to His Son.

sinaiticus.text: And the Son placed the angels in charge of them, to watch over them;

verses.text: And the Son placed the angels in charge of them, to watch over them;

sinaiticus.text: and the Son Himself cleansed their sins, by labouring much and enduring many toils;

verses.text: and the Son Himself cleansed their sins, by labouring much and enduring many toils;

sinaiticus.text: for no one can dig without toil or labour.

verses.text: for no one can dig without toil or labour.

sinaiticus.text: Having Himself then cleansed the sins of His people, He showed them the paths of life, giving them the law which He received from His Father.

verses.text: Having Himself then cleansed the sins of His people, He showed them the paths of life, giving them the law which He received from His Father.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest, saith he, that He is Himself Lord of the people, having received all power from His Father.

verses.text: Thou seest, saith he, that He is Himself Lord of the people, having received all power from His Father.

sinaiticus.text: But how that the lord took his son and the glorious angels as advisers concerning the inheritance of the servant, listen.

verses.text: But how that the lord took his son and the glorious angels as advisers concerning the inheritance of the servant, listen.

sinaiticus.text: The Holy Pre-existent Spirit, Which created the whole creation, God made to dwell in flesh that He desired.
