verses.text: The Holy Pre-existent Spirit, Which created the whole creation, God made to dwell in flesh that He desired.

sinaiticus.text: This flesh, therefore, in which the Holy Spirit dwelt, was subject unto the Spirit, walking honourably in holiness and purity, without in any way defiling the Spirit.

verses.text: This flesh, therefore, in which the Holy Spirit dwelt, was subject unto the Spirit, walking honourably in holiness and purity, without in any way defiling the Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: When then it had lived honourably in chastity,

verses.text: When then it had lived honourably in chastity,

sinaiticus.text: and had laboured with the Spirit, and had cooperated with it in everything, behaving itself boldly and bravely, He chose it as a partner with the Holy Spirit;

verses.text: and had laboured with the Spirit, and had cooperated with it in everything, behaving itself boldly and bravely, He chose it as a partner with the Holy Spirit;

sinaiticus.text: for the career of this flesh pleased, seeing that, as possessing the Holy Spirit, it was not defiled upon the earth.

verses.text: for the career of this flesh pleased, seeing that, as possessing the Holy Spirit, it was not defiled upon the earth.

sinaiticus.text: He therefore took the son as adviser and the glorious angels also,

verses.text: He therefore took the son as adviser and the glorious angels also,

sinaiticus.text: that this flesh too, having served the Spirit unblameably, might have some place of sojourn, and might not seem to have lost the reward for its service;

verses.text: that this flesh too, having served the Spirit unblameably, might have some place of sojourn, and might not seem to have lost the reward for its service;

sinaiticus.text: for all flesh, which is found undefiled and unspotted, wherein the Holy Spirit dwelt, shall receive a reward.

verses.text: for all flesh, which is found undefiled and unspotted, wherein the Holy Spirit dwelt, shall receive a reward.

sinaiticus.text: I was right glad, Sir, say I, to hear this interpretation.

verses.text: I was right glad, Sir, say I, to hear this interpretation.

sinaiticus.text: Listen now, saith he.

verses.text: Listen now, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Keep this thy flesh pure and undefiled, that the Spirit justified.

verses.text: Keep this thy flesh pure and undefiled, that the Spirit justified.

sinaiticus.text: See that it never enter into thine heart that this flesh of thine is perishable, and so thou abuse it in come defilement.

verses.text: See that it never enter into thine heart that this flesh of thine is perishable, and so thou abuse it in come defilement.

sinaiticus.text: [For] if thou defile thy flesh, thou shalt defile the Holy Spirit also;

verses.text: [For] if thou defile thy flesh, thou shalt defile the Holy Spirit also;

sinaiticus.text: but if thou defile +the flesh, thou shalt not live.

verses.text: but if thou defile +the flesh, thou shalt not live.

sinaiticus.text: But if, Sir, say I, there has been any ignorance in times past, before these words were heard, how shall a man who has defiled his flesh be saved?

verses.text: But if, Sir, say I, there has been any ignorance in times past, before these words were heard, how shall a man who has defiled his flesh be saved?

sinaiticus.text: For the former deeds of ignorance, saith he, God alone hath power to give healing;

verses.text: For the former deeds of ignorance, saith he, God alone hath power to give healing;

sinaiticus.text: for all authority is His.

verses.text: for all authority is His.

sinaiticus.text: [But now keep thyself, and the Lord Almighty, Who is full of compassion, will give healing for thy former deeds of ignorance,] if henceforth thou defile not thy flesh, neither the Spirit;

verses.text: [But now keep thyself, and the Lord Almighty, Who is full of compassion, will give healing for thy former deeds of ignorance,] if henceforth thou defile not thy flesh, neither the Spirit;

sinaiticus.text: for both share in common, and the one cannot be defiled without the other.

verses.text: for both share in common, and the one cannot be defiled without the other.

sinaiticus.text: [PARABLE THE SIXTH].

verses.text: [PARABLE THE SIXTH].

sinaiticus.text: As I sat in my house, and glorified the Lord for all things that I had seen, and was considering concerning the glorious and able to save a mans soul, I said within myself;

verses.text: As I sat in my house, and glorified the Lord for all things that I had seen, and was considering concerning the glorious and able to save a mans soul, I said within myself;

sinaiticus.text: Blessed shall I be, if I walk in these commandments;

verses.text: Blessed shall I be, if I walk in these commandments;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and whosoever shall walk in them shall be blessed.

verses.text: yea, and whosoever shall walk in them shall be blessed.

sinaiticus.text: As I spake these things within thyself, I see him suddenly seated by me, and saying as follows;

verses.text: As I spake these things within thyself, I see him suddenly seated by me, and saying as follows;

sinaiticus.text: Why art thou of a doubtful mind concerning the commandments, which I commanded thee?

verses.text: Why art thou of a doubtful mind concerning the commandments, which I commanded thee?

sinaiticus.text: They are beautiful.

verses.text: They are beautiful.

sinaiticus.text: Doubt not at all;

verses.text: Doubt not at all;

sinaiticus.text: but clothe thyself in the faith of the Lord, and thou shalt walk in them.

verses.text: but clothe thyself in the faith of the Lord, and thou shalt walk in them.

sinaiticus.text: For I will strengthen thee in them.

verses.text: For I will strengthen thee in them.

sinaiticus.text: These commandments are suitable for those who meditate repentance for if they walk not in them, their repentance is in vain.

verses.text: These commandments are suitable for those who meditate repentance for if they walk not in them, their repentance is in vain.

sinaiticus.text: Ye then that repent, cast away the evil doings of this world which crush you;

verses.text: Ye then that repent, cast away the evil doings of this world which crush you;

sinaiticus.text: and, by putting on every excellence of righteousness, ye shall be able to observe these commandments, and to add no more to your sins.542

verses.text: and, by putting on every excellence of righteousness, ye shall be able to observe these commandments, and to add no more to your sins.542

sinaiticus.text: If then ye add no further sin at all, ye will depart from your former sins.

verses.text: If then ye add no further sin at all, ye will depart from your former sins.

sinaiticus.text: Walk then in these my commandments, and ye shall live unto God.

verses.text: Walk then in these my commandments, and ye shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: These things have been told you from me.

verses.text: These things have been told you from me.

sinaiticus.text: And after he had told these things to me, he saith to me, Let us go into the country, and I will show thee the shepherds of the sheep.

verses.text: And after he had told these things to me, he saith to me, Let us go into the country, and I will show thee the shepherds of the sheep.

sinaiticus.text: Let us go, Sir, say I.

verses.text: Let us go, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: And we came to a certain plain, and he showeth me a young man, a shepherd, clothed in a light cloak, of saffron colour;

verses.text: And we came to a certain plain, and he showeth me a young man, a shepherd, clothed in a light cloak, of saffron colour;

sinaiticus.text: and he was feeding a great number of sheep, and these sheep were, as it were, well fed and very frisky, and were gladsome as they skipped about hither and thither;

verses.text: and he was feeding a great number of sheep, and these sheep were, as it were, well fed and very frisky, and were gladsome as they skipped about hither and thither;

sinaiticus.text: and the shepherd himself was all gladsome over his flock;

verses.text: and the shepherd himself was all gladsome over his flock;

sinaiticus.text: and the very visage of the shepherd was exceedingly gladsome;

verses.text: and the very visage of the shepherd was exceedingly gladsome;

sinaiticus.text: and he ran about among the sheep.

verses.text: and he ran about among the sheep.

sinaiticus.text: And he saith to me;

verses.text: And he saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Seest thou this shepherd?

verses.text: Seest thou this shepherd?

sinaiticus.text: I see him, Sir, I say.

verses.text: I see him, Sir, I say.

sinaiticus.text: This, saith he, is the angel of self-indulgence and of deceit.

verses.text: This, saith he, is the angel of self-indulgence and of deceit.

sinaiticus.text: He crusheth the souls of the servants of God, and perverteth them from the truth, leading them astray with evil desires, wherein they perish.

verses.text: He crusheth the souls of the servants of God, and perverteth them from the truth, leading them astray with evil desires, wherein they perish.

sinaiticus.text: For they forget the commandments of the living God, and walk in vain deceits and acts of self-indulgence, and are destroyed by this angel, some of them unto death, and others unto corruption.

verses.text: For they forget the commandments of the living God, and walk in vain deceits and acts of self-indulgence, and are destroyed by this angel, some of them unto death, and others unto corruption.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him, Sir, I comprehend not what means “unto death,” and what “unto corruption”.

verses.text: I say to him, Sir, I comprehend not what means “unto death,” and what “unto corruption”.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: the sheep which thou sawest gladsome and skipping about, these are they who have been turned asunder from God utterly, and have delivered themselves over to the lusts of this world.

verses.text: the sheep which thou sawest gladsome and skipping about, these are they who have been turned asunder from God utterly, and have delivered themselves over to the lusts of this world.

sinaiticus.text: In these, therefore, there is not repentance unto life.

verses.text: In these, therefore, there is not repentance unto life.

sinaiticus.text: For the Name of God is being blasphemed through them.

verses.text: For the Name of God is being blasphemed through them.

sinaiticus.text: The life of such persons is death.

verses.text: The life of such persons is death.

sinaiticus.text: But the sheep, which thou sawest not skipping about, but feeding in one place,

verses.text: But the sheep, which thou sawest not skipping about, but feeding in one place,

sinaiticus.text: these are they that have delivered themselves over to acts of self- indulgence and deceit, but have not uttered any blasphemy against

verses.text: these are they that have delivered themselves over to acts of self- indulgence and deceit, but have not uttered any blasphemy against

sinaiticus.text: These then have been corrupted from the truth.

verses.text: These then have been corrupted from the truth.

sinaiticus.text: In these there is hope of repentance, wherein they can live.

verses.text: In these there is hope of repentance, wherein they can live.

sinaiticus.text: Corruption then hath hope of a possible renewal, but death hath eternal destruction.

verses.text: Corruption then hath hope of a possible renewal, but death hath eternal destruction.

sinaiticus.text: Again we went forward a little way, and he showeth me a great shepherd like a wild man in appearance, with a white goatskin thrown about him;

verses.text: Again we went forward a little way, and he showeth me a great shepherd like a wild man in appearance, with a white goatskin thrown about him;

sinaiticus.text: and he had a kind of wallet on his shoulders, and a staff very hard and with knots in it, and a great whip.

verses.text: and he had a kind of wallet on his shoulders, and a staff very hard and with knots in it, and a great whip.

sinaiticus.text: And his look was very sour, so that I was afraid of him because of his look.

verses.text: And his look was very sour, so that I was afraid of him because of his look.

sinaiticus.text: This shepherd then kept receiving from the young man, the shepherd,

verses.text: This shepherd then kept receiving from the young man, the shepherd,

sinaiticus.text: those sheep that were frisky and well-fed,

verses.text: those sheep that were frisky and well-fed,

sinaiticus.text: but not skipping about, and putting them in a certain spot,

verses.text: but not skipping about, and putting them in a certain spot,

sinaiticus.text: which was precipitous and covered with thorns and briars, so that the sheep could not disentangle themselves from the thorns and briars, but [became entangled among the thorns and briars.

verses.text: which was precipitous and covered with thorns and briars, so that the sheep could not disentangle themselves from the thorns and briars, but [became entangled among the thorns and briars.

sinaiticus.text: And so they] pastured entangled in the thorns and briars, and were in great misery with being beaten by him;

verses.text: And so they] pastured entangled in the thorns and briars, and were in great misery with being beaten by him;

sinaiticus.text: and he kept driving them about to and fro, and giving them no rest, and altogether those sheep had not a happy time.

verses.text: and he kept driving them about to and fro, and giving them no rest, and altogether those sheep had not a happy time.

sinaiticus.text: When then I saw them so lashed with the whip and vexed, I was sorry for their sakes, because they were so tortured and had no rest at all.

verses.text: When then I saw them so lashed with the whip and vexed, I was sorry for their sakes, because they were so tortured and had no rest at all.

sinaiticus.text: I say to the shepherd who was speaking with me;

verses.text: I say to the shepherd who was speaking with me;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, who is this shepherd, who is hard-hearted and severe, and has no compassion at all for these sheep?

verses.text: Sir, who is this shepherd, who is hard-hearted and severe, and has no compassion at all for these sheep?

sinaiticus.text: This, saith he, is the angel of punishment, and he is one of the just angels, and presides over punishment.

verses.text: This, saith he, is the angel of punishment, and he is one of the just angels, and presides over punishment.

sinaiticus.text: So he receiveth those who wander away from God, and walk after the lusts and deceits of this life, and punisheth them, as they deserve, with fearful and various punishments.

verses.text: So he receiveth those who wander away from God, and walk after the lusts and deceits of this life, and punisheth them, as they deserve, with fearful and various punishments.

sinaiticus.text: I would fain learn, Sir, say I, of what sort are these various punishments.

verses.text: I would fain learn, Sir, say I, of what sort are these various punishments.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: the various tortures and punishments are tortures belonging to the present life;

verses.text: the various tortures and punishments are tortures belonging to the present life;

sinaiticus.text: for some are punished with losses, and others with want,544

verses.text: for some are punished with losses, and others with want,544

sinaiticus.text: and others with divers maladies, and others with of unsettlement, and others with insults from unworthy persons and with suffering in many other respects.

verses.text: and others with divers maladies, and others with of unsettlement, and others with insults from unworthy persons and with suffering in many other respects.

sinaiticus.text: For many, being unsettled in their plans, set their hands to many things, and nothing ever goes forward with them.

verses.text: For many, being unsettled in their plans, set their hands to many things, and nothing ever goes forward with them.

sinaiticus.text: And then they say that they do not prosper in their doings, and it doth not enter into their hearts that they have done evil deeds, but they blame the Lord.

verses.text: And then they say that they do not prosper in their doings, and it doth not enter into their hearts that they have done evil deeds, but they blame the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: When then they are afflicted with every kind of affliction,

verses.text: When then they are afflicted with every kind of affliction,

sinaiticus.text: then they are delivered over to me for good instruction, and are strengthened in the faith of the Lord, and serve the Lord with a pure heart the remaining days of their life.

verses.text: then they are delivered over to me for good instruction, and are strengthened in the faith of the Lord, and serve the Lord with a pure heart the remaining days of their life.

sinaiticus.text: But, if they repent, the evil works which they have done rise up in their hearts,

verses.text: But, if they repent, the evil works which they have done rise up in their hearts,

sinaiticus.text: and then they glorify God, saying that He is a just Judge, and that they suffered justly each according to his doings.

verses.text: and then they glorify God, saying that He is a just Judge, and that they suffered justly each according to his doings.

sinaiticus.text: And they serve the Lord thenceforward with a pure heart, and are prosperous in all their doings, receiving from the Lord whatsoever things they may ask;

verses.text: And they serve the Lord thenceforward with a pure heart, and are prosperous in all their doings, receiving from the Lord whatsoever things they may ask;

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him;

verses.text: I say unto him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, declare unto me this further matter.

verses.text: Sir, declare unto me this further matter.

sinaiticus.text: What self-indulgence and are deceived undergo torments during the same length of time as they live in self-indulgence and are deceived.

verses.text: What self-indulgence and are deceived undergo torments during the same length of time as they live in self-indulgence and are deceived.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me, They undergo torments for the same length of time.

verses.text: He saith to me, They undergo torments for the same length of time.

sinaiticus.text: Then, Sir, say I, they undergo very slight torments;

verses.text: Then, Sir, say I, they undergo very slight torments;

sinaiticus.text: for those who are living thus in self-indulgence and forget God ought to have been tormented sevenfold.

verses.text: for those who are living thus in self-indulgence and forget God ought to have been tormented sevenfold.

sinaiticus.text: He saith to me, Thou art foolish, and comprehendest not the power of the torment.

verses.text: He saith to me, Thou art foolish, and comprehendest not the power of the torment.

sinaiticus.text: True, say I, for if I had comprehended it, I should not have asked thee to declare it to me.

verses.text: True, say I, for if I had comprehended it, I should not have asked thee to declare it to me.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he, to the power of both, [of the self-indulgence and of the torment].

verses.text: Listen, saith he, to the power of both, [of the self-indulgence and of the torment].

sinaiticus.text: The time of the self-indulgence and deceit is one hour.

verses.text: The time of the self-indulgence and deceit is one hour.

sinaiticus.text: But an hour of the torment hath the power of thirty days.

verses.text: But an hour of the torment hath the power of thirty days.

sinaiticus.text: If then one live in self-indulgence and be deceived for one day, and be tormented for one day, the day of the torment is equivalent to a whole year.

verses.text: If then one live in self-indulgence and be deceived for one day, and be tormented for one day, the day of the torment is equivalent to a whole year.

sinaiticus.text: For as many days then as a man lives in self-indulgence, for so

verses.text: For as many days then as a man lives in self-indulgence, for so

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then, saith he, that the time of the self-indulgence and deceit is very short, but the time of the punishment and torment is long.

verses.text: Thou seest then, saith he, that the time of the self-indulgence and deceit is very short, but the time of the punishment and torment is long.

sinaiticus.text: Inasmuch, Sir, say I, as I do not quite comprehend concerning the time of the deceit and self-indulgence and torment, show me more clearly.

verses.text: Inasmuch, Sir, say I, as I do not quite comprehend concerning the time of the deceit and self-indulgence and torment, show me more clearly.

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said unto me;

verses.text: He answered and said unto me;

sinaiticus.text: Thy stupidity cleaveth to thee;

verses.text: Thy stupidity cleaveth to thee;

sinaiticus.text: and thou wilt not cleanse thy heart and serve God.

verses.text: and thou wilt not cleanse thy heart and serve God.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed, lest haply the time be fulfilled, and thou be found in thy foolishness.

verses.text: Take heed, lest haply the time be fulfilled, and thou be found in thy foolishness.

sinaiticus.text: Listen then, even as thou wishest, that thou mayest comprehend the matter.

verses.text: Listen then, even as thou wishest, that thou mayest comprehend the matter.

sinaiticus.text: He that liveth in self-indulgence and is deceived for one day, and doeth what he wisheth, is clothed in much folly and comprehendeth not the thing which he doeth;

verses.text: He that liveth in self-indulgence and is deceived for one day, and doeth what he wisheth, is clothed in much folly and comprehendeth not the thing which he doeth;

sinaiticus.text: for on the morrow he forgetteth what he did the day before.

verses.text: for on the morrow he forgetteth what he did the day before.

sinaiticus.text: For self-indulgence and deceit have no memories, by reason of the folly, wherewith each is clothed;

verses.text: For self-indulgence and deceit have no memories, by reason of the folly, wherewith each is clothed;

sinaiticus.text: but when punishment and torment cling to a man for a single day, he is punished and tormented for a whole year long;

verses.text: but when punishment and torment cling to a man for a single day, he is punished and tormented for a whole year long;

sinaiticus.text: for punishment and torment have long memories.

verses.text: for punishment and torment have long memories.

sinaiticus.text: So being tormented and punished for the whole year, the man remembers at length the self-indulgence and deceit, and perceiveth that it is on their account that he is suffering these ills.

verses.text: So being tormented and punished for the whole year, the man remembers at length the self-indulgence and deceit, and perceiveth that it is on their account that he is suffering these ills.

sinaiticus.text: Every man, therefore, that liveth in self-indulgence and is deceived, is tormented in this way because, though possessing life, they have delivered themselves over unto death.

verses.text: Every man, therefore, that liveth in self-indulgence and is deceived, is tormented in this way because, though possessing life, they have delivered themselves over unto death.

sinaiticus.text: What kinds of self-indulgence, Sir, say I, are harmful?

verses.text: What kinds of self-indulgence, Sir, say I, are harmful?

sinaiticus.text: “Every action, saith he, is self-indulgence to a man, which he does with pleasure;

verses.text: “Every action, saith he, is self-indulgence to a man, which he does with pleasure;

sinaiticus.text: for the irascible man, when he gives the reins to his passion, is self-indulgent;

verses.text: for the irascible man, when he gives the reins to his passion, is self-indulgent;

sinaiticus.text: and the adulterer and the drunkard and the slanderer and the liar and the miser and the defrauder and he that doeth things akin to these, giveth the reins to his peculiar passion;

verses.text: and the adulterer and the drunkard and the slanderer and the liar and the miser and the defrauder and he that doeth things akin to these, giveth the reins to his peculiar passion;

sinaiticus.text: therefore he is self-indulgent in his action.

verses.text: therefore he is self-indulgent in his action.

sinaiticus.text: All these habits of self-indulgence are harmful to the servants of God;

verses.text: All these habits of self-indulgence are harmful to the servants of God;

sinaiticus.text: on account of these deceits therefore they so suffer who are punished and tormented.546

verses.text: on account of these deceits therefore they so suffer who are punished and tormented.546

sinaiticus.text: But there are habits of self-indulgence likewise which save men;

verses.text: But there are habits of self-indulgence likewise which save men;

sinaiticus.text: for many are self-indulgent in doing good, being carried away by the pleasure it gives to themselves.

verses.text: for many are self-indulgent in doing good, being carried away by the pleasure it gives to themselves.

sinaiticus.text: This self-indulgence then is expedient for the servants of God, and bringeth life to a man of this disposition;

verses.text: This self-indulgence then is expedient for the servants of God, and bringeth life to a man of this disposition;

sinaiticus.text: but the harmful self-indulgencies afore-mentioned bring to men torments and punishments;

verses.text: but the harmful self-indulgencies afore-mentioned bring to men torments and punishments;

sinaiticus.text: [PARABLE THE SEVENTH].

verses.text: [PARABLE THE SEVENTH].

sinaiticus.text: After a few days I saw him on the same plain, where also I had seen the shepherds, and he saith to me, What seekest punisheth go out of My house;

verses.text: After a few days I saw him on the same plain, where also I had seen the shepherds, and he saith to me, What seekest punisheth go out of My house;

sinaiticus.text: for he afflicteth me much.

verses.text: for he afflicteth me much.

sinaiticus.text: It is necessary for thee, saith he, to be afflicted;

verses.text: It is necessary for thee, saith he, to be afflicted;

sinaiticus.text: for so, saith he, the glorious angel ordered as concerning thee, for he wisheth thee to be proved.

verses.text: for so, saith he, the glorious angel ordered as concerning thee, for he wisheth thee to be proved.

sinaiticus.text: Why, what so evil thing have I done, Sir, say I, that I should be delivered over to this angel?

verses.text: Why, what so evil thing have I done, Sir, say I, that I should be delivered over to this angel?

sinaiticus.text: “ Listen, saith he.

verses.text: “ Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Thy sins are many, yet not so many that thou shouldest be delivered over to this angel;

verses.text: Thy sins are many, yet not so many that thou shouldest be delivered over to this angel;

sinaiticus.text: but thy house has committed great iniquities and sins,

verses.text: but thy house has committed great iniquities and sins,

sinaiticus.text: and the glorious angel was embittered at their deeds,

verses.text: and the glorious angel was embittered at their deeds,

sinaiticus.text: and for this cause he made thee be afflicted for a certain time, that they also might repent and cleanse themselves from every lust of this world.

verses.text: and for this cause he made thee be afflicted for a certain time, that they also might repent and cleanse themselves from every lust of this world.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore they shall repent and be cleansed, then shall the angel of punishment depart.

verses.text: When therefore they shall repent and be cleansed, then shall the angel of punishment depart.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him;

verses.text: I say to him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, if they perpetrated such deeds that the glorious angel is embittered, what have I done?

verses.text: Sir, if they perpetrated such deeds that the glorious angel is embittered, what have I done?

sinaiticus.text: They cannot be afflicted otherwise, saith he, unless thou, the head of the [whole] house, be afflicted;

verses.text: They cannot be afflicted otherwise, saith he, unless thou, the head of the [whole] house, be afflicted;

sinaiticus.text: for if thou be afflicted, they also of necessity will be afflicted;

verses.text: for if thou be afflicted, they also of necessity will be afflicted;

sinaiticus.text: but if thou be prosperous, they can suffer no affliction.

verses.text: but if thou be prosperous, they can suffer no affliction.

sinaiticus.text: But behold, Sir, say I, they have repented with their whole heart.

verses.text: But behold, Sir, say I, they have repented with their whole heart.

sinaiticus.text: I am quite aware myself, saith he, that they have repented with their whole heart;

verses.text: I am quite aware myself, saith he, that they have repented with their whole heart;

sinaiticus.text: well, thinkest thou that the sins of those who repent are forgiven forthwith?

verses.text: well, thinkest thou that the sins of those who repent are forgiven forthwith?

sinaiticus.text: but the person who repents must torture his own soul, and must be thoroughly humble in his every action, and be afflicted with all the divers kinds of affliction;

verses.text: but the person who repents must torture his own soul, and must be thoroughly humble in his every action, and be afflicted with all the divers kinds of affliction;

sinaiticus.text: and if he endure the afflictions which come upon him, assuredly He Who created all things and endowed them with power will be moved with compassion and will bestow some remedy.

verses.text: and if he endure the afflictions which come upon him, assuredly He Who created all things and endowed them with power will be moved with compassion and will bestow some remedy.

sinaiticus.text: But why speak I many words to thee?

verses.text: But why speak I many words to thee?

sinaiticus.text: Thou must be afflicted as the angel of the Lord commanded, even he that delivered thee unto me;

verses.text: Thou must be afflicted as the angel of the Lord commanded, even he that delivered thee unto me;

sinaiticus.text: and for this give thanks to the Lord, in that He deemed thee worthy that I should reveal unto thee beforehand the affliction, that foreknowing it thou mightest endure it with fortitude.

verses.text: and for this give thanks to the Lord, in that He deemed thee worthy that I should reveal unto thee beforehand the affliction, that foreknowing it thou mightest endure it with fortitude.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him;

verses.text: I say to him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, be thou with, me, and I shall be able to endure all affliction [easily].

verses.text: Sir, be thou with, me, and I shall be able to endure all affliction [easily].

sinaiticus.text: I will be with thee, saith he;

verses.text: I will be with thee, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: and I will ask the angel that punisheth to afflict thee more lightly;

verses.text: and I will ask the angel that punisheth to afflict thee more lightly;

sinaiticus.text: but thou shalt be afflicted for a short time, and thou shalt be restored again to thy house.

verses.text: but thou shalt be afflicted for a short time, and thou shalt be restored again to thy house.

sinaiticus.text: Only continue to be humble and to minister unto the Lord with a pure heart,

verses.text: Only continue to be humble and to minister unto the Lord with a pure heart,

sinaiticus.text: thou and thy children and thy house, and walk in my commandments which I command thee, and thus it will be possible for thy repentance to be strong and pure.

verses.text: thou and thy children and thy house, and walk in my commandments which I command thee, and thus it will be possible for thy repentance to be strong and pure.

sinaiticus.text: And if thou keep these commandments with thy household, all affliction shall hold aloof from thee;

verses.text: And if thou keep these commandments with thy household, all affliction shall hold aloof from thee;

sinaiticus.text: [PARABLE THE EIGHTH].

verses.text: [PARABLE THE EIGHTH].

sinaiticus.text: He showed me a willow, overshadow are called by the name of the Lord.

verses.text: He showed me a willow, overshadow are called by the name of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And by the willow there stood an angel of the Lord, glorious and very tall, having a great sickle,

verses.text: And by the willow there stood an angel of the Lord, glorious and very tall, having a great sickle,

sinaiticus.text: and he was lopping branches from the willow, and giving them to the people that sheltered beneath the willow;

verses.text: and he was lopping branches from the willow, and giving them to the people that sheltered beneath the willow;

sinaiticus.text: and he gave them little rods about a cubit long.

verses.text: and he gave them little rods about a cubit long.

sinaiticus.text: And after all had taken the rods, the angel laid aside the sickle, and the tree was sound, just as I had seen it.

verses.text: And after all had taken the rods, the angel laid aside the sickle, and the tree was sound, just as I had seen it.

sinaiticus.text: Then I marvelled within myself, saying, How is the tree sound after so many branches have been lopped off?548

verses.text: Then I marvelled within myself, saying, How is the tree sound after so many branches have been lopped off?548

sinaiticus.text: The shepherd saith to me, Marvel not that the tree remained sound, after so many branches were lopped off;

verses.text: The shepherd saith to me, Marvel not that the tree remained sound, after so many branches were lopped off;

sinaiticus.text: but wait until thou seest all things, and it shall be shown to thee what it is.

verses.text: but wait until thou seest all things, and it shall be shown to thee what it is.

sinaiticus.text: The angel who gave the rods to the people demanded them back from them again;

verses.text: The angel who gave the rods to the people demanded them back from them again;

sinaiticus.text: and according as they had received them, so also they were summoned to him, and each of them returned the several rods.

verses.text: and according as they had received them, so also they were summoned to him, and each of them returned the several rods.

sinaiticus.text: But the angel of the Lord took them, and examined them.

verses.text: But the angel of the Lord took them, and examined them.

sinaiticus.text: From some he received the rods withered and eaten as it were by grubs:

verses.text: From some he received the rods withered and eaten as it were by grubs:

verses.text: the angel ordered those who gave up rods like these to stand apart.

sinaiticus.text: And others gave them up withered, but not grub-eaten;

verses.text: And others gave them up withered, but not grub-eaten;

sinaiticus.text: and these again he ordered to stand apart.

verses.text: and these again he ordered to stand apart.

sinaiticus.text: And others gave them up half-withered;

verses.text: And others gave them up half-withered;

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: And others gave up their rods half-withered and with cracks;

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: And others gave up their rods green and with cracks;

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: these also stood apart.

sinaiticus.text: And others gave up their rods one half withered and one half green;

verses.text: And others gave up their rods one half withered and one half green;

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: these also stood apart.

sinaiticus.text: And others brought their rods two parts of the rod green, and the third part withered;

verses.text: these also stood apart.

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: these also stood apart.

verses.text: but they had cracks in them;

verses.text: these also stood apart.

sinaiticus.text: And others came bringing their rods green, as they received them from the angel;

sinaiticus.text: and the most part of the multitude gave up their rods in this state;

verses.text: and the most part of the multitude gave up their rods in this state;

verses.text: and the angel rejoiced exceedingly at these;

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart.

sinaiticus.text: these also stood apart;

verses.text: these also stood apart;

sinaiticus.text: and at these again the angel rejoiced exceedingly.

verses.text: and at these again the angel rejoiced exceedingly.

sinaiticus.text: And others gave up their rods green and with shoots;

verses.text: And others gave up their rods green and with shoots;

sinaiticus.text: and their shoots had, as it were, a kind of fruit.

verses.text: and their shoots had, as it were, a kind of fruit.

sinaiticus.text: And those men were exceeding gladsome, whose rods were found in this state.

verses.text: And those men were exceeding gladsome, whose rods were found in this state.

sinaiticus.text: And over them the angel exulted, and the shepherd was very gladsome over them.

verses.text: And over them the angel exulted, and the shepherd was very gladsome over them.

sinaiticus.text: And the angel of the Lord commanded crowns to be brought.

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord commanded crowns to be brought.

sinaiticus.text: And crowns were brought, made as it were of palm-branches;

verses.text: And crowns were brought, made as it were of palm-branches;

sinaiticus.text: and he crowned the men that had given up the rods which had the shoots and some fruit, and sent them away into the tower.

verses.text: and he crowned the men that had given up the rods which had the shoots and some fruit, and sent them away into the tower.

sinaiticus.text: And the others also he sent into the tower, even those who had given up the rods green and with shoots, but the shoots were without fruit;

verses.text: And the others also he sent into the tower, even those who had given up the rods green and with shoots, but the shoots were without fruit;

sinaiticus.text: and he set a seal upon them.

verses.text: and he set a seal upon them.

sinaiticus.text: And all they that went into the tower had the same raiment, white as snow.

verses.text: And all they that went into the tower had the same raiment, white as snow.

sinaiticus.text: And those that had given up their rods green as they received them, he sent away, giving them a [white] robe, and seals.

verses.text: And those that had given up their rods green as they received them, he sent away, giving them a [white] robe, and seals.

sinaiticus.text: After the angel had finished these things, he saith to the shepherd;

verses.text: After the angel had finished these things, he saith to the shepherd;

sinaiticus.text: I go away;

verses.text: I go away;

sinaiticus.text: but these thou shall send away to  the walls, according as each deserveth to dwell;

verses.text: but these thou shall send away to  the walls, according as each deserveth to dwell;

sinaiticus.text: but examine their rods carefully, and so send them away.

verses.text: but examine their rods carefully, and so send them away.

sinaiticus.text: But be careful in examining them.

verses.text: But be careful in examining them.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed lest any escape thee, saith he.

verses.text: Take heed lest any escape thee, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: Still if any escape thee, I will test then, at the altar.

verses.text: Still if any escape thee, I will test then, at the altar.

sinaiticus.text: When he had thus spoken to the shepherd, he departed.

verses.text: When he had thus spoken to the shepherd, he departed.

sinaiticus.text: And, after the angel had departed, the shepherd saith to me;

verses.text: And, after the angel had departed, the shepherd saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Let us take the rods of all and plant them, to see whether any of them shall be able to live.

verses.text: Let us take the rods of all and plant them, to see whether any of them shall be able to live.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him, Sir, these withered things, how can they live?

verses.text: I say unto him, Sir, these withered things, how can they live?

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said unto me;

verses.text: He answered and said unto me;

sinaiticus.text: This tree is a willow, and this class of trees clingeth to life.

verses.text: This tree is a willow, and this class of trees clingeth to life.

sinaiticus.text: If then the rods shall be planted and get a little moisture, many of them will live.

verses.text: If then the rods shall be planted and get a little moisture, many of them will live.

sinaiticus.text: And afterwards let us try to pour some water also over them.

verses.text: And afterwards let us try to pour some water also over them.

sinaiticus.text: If any of them shall be able to live, I will rejoice with it;

verses.text: If any of them shall be able to live, I will rejoice with it;

sinaiticus.text: but if it live not, I at least shall not be found neglectful.550

verses.text: but if it live not, I at least shall not be found neglectful.550

sinaiticus.text: So the shepherd made me call them, just as each one of them was stationed.

verses.text: So the shepherd made me call them, just as each one of them was stationed.

sinaiticus.text: And they came row after row, and they delivered up the rods to the shepherd.

verses.text: And they came row after row, and they delivered up the rods to the shepherd.

sinaiticus.text: And the shepherd took the rods, and planted them in rows, and after he had planted them, he poured much water over them, so that the rods could not be seen for the water.

verses.text: And the shepherd took the rods, and planted them in rows, and after he had planted them, he poured much water over them, so that the rods could not be seen for the water.

sinaiticus.text: And after he had watered the rods, he saith to me;

verses.text: And after he had watered the rods, he saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: Let us go now, and after a few days let us return and inspect all the rods;

verses.text: Let us go now, and after a few days let us return and inspect all the rods;

sinaiticus.text: for He Who created this tree willeth that all those who have received rods from this tree should live.

verses.text: for He Who created this tree willeth that all those who have received rods from this tree should live.

sinaiticus.text: I say to him;

verses.text: I say to him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, inform me what this tree is.

verses.text: Sir, inform me what this tree is.

sinaiticus.text: For I am perplexed and nothing appears to have been cut from it;

verses.text: For I am perplexed and nothing appears to have been cut from it;

sinaiticus.text: I am therefore perplexed thereat.

verses.text: I am therefore perplexed thereat.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: this great tree which overshadows plains and mountains and all the earth is the law of God which was given to the whole world;

verses.text: this great tree which overshadows plains and mountains and all the earth is the law of God which was given to the whole world;

sinaiticus.text: and this law is the Son of God preached unto the ends of the earth.

verses.text: and this law is the Son of God preached unto the ends of the earth.

sinaiticus.text: But the people that are under the shadow are they that have heard the preaching, and believed on Him;

verses.text: But the people that are under the shadow are they that have heard the preaching, and believed on Him;

sinaiticus.text: but the great and glorious angel is Michael, who hath the power over this people and is their captain.

verses.text: but the great and glorious angel is Michael, who hath the power over this people and is their captain.

sinaiticus.text: For this is he that putteth the law into the hearts of the believers;

verses.text: For this is he that putteth the law into the hearts of the believers;

sinaiticus.text: therefore he himself inspecteth them to whom he gave it, to see whether they have observed it.

verses.text: therefore he himself inspecteth them to whom he gave it, to see whether they have observed it.

sinaiticus.text: But thou seest the rods of every one;

verses.text: But thou seest the rods of every one;

sinaiticus.text: for the rods are the law.

verses.text: for the rods are the law.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest these many rods rendered useless, and thou shalt notice all those that have not observed the law, and shalt see the abode of each severally.

verses.text: Thou seest these many rods rendered useless, and thou shalt notice all those that have not observed the law, and shalt see the abode of each severally.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him;

verses.text: I say unto him;

sinaiticus.text: Sir, wherefore did he send away some into the tower, and leave others for thee?

verses.text: Sir, wherefore did he send away some into the tower, and leave others for thee?

sinaiticus.text: As many, saith he, as transgressed the law which they received from him, these he left under my authority for repentance;

verses.text: As many, saith he, as transgressed the law which they received from him, these he left under my authority for repentance;

sinaiticus.text: but as many as already satisfied the law and have observed it,

verses.text: but as many as already satisfied the law and have observed it,

sinaiticus.text: Who then, Sir, say I, are they that have been crowned and go into the tower?

verses.text: Who then, Sir, say I, are they that have been crowned and go into the tower?

sinaiticus.text: [As many, saith he, as wrestled with the devil and overcame him in their wrestling, are crowned:]

verses.text: [As many, saith he, as wrestled with the devil and overcame him in their wrestling, are crowned:]

verses.text: these are they that suffered for the law.

sinaiticus.text: But they that gave them up green just as they received them, are sober and righteous men, who walked altogether in a pure heart and have kept the commandments of the Lord.

verses.text: But they that gave them up green just as they received them, are sober and righteous men, who walked altogether in a pure heart and have kept the commandments of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And after a few days we came to the place, and the shepherd sat down thyself with a garment of raw flax, and minister to me.

verses.text: The rods of some were found entirely green, of some half-withered, of some withered and eaten, and of some green and with shoots.

sinaiticus.text: The rods of these were found for the most part green and with shoots and fruit on the shoots, and others altogether green.

verses.text: The rods of these were found for the most part green and with shoots and fruit on the shoots, and others altogether green.

sinaiticus.text: At these rods the shepherd rejoiced very, because they were found so.

sinaiticus.text: And these went away each to his own company.

verses.text: And these went away each to his own company.

sinaiticus.text: After had examined the rods of all, he saith to me, I told thee that this tree clingeth to life.

verses.text: After had examined the rods of all, he saith to me, I told thee that this tree clingeth to life.

sinaiticus.text: Seest thou, saith he, how many repented and were saved?

verses.text: Seest thou, saith he, how many repented and were saved?

sinaiticus.text: It is, saith he, that thou mayest see the abundant compassion of the Lord, how great and glorious it is,

verses.text: It is, saith he, that thou mayest see the abundant compassion of the Lord, how great and glorious it is,

sinaiticus.text: and He hath given  Spirit to those that are worthy of repentance.

verses.text: and He hath given  Spirit to those that are worthy of repentance.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, did they not all repent?

verses.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, did they not all repent?

sinaiticus.text: To those, whose heart He saw about to become pure and to serve Him with all the heart, to them He gave repentance;

verses.text: To those, whose heart He saw about to become pure and to serve Him with all the heart, to them He gave repentance;

sinaiticus.text: but those whose craftiness and wickedness He saw who intend to repent in hypocrisy, to them He gave not repentance, lest haply they should again profane His name.

verses.text: but those whose craftiness and wickedness He saw who intend to repent in hypocrisy, to them He gave not repentance, lest haply they should again profane His name.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him,

verses.text: I say unto him,

sinaiticus.text: Sir, now then show me concerning those that have given up their rods, what manner of man each of them is, and their abode,

verses.text: Sir, now then show me concerning those that have given up their rods, what manner of man each of them is, and their abode,

sinaiticus.text: that when they hear this, they that believed and have received the seal and have broken it and did not keep it sound may fully understand what they are doing, and repent, receiving from thee a seal, and may glorify the Lord,

verses.text: that when they hear this, they that believed and have received the seal and have broken it and did not keep it sound may fully understand what they are doing, and repent, receiving from thee a seal, and may glorify the Lord,

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: those whose rods were found withered and grub-eaten,

verses.text: those whose rods were found withered and grub-eaten,

sinaiticus.text: these are the renegades and traitors to the Church, that blasphemed the Lord in their sins, and still further were ashamed of the Name of the Lord, which was invoked upon them.

verses.text: these are the renegades and traitors to the Church, that blasphemed the Lord in their sins, and still further were ashamed of the Name of the Lord, which was invoked upon them.

sinaiticus.text: These then perished altogether unto God.

verses.text: These then perished altogether unto God.

sinaiticus.text: But thou seest how not one of them repented, although they heard the words which thou spakest to them, which I commanded thee.

verses.text: But thou seest how not one of them repented, although they heard the words which thou spakest to them, which I commanded thee.

sinaiticus.text: From men of this kind life departed.

verses.text: From men of this kind life departed.

sinaiticus.text: But those that gave up the green and undecayed , these also are near them;

verses.text: But those that gave up the green and undecayed , these also are near them;

sinaiticus.text: for they were hypocrites,

verses.text: for they were hypocrites,

sinaiticus.text: and brought in strange doctrines, and perverted the servants of God, especially them that had sinned,

verses.text: and brought in strange doctrines, and perverted the servants of God, especially them that had sinned,

sinaiticus.text: not permitting them to repent, but persuading them with their foolish doctrines.

verses.text: not permitting them to repent, but persuading them with their foolish doctrines.

sinaiticus.text: These then have hope of repenting.

verses.text: These then have hope of repenting.

sinaiticus.text: But thou seest that many of them have indeed repented from the time when thou spakest to them my commandments;

verses.text: But thou seest that many of them have indeed repented from the time when thou spakest to them my commandments;

sinaiticus.text: yea, and  still will repent.

verses.text: yea, and  still will repent.

sinaiticus.text: And as many as shall not repent, have lost their life;

verses.text: And as many as shall not repent, have lost their life;

sinaiticus.text: but as many of them as repented, became good;

verses.text: but as many of them as repented, became good;

sinaiticus.text: and their dwelling was placed within the first walls, and some of them even ascended into the tower.554

verses.text: and their dwelling was placed within the first walls, and some of them even ascended into the tower.554

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest then, that repentance from sins bringeth life, but not to repent bringeth death.

verses.text: Thou seest then, that repentance from sins bringeth life, but not to repent bringeth death.

sinaiticus.text: But as many as gave up  half-withered, and with cracks in them, hear also concerning these.

verses.text: But as many as gave up  half-withered, and with cracks in them, hear also concerning these.

sinaiticus.text: Those whose rods were half-withered throughout are the double- minded;

verses.text: Those whose rods were half-withered throughout are the double- minded;

sinaiticus.text: for they neither live nor are dead.

verses.text: for they neither live nor are dead.

sinaiticus.text: But those that have them half-withered and cracks in then,, these are both double-minded and slanderers, and are never at peace among themselves but always causing dissensions.

verses.text: But those that have them half-withered and cracks in then,, these are both double-minded and slanderers, and are never at peace among themselves but always causing dissensions.

sinaiticus.text: Yet even to these, repentance is given.

sinaiticus.text: Thou seest, that some of them have repented;

verses.text: Thou seest, that some of them have repented;

sinaiticus.text: And as many of them, saith he, as have repented, have their abode within the tower but as many of them as have repented tardily shall abide within the walls;

verses.text: And as many of them, saith he, as have repented, have their abode within the tower but as many of them as have repented tardily shall abide within the walls;

sinaiticus.text: and as many as repent not, but continue in their doings, shall die the death.

verses.text: and as many as repent not, but continue in their doings, shall die the death.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have given up their rods green and with cracks, these were found faithful and good at all times, [but] they have a certain emulation one with another about first places and about glory of some kind or other;

verses.text: But they that have given up their rods green and with cracks, these were found faithful and good at all times, [but] they have a certain emulation one with another about first places and about glory of some kind or other;

sinaiticus.text: but all these are foolish in having  one with another about first places.

sinaiticus.text: Yet these also, when they heard my commandments, being good, purified themselves and repented quickly.

verses.text: Yet these also, when they heard my commandments, being good, purified themselves and repented quickly.

sinaiticus.text: They have their habitation, therefore, within the tower.

verses.text: They have their habitation, therefore, within the tower.

sinaiticus.text: But if any one shall again turn to dissension, he shall be cast out from the tower and shall lose his life.

verses.text: But if any one shall again turn to dissension, he shall be cast out from the tower and shall lose his life.

sinaiticus.text: Life is for all those that keep the commandments of the Lord.

verses.text: Life is for all those that keep the commandments of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: But in the commandments there is nothing about first places, or about glory of any kind, but about long-suffering and humility in man.

verses.text: But in the commandments there is nothing about first places, or about glory of any kind, but about long-suffering and humility in man.

sinaiticus.text: In such men, therefore, is the life of the Lord, but in factious and lawless men is death.

verses.text: In such men, therefore, is the life of the Lord, but in factious and lawless men is death.

sinaiticus.text: But they that gave up their rods half green and half withered, these are they that are mixed up in business and cleave not to the saints.

verses.text: But they that gave up their rods half green and half withered, these are they that are mixed up in business and cleave not to the saints.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the one half of them liveth, but the other half is dead.

verses.text: Therefore the one half of them liveth, but the other half is dead.

sinaiticus.text: As many then as repented, have their abode within the tower.

verses.text: These then have no repentance;

verses.text: for by reason of their business affairs they blasphemed the Lord and denied Him.

sinaiticus.text: So they lost their life for the wickedness that they committed.

verses.text: So they lost their life for the wickedness that they committed.

sinaiticus.text: But many of them were doubtful-minded.

verses.text: But many of them were doubtful-minded.

sinaiticus.text: These still have place for repentance, if they repent quickly, and their dwelling shall be within the tower;

verses.text: These still have place for repentance, if they repent quickly, and their dwelling shall be within the tower;

sinaiticus.text: and if they repent tardily, they shall dwell within the walls;

verses.text: but if they repent not, they too have lost their life.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have given up two parts green and the third part withered, these are they that have denied with manifold denials.

sinaiticus.text: And some of them were double-minded and caused dissensions.

sinaiticus.text: For these then there is repentance, if they repent speedily and continue not in their pleasures;

verses.text: For these then there is repentance, if they repent speedily and continue not in their pleasures;

sinaiticus.text: but if they continue in their doings, they likewise procure for themselves death.

verses.text: but if they continue in their doings, they likewise procure for themselves death.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have given up their rods two thirds withered and one third green, these are men who have been believers, but grew rich and became renowned among the Gentiles.

sinaiticus.text: But some of them were double-minded, and some being double- minded made a greater dissension.

sinaiticus.text: In these then there is still a hope of repentance, because they were found always good;

sinaiticus.text: But they that gave up their rods withered, yet with a very small part green, these are they that believed, but practised the works of lawlessness.

sinaiticus.text: Still they never separated from God, but bore the Name gladly, and gladly received into their houses the servants of God.

verses.text: Still they never separated from God, but bore the Name gladly, and gladly received into their houses the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: So hearing of this repentance they repented without wavering, and they practise all excellence and righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: And some of them even suffer persecution willingly, knowing the deeds that they did.

sinaiticus.text: Go, and tell all men to repent, and they shall live unto God;

verses.text: Go, and tell all men to repent, and they shall live unto God;

sinaiticus.text: for the Lord in His compassion sent me to give repentance to all, though some of them do not deserve it for their deeds;

sinaiticus.text: but being long-suffering the Lord willeth them that were called through His Son to be saved.

verses.text: but being long-suffering the Lord willeth them that were called through His Son to be saved.

sinaiticus.text: Sir, I hope that all when they hear these words will repent;

verses.text: Sir, I hope that all when they hear these words will repent;

sinaiticus.text: for I am persuaded that each one, when he fully knows his own deeds and fears God, will repent.

verses.text: for I am persuaded that each one, when he fully knows his own deeds and fears God, will repent.

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said unto me;

verses.text: He answered and said unto me;

sinaiticus.text: As many, as from their whole heart shall cleanse themselves from all the evil deeds afore-mentioned,

verses.text: As many, as from their whole heart shall cleanse themselves from all the evil deeds afore-mentioned,

sinaiticus.text: and shall add nothing further to their sins,

verses.text: and shall add nothing further to their sins,

sinaiticus.text: shall receive healing from the Lord for their former sins, unless they be double-minded concerning these commandments, and they shall live unto God.

verses.text: shall receive healing from the Lord for their former sins, unless they be double-minded concerning these commandments, and they shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: Having shown me all these things he saith to me;

verses.text: Having shown me all these things he saith to me;

sinaiticus.text: [PARABLE THE NINTH].

verses.text: [PARABLE THE NINTH].

sinaiticus.text: After I had written down the commandments and parables of the shepherd, the angel of repentance, he came to me and saith with thee in the form of the Church, showed unto thee.

verses.text: After I had written down the commandments and parables of the shepherd, the angel of repentance, he came to me and saith with thee in the form of the Church, showed unto thee.

sinaiticus.text: For that Spirit is the Son of God.

verses.text: For that Spirit is the Son of God.

sinaiticus.text: For when thou wast weaker in the flesh, it was not declared unto thee through an angel;

verses.text: For when thou wast weaker in the flesh, it was not declared unto thee through an angel;

sinaiticus.text: but when thou wast enabled through the Spirit, and didst grow mighty in thy strength so that thou couldest even see an angel,

verses.text: but when thou wast enabled through the Spirit, and didst grow mighty in thy strength so that thou couldest even see an angel,

sinaiticus.text: then at length was manifested unto thee, through the Church, the building of the tower.

sinaiticus.text: In fair and seemly manner hast thou seen all things,  as it were by a virgin;

sinaiticus.text: but now thou seest (being instructed by an angel, though by the same Spirit;

verses.text: yet must thou learn everything more accurately from me.

sinaiticus.text: For to this end also was I appointed by the glorious angel to dwell in thy house, that thou mightest see all things mightily, in nothing terrified, even as before.

verses.text: For to this end also was I appointed by the glorious angel to dwell in thy house, that thou mightest see all things mightily, in nothing terrified, even as before.

sinaiticus.text: And he took me away into Arcadia, to a certain rounded mountain, and set me on the top of the mountain, and showed me a great plain, and round the plain twelve mountains, the mountains having each a different appearance.

verses.text: And he took me away into Arcadia, to a certain rounded mountain, and set me on the top of the mountain, and showed me a great plain, and round the plain twelve mountains, the mountains having each a different appearance.

sinaiticus.text: The first was black as soot;558

verses.text: The first was black as soot;558

sinaiticus.text: the second was bare, without vegetation;

verses.text: the second was bare, without vegetation;

sinaiticus.text: the third was thorny and full of briars;

verses.text: the third was thorny and full of briars;

sinaiticus.text: the fourth had the vegetation half-withered, the upper part of the grass green, but the part by the roots withered, and some of the grass became withered, whenever the sun had scorched it;

sinaiticus.text: the fifth mountain had green grass and was rugged;

verses.text: the fifth mountain had green grass and was rugged;

verses.text: the sixth mountain was full with clefts throughout, some small and some great, and the clefts had vegetation,

sinaiticus.text: but the grass was not very luxuriant, but rather as if it had been withered;

verses.text: but the grass was not very luxuriant, but rather as if it had been withered;

sinaiticus.text: the seventh mountain had smiling vegetation, and the whole mountain was in a thriving condition, and cattle and birds of every kind did feed upon that mountain;

verses.text: the seventh mountain had smiling vegetation, and the whole mountain was in a thriving condition, and cattle and birds of every kind did feed upon that mountain;

sinaiticus.text: and the more the cattle and the birds did feed, so much the more did the herbage of that mountain flourish.

verses.text: and the more the cattle and the birds did feed, so much the more did the herbage of that mountain flourish.

sinaiticus.text: The eighth mountain was full of springs, and every kind of creature of the Lord did drink of the springs on that mountain.

verses.text: The eighth mountain was full of springs, and every kind of creature of the Lord did drink of the springs on that mountain.

sinaiticus.text: The ninth mountain had no water at all, and was entirely desert;

verses.text: The ninth mountain had no water at all, and was entirely desert;

sinaiticus.text: and it had in it wild beasts and deadly reptile, which destroy mankind.

verses.text: and it had in it wild beasts and deadly reptile, which destroy mankind.

sinaiticus.text: The tenth mountain had very large trees and was umbrageous throughout, and beneath the shade lay sheep resting and feeding.

verses.text: The tenth mountain had very large trees and was umbrageous throughout, and beneath the shade lay sheep resting and feeding.

sinaiticus.text: The eleventh mountain was thickly wooded all over, and the trees thereon were very productive, decked with divers kinds of fruits, so that one seeing then would desire to eat of their fruits.

verses.text: The eleventh mountain was thickly wooded all over, and the trees thereon were very productive, decked with divers kinds of fruits, so that one seeing then would desire to eat of their fruits.

sinaiticus.text: The twelfth mountain was altogether white and its aspect was cheerful;

sinaiticus.text: and the mountain was most beauteous in itself 88.

sinaiticus.text: And in the middle of the plain he showed me a great white rock, rising up from the plain.

verses.text: And in the middle of the plain he showed me a great white rock, rising up from the plain.

sinaiticus.text: The rock was loftier than the mountains, being four-square, so that it could contain the whole world.

verses.text: The rock was loftier than the mountains, being four-square, so that it could contain the whole world.

sinaiticus.text: And again I was perplexed concerning the virgins, that delicate as they were they stood up like men, as if they intended to carry the whole heaven.

sinaiticus.text: For whatsoever things thou canst not comprehend, attempt them not, if thou art prudent;

sinaiticus.text: What is behind thee thou canst not see, but what is before thee thou beholdest.

sinaiticus.text: The things therefore which thou canst not see, let alone, and trouble not thyself (about then);

sinaiticus.text: So twelve women were called, most beautiful in form, clad in black, [girded about and having the shoulders bare,] with their hair hanging loose.

sinaiticus.text: And the virgins took brooms and swept, and they removed all the rubbish from the tower, and sprinkled water, and the site of the tower was made cheerful and very seemly.

sinaiticus.text: If the lord come to inspect the tower, he hath nothing for which to blame us.

verses.text: Thou art not alone, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: “Thou shalt pass the night with us, say they, as a brother, not as a husband;

verses.text: for thou art our brother, and hence-forward we will dwell with thee;

sinaiticus.text: The rock and the How, Sir, say I, is the rock ancient, but the gate recent?

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he, and understand, foolish man.

sinaiticus.text: The Son of God is older than all His creation, so that He became the Fathers adviser in His creation.

verses.text: The Son of God is older than all His creation, so that He became the Fathers adviser in His creation.

sinaiticus.text: But the gate, why is it recent, Sir? say I.

verses.text: But the gate, why is it recent, Sir? say I.

verses.text: Because, saith he, He was made manifest in the last days of the consummation;

sinaiticus.text: I saw, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: “Thus, saith he, no one shall enter into the kingdom of God, except he receive the name of His Son.

sinaiticus.text: For if thou wishest to enter into any city, and that city is walled all round and has one gate only, canst thou enter into that city except through the gate which it hath?

verses.text: For if thou wishest to enter into any city, and that city is walled all round and has one gate only, canst thou enter into that city except through the gate which it hath?

sinaiticus.text: Why, how, Sir, say I, is it possible otherwise?

sinaiticus.text: If then thou canst not enter into the city except through the gate itself, even so, saith he, a man cannot enter into the kingdom of God except by the name of His Son that is beloved by Him.

verses.text: If then thou canst not enter into the city except through the gate itself, even so, saith he, a man cannot enter into the kingdom of God except by the name of His Son that is beloved by Him.

sinaiticus.text: For this cause thou seest the tower made a single stone with the rock.

verses.text: For this cause thou seest the tower made a single stone with the rock.

sinaiticus.text: So also they that have believed in the Lord through His Son and clothe themselves in these spirits, shall become one spirit and one body, and their garments all of one colour.

verses.text: Since all these things interest thee, saith he, and thou enquirest diligently, listen as touching the stones that have been cast aside.

sinaiticus.text: These all, received the name of the Son of God, and received likewise the power of these virgins.

verses.text: These all, received the name of the Son of God, and received likewise the power of these virgins.

sinaiticus.text: When then they received these spirits, they were strengthened, and were with the servants of God, and they had one spirit and one body [and one garment];

verses.text: for they had the same mind, and they wrought righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: What then, Sir, say I, if these men, being such as they are, should repent and put away their desire for these women, and return unto the virgins, and walk in their power and in their works?

verses.text: What then, Sir, say I, if these men, being such as they are, should repent and put away their desire for these women, and return unto the virgins, and walk in their power and in their works?

sinaiticus.text: Shall they not enter into the house of God?

verses.text: Shall they not enter into the house of God?

sinaiticus.text: They shall enter, saith he, if they shall put away the works of these women, and take again the power of the virgins, and walk in their works.

verses.text: They shall enter, saith he, if they shall put away the works of these women, and take again the power of the virgins, and walk in their works.

sinaiticus.text: For this is the reason why there was also a cessation in the building, that, if these repent, they may go into the building of the tower;

sinaiticus.text: For all these things I gave thanks unto the Lord, because He had compassion on all that called upon His name,

verses.text: For all these things I gave thanks unto the Lord, because He had compassion on all that called upon His name,

sinaiticus.text: and sent forth the angel of repentance to us that had sinned against Him, and refreshed our spirit, and, when we were already ruined and had no hope of life, restored our life.

verses.text: and sent forth the angel of repentance to us that had sinned against Him, and refreshed our spirit, and, when we were already ruined and had no hope of life, restored our life.

sinaiticus.text: Now, Sir, say I, show me why the tower is not built upon the ground, but upon the rock and upon the gate.

verses.text: Now, Sir, say I, show me why the tower is not built upon the ground, but upon the rock and upon the gate.

sinaiticus.text: Because thou art senseless, saith he, and without understanding [thou askest the question].

verses.text: Because thou art senseless, saith he, and without understanding [thou askest the question].

sinaiticus.text: I am obliged, Sir, say I, to ask all questions of thee, because I am absolutely unable to comprehend anything at all;

verses.text: I am obliged, Sir, say I, to ask all questions of thee, because I am absolutely unable to comprehend anything at all;

sinaiticus.text: for all are great and glorious and difficult for men to understand.

verses.text: for all are great and glorious and difficult for men to understand.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: The name of the Son of God is great and incomprehensible, and sustaineth the whole world.

verses.text: The name of the Son of God is great and incomprehensible, and sustaineth the whole world.

sinaiticus.text: If then all creation is sustained by the Son, what thinkest thou of those that are called by Him, and bear the name of the Son of God, and walk according to His commandments?

verses.text: If then all creation is sustained by the Son, what thinkest thou of those that are called by Him, and bear the name of the Son of God, and walk according to His commandments?

sinaiticus.text: Seest thou then what manner of men He sustaineth?
