sinaiticus.text: Even those that bear His name with their whole heart.

verses.text: Even those that bear His name with their whole heart.

sinaiticus.text: Declare to me, Sir, say I, the names of the virgins, and of the of the more powerful virgins, those that are stationed at the corners.

verses.text: Declare to me, Sir, say I, the names of the virgins, and of the of the more powerful virgins, those that are stationed at the corners.

sinaiticus.text: The first is Faith, and the second, Continence, and the third, Power, and the fourth, Longsuffering.

verses.text: The first is Faith, and the second, Continence, and the third, Power, and the fourth, Longsuffering.

sinaiticus.text: But the others stationed between them have these names Simplicity, Guilelessness, Purity, Cheerfulness, Truth, Understanding, Concord, Love.572

verses.text: But the others stationed between them have these names Simplicity, Guilelessness, Purity, Cheerfulness, Truth, Understanding, Concord, Love.572

sinaiticus.text: He that beareth these names and the name of the Son of God shall be able to enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: He that beareth these names and the name of the Son of God shall be able to enter into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: Hear, saith he, likewise the names of the women that wear the black garments.

verses.text: Hear, saith he, likewise the names of the women that wear the black garments.

sinaiticus.text: Of these also four are more powerful than the rest;

verses.text: Of these also four are more powerful than the rest;

sinaiticus.text: the first is Unbelief;

verses.text: the first is Unbelief;

sinaiticus.text: the second, Intemperance;

verses.text: the second, Intemperance;

sinaiticus.text: the third, Disobedience;

verses.text: the third, Disobedience;

sinaiticus.text: the fourth, Deceit;

verses.text: the fourth, Deceit;

sinaiticus.text: and their followers are called, Sadness, Wickedness, Wantonness, Irascibility, Falsehood, Folly, Slander, Hatred.

verses.text: and their followers are called, Sadness, Wickedness, Wantonness, Irascibility, Falsehood, Folly, Slander, Hatred.

sinaiticus.text: The servant of God that beareth these names shall see the kingdom of God, but shall not enter into it.

verses.text: The servant of God that beareth these names shall see the kingdom of God, but shall not enter into it.

sinaiticus.text: But the stones, Sir, say I, that came from the deep, and were fitted into the building, who are they?

verses.text: But the stones, Sir, say I, that came from the deep, and were fitted into the building, who are they?

sinaiticus.text: “The first, saith he, even the ten, that were placed in the foundations, are the first generation;

verses.text: “The first, saith he, even the ten, that were placed in the foundations, are the first generation;

sinaiticus.text: the twenty-five are the second generation of righteous men;

verses.text: the twenty-five are the second generation of righteous men;

sinaiticus.text: the thirty-five are Gods prophets and His ministers;

verses.text: the thirty-five are Gods prophets and His ministers;

sinaiticus.text: the forty are apostles and teachers of the preaching of the Son of God.

verses.text: the forty are apostles and teachers of the preaching of the Son of God.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, did the virgins give in these stones also for the building of the tower and carry them through the gate?

verses.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, did the virgins give in these stones also for the building of the tower and carry them through the gate?

sinaiticus.text: “ Because these first, saith he,

verses.text: “ Because these first, saith he,

sinaiticus.text: bore these spirits, and they never separated the one from the other, neither the spirits from the men nor the men from the spirits, but the spirits abode with them till they fell asleep;

verses.text: bore these spirits, and they never separated the one from the other, neither the spirits from the men nor the men from the spirits, but the spirits abode with them till they fell asleep;

sinaiticus.text: Show me still further, Sir, say I.

verses.text: Show me still further, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: What desirest thou to know the deep, and wherefore were they placed into the building, though they bore these spirits?

verses.text: What desirest thou to know the deep, and wherefore were they placed into the building, though they bore these spirits?

sinaiticus.text: “It was necessary for them, saith he, to rise up through water, that they might be made alive;

verses.text: “It was necessary for them, saith he, to rise up through water, that they might be made alive;

sinaiticus.text: for otherwise they could not enter into the kingdom of God, except they had put aside the deadness of their [former] life.

verses.text: for otherwise they could not enter into the kingdom of God, except they had put aside the deadness of their [former] life.

sinaiticus.text: So these likewise that had fallen asleep received the seal of the Son of God and entered into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: So these likewise that had fallen asleep received the seal of the Son of God and entered into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: For before a man, saith he, has borne the name of God, he is dead;

verses.text: For before a man, saith he, has borne the name of God, he is dead;

sinaiticus.text: but when he has received the seal, he layeth aside his deadness, and

verses.text: but when he has received the seal, he layeth aside his deadness, and

sinaiticus.text: The seal then is the water so they go down into the water dead, and they come up alive.

verses.text: The seal then is the water so they go down into the water dead, and they come up alive.

sinaiticus.text: Thus to them also this seal was preached, and they availed themselves of it that they might enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: Thus to them also this seal was preached, and they availed themselves of it that they might enter into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, did the forty stones also come up with them from the deep, though they had already received the seal?

verses.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, did the forty stones also come up with them from the deep, though they had already received the seal?

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he,

verses.text: Because, saith he,

sinaiticus.text: these, the apostles and the teachers who preached the name of the Son of God, after they had fallen asleep in the power and faith of the Son of God,

verses.text: these, the apostles and the teachers who preached the name of the Son of God, after they had fallen asleep in the power and faith of the Son of God,

sinaiticus.text: preached also to then that had fallen asleep before them, and themselves gave unto them the seal of the preaching.

verses.text: preached also to then that had fallen asleep before them, and themselves gave unto them the seal of the preaching.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore they went down with them into the water, and came up again.

verses.text: Therefore they went down with them into the water, and came up again.

sinaiticus.text: But these went down alive;

verses.text: But these went down alive;

sinaiticus.text: whereas the others that had fallen asleep before them went down dead and came up alive.

verses.text: whereas the others that had fallen asleep before them went down dead and came up alive.

sinaiticus.text: So by their means they were quickened into life, and came to the full knowledge of the name of the Son of God.

verses.text: So by their means they were quickened into life, and came to the full knowledge of the name of the Son of God.

sinaiticus.text: For this cause also they came up with them, and were fitted with them into the building of the tower and were builded with them, without being shaped;

verses.text: For this cause also they came up with them, and were fitted with them into the building of the tower and were builded with them, without being shaped;

sinaiticus.text: for they fell asleep in righteousness and in great purity.

verses.text: for they fell asleep in righteousness and in great purity.

sinaiticus.text: Only they had not this seal.

verses.text: Only they had not this seal.

sinaiticus.text: Thou hast then the interpretation of these things also.

verses.text: Thou hast then the interpretation of these things also.

sinaiticus.text: I have, Sir, say I.

verses.text: I have, Sir, say I.

sinaiticus.text: Now then, Sir, explain to me concerning the mountains.

verses.text: Now then, Sir, explain to me concerning the mountains.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore are their forms diverse the one from the other, and various?

verses.text: Wherefore are their forms diverse the one from the other, and various?

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he.

verses.text: Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: These twelve mountains are tribes that inhabit the whole world.

verses.text: These twelve mountains are tribes that inhabit the whole world.

sinaiticus.text: To these  then the Son of God was preached by the Apostles.

verses.text: To these  then the Son of God was preached by the Apostles.

sinaiticus.text: But explain to me, Sir, why they are various-these mountains-and each has a different appearance.

verses.text: But explain to me, Sir, why they are various-these mountains-and each has a different appearance.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he.

verses.text: Listen, saith he.

sinaiticus.text: These twelve tribes which inhabit the whole world are twelve nations;

verses.text: These twelve tribes which inhabit the whole world are twelve nations;

sinaiticus.text: and they are various in understanding and in mind.574

verses.text: and they are various in understanding and in mind.574

sinaiticus.text: As various, then, as thou sawest these mountains to be, such also are the varieties in the mind of these nations, and such their understanding.

verses.text: As various, then, as thou sawest these mountains to be, such also are the varieties in the mind of these nations, and such their understanding.

sinaiticus.text: And I will show unto thee the conduct of each.

verses.text: And I will show unto thee the conduct of each.

sinaiticus.text: First, Sir, say I,

verses.text: First, Sir, say I,

sinaiticus.text: show me this, why the mountains being so various, yet,

verses.text: show me this, why the mountains being so various, yet,

sinaiticus.text: when their stones were set into the building, became bright and of one colour, just like the stones that had come up from the deep.

verses.text: when their stones were set into the building, became bright and of one colour, just like the stones that had come up from the deep.

sinaiticus.text: Because, saith he, all the nations that dwell under heaven, when they heard and believed, were called by the one name of [the Son of] God.

verses.text: Because, saith he, all the nations that dwell under heaven, when they heard and believed, were called by the one name of [the Son of] God.

sinaiticus.text: So having received the seal, they had one understanding and one mind, and one faith became theirs and [one] love, and they bore the spirits of the virgins along with the Name;

verses.text: So having received the seal, they had one understanding and one mind, and one faith became theirs and [one] love, and they bore the spirits of the virgins along with the Name;

sinaiticus.text: therefore the building of the tower became of one colour, even bright as the sun.

verses.text: therefore the building of the tower became of one colour, even bright as the sun.

sinaiticus.text: But after they entered in together, and became one body, some of them defiled themselves, and were cast out from the society of the righteous, and became again such as they were before, or rather even worse.

verses.text: But after they entered in together, and became one body, some of them defiled themselves, and were cast out from the society of the righteous, and became again such as they were before, or rather even worse.

sinaiticus.text: How, Sir, say I, did they become worse, after they had fully known God?

verses.text: How, Sir, say I, did they become worse, after they had fully known God?

sinaiticus.text: He that knoweth not God, saith he, and committeth wickedness, hath a certain punishment for his wickedness;

verses.text: He that knoweth not God, saith he, and committeth wickedness, hath a certain punishment for his wickedness;

sinaiticus.text: but he that knoweth God fully ought not any longer to commit wickedness, but to do good.

verses.text: but he that knoweth God fully ought not any longer to commit wickedness, but to do good.

sinaiticus.text: If then he that ought to do good committeth wickedness, does he not seem to do greater wickedness than the man that knoweth not God?

verses.text: If then he that ought to do good committeth wickedness, does he not seem to do greater wickedness than the man that knoweth not God?

sinaiticus.text: Therefore they that have not known God, and commit wickedness, are condemned to death;

verses.text: Therefore they that have not known God, and commit wickedness, are condemned to death;

sinaiticus.text: but they that have known God and seen His mighty works, and yet commit wickedness, shall receive a double punishment, and shall die eternally.

verses.text: but they that have known God and seen His mighty works, and yet commit wickedness, shall receive a double punishment, and shall die eternally.

sinaiticus.text: In this way therefore shall the Church of God be purified.

verses.text: In this way therefore shall the Church of God be purified.

sinaiticus.text: And as thou sawest the stones removed from the tower and delivered over to the evil spirits, they too shall be cast out;

verses.text: And as thou sawest the stones removed from the tower and delivered over to the evil spirits, they too shall be cast out;

sinaiticus.text: and there shall be one body of them that are purified, just as the tower, after it had been purified, became made as it were of one stone.

verses.text: and there shall be one body of them that are purified, just as the tower, after it had been purified, became made as it were of one stone.

sinaiticus.text: Thus shall it be with the Church of God also, after she hath been double-minded and they that commit various kinds of wickedness have been cast out.

verses.text: Thus shall it be with the Church of God also, after she hath been double-minded and they that commit various kinds of wickedness have been cast out.

sinaiticus.text: When these have been cast out, the Church of God shall be one body, one understanding, one mind, one faith, one love.

verses.text: When these have been cast out, the Church of God shall be one body, one understanding, one mind, one faith, one love.

sinaiticus.text: And then the Son of God shall rejoice and be glad in them, for that He hath received back His people pure.

verses.text: And then the Son of God shall rejoice and be glad in them, for that He hath received back His people pure.

sinaiticus.text: Great and glorious, Sir, say I, are all these things.

verses.text: Great and glorious, Sir, say I, are all these things.

sinaiticus.text: Once more, Sir, show me the force and the doings of each one of the mountains, that every soul that trusteth in the Lord, when it heareth, may glorify His great and marvelous and glorious name.

verses.text: Once more, Sir, show me the force and the doings of each one of the mountains, that every soul that trusteth in the Lord, when it heareth, may glorify His great and marvelous and glorious name.

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he, to the variety of the mountains and of the twelve nations.

verses.text: Listen, saith he, to the variety of the mountains and of the twelve nations.

sinaiticus.text: From the first mountain, which was black, they that have believed are such as these;

verses.text: From the first mountain, which was black, they that have believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: rebels and blasphemers against the Lord, and betrayers of the servants of God.

verses.text: rebels and blasphemers against the Lord, and betrayers of the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: For these there is no repentance, but there is death.

verses.text: For these there is no repentance, but there is death.

sinaiticus.text: For this cause also they are black;

verses.text: For this cause also they are black;

sinaiticus.text: for their race is lawless.

verses.text: for their race is lawless.

sinaiticus.text: And from the second mountain, the bare one, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the second mountain, the bare one, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: hypocrites and teachers of wickedness.

verses.text: hypocrites and teachers of wickedness.

sinaiticus.text: And these then are like the former it not having the fruit of righteousness.

verses.text: And these then are like the former it not having the fruit of righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: For, even as their mountain is unfruitful, so likewise such men as these have a name indeed, but they are void of the faith, and there is no fruit of truth in them.

verses.text: For, even as their mountain is unfruitful, so likewise such men as these have a name indeed, but they are void of the faith, and there is no fruit of truth in them.

sinaiticus.text: For these then repentance is offered, if they repent quickly;

verses.text: For these then repentance is offered, if they repent quickly;

sinaiticus.text: but if they delay, they will have their death with the former.

verses.text: but if they delay, they will have their death with the former.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, is repentance possible for them, but not for the former?

verses.text: Wherefore, Sir, say I, is repentance possible for them, but not for the former?

sinaiticus.text: For their doings are almost the same.

verses.text: For their doings are almost the same.

sinaiticus.text: On this account, he saith, is repentance offered for them, because they blasphemed not their Lord, nor became betrayers of the servants of God;

verses.text: On this account, he saith, is repentance offered for them, because they blasphemed not their Lord, nor became betrayers of the servants of God;

sinaiticus.text: yet from desire of gain they played the hypocrite, and taught each other [after] the desires of sinful men.

verses.text: yet from desire of gain they played the hypocrite, and taught each other [after] the desires of sinful men.

sinaiticus.text: But they shall pay a certain penalty;

verses.text: But they shall pay a certain penalty;

sinaiticus.text: yet repentance is ordained for them, because they are not become blasphemers or betrayers.576

verses.text: yet repentance is ordained for them, because they are not become blasphemers or betrayers.576

sinaiticus.text: And from the third mountain, which had thorns and briars, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the third mountain, which had thorns and briars, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: some of them are wealthy and others are entangled in many business affairs.

verses.text: some of them are wealthy and others are entangled in many business affairs.

sinaiticus.text: The briars are the wealthy, and the thorns are they that are mixed up in various business affairs.

verses.text: The briars are the wealthy, and the thorns are they that are mixed up in various business affairs.

sinaiticus.text: These [then,that are mixed up in many and various business affairs,] cleave [not] to the servants of God, but go astray, being choked by their affairs,

verses.text: These [then,that are mixed up in many and various business affairs,] cleave [not] to the servants of God, but go astray, being choked by their affairs,

sinaiticus.text: but the wealthy unwillingly cleave to the servants of God, fearing lest they may be asked for something by them.

verses.text: but the wealthy unwillingly cleave to the servants of God, fearing lest they may be asked for something by them.

sinaiticus.text: Such men therefore shall hardly enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: Such men therefore shall hardly enter into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: For as it is difficult to walk on briars with bare feet, so also it is difficult for such men to enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: For as it is difficult to walk on briars with bare feet, so also it is difficult for such men to enter into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: But for all these repentance is possible, but it must be speedy, that in respect to what they omitted to do in the former times, they may now revert to (past) days, and do some good.

verses.text: But for all these repentance is possible, but it must be speedy, that in respect to what they omitted to do in the former times, they may now revert to (past) days, and do some good.

sinaiticus.text: If then they shall repent and do some good, they shall live unto God;

verses.text: If then they shall repent and do some good, they shall live unto God;

sinaiticus.text: but if they continue in their doings, they shall be delivered over to those women, the which shall put them to death.

verses.text: but if they continue in their doings, they shall be delivered over to those women, the which shall put them to death.

sinaiticus.text: And from the fourth mountain, which had much vegetation, the upper part of the grass green and the part towards the roots withered, and some of it dried up by the sun, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the fourth mountain, which had much vegetation, the upper part of the grass green and the part towards the roots withered, and some of it dried up by the sun, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: the double-minded, and they that have the Lord on their lips, but have Him not in their heart.

verses.text: the double-minded, and they that have the Lord on their lips, but have Him not in their heart.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore their foundations are dry and without power, and their words only live, but their works are dead.

verses.text: Therefore their foundations are dry and without power, and their words only live, but their works are dead.

sinaiticus.text: Such men are neither alive nor dead.

verses.text: Such men are neither alive nor dead.

sinaiticus.text: They are, therefore, like unto the double-minded;

verses.text: They are, therefore, like unto the double-minded;

sinaiticus.text: for the double-minded are neither green nor withered;

verses.text: for the double-minded are neither green nor withered;

sinaiticus.text: for they are neither alive nor dead.

verses.text: for they are neither alive nor dead.

sinaiticus.text: For as their grass was withered up then it saw the sun, so also the double-minded, when they hear of tribulation, through their cowardice worship idols and are ashamed of the name of their Lord.

verses.text: For as their grass was withered up then it saw the sun, so also the double-minded, when they hear of tribulation, through their cowardice worship idols and are ashamed of the name of their Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Such are neither alive nor dead.

verses.text: Such are neither alive nor dead.

sinaiticus.text: Yet these also, if they repent quickly, shall be able to live;

verses.text: Yet these also, if they repent quickly, shall be able to live;

sinaiticus.text: but if they repent not, they are delivered over already to the

verses.text: but if they repent not, they are delivered over already to the

sinaiticus.text: And from the fifth mountain, which had green grass and was rugged, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the fifth mountain, which had green grass and was rugged, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: they are faithful, but slow to learn and stubborn and self-pleasers, desiring to know all things, and yet they know nothing at all.

verses.text: they are faithful, but slow to learn and stubborn and self-pleasers, desiring to know all things, and yet they know nothing at all.

sinaiticus.text: By reason of this their stubbornness, understanding stood aloof from them, and a foolish senselessness entered into them;

verses.text: By reason of this their stubbornness, understanding stood aloof from them, and a foolish senselessness entered into them;

sinaiticus.text: and they praise themselves as having understanding, and they desire to be self-appointed teachers, senseless though they are.

verses.text: and they praise themselves as having understanding, and they desire to be self-appointed teachers, senseless though they are.

sinaiticus.text: Owing then to this pride of heart many, while they exalted themselves, have been made empty;

verses.text: Owing then to this pride of heart many, while they exalted themselves, have been made empty;

sinaiticus.text: for a mighty demon is stubbornness and vain confidence.

verses.text: for a mighty demon is stubbornness and vain confidence.

sinaiticus.text: Of these then many were cast away, but some repented and believed, and submitted themselves to those that had understanding, having learnt their own senselessness.

verses.text: Of these then many were cast away, but some repented and believed, and submitted themselves to those that had understanding, having learnt their own senselessness.

sinaiticus.text: Yea, and to the rest that belong to this class repentance is offered;

verses.text: Yea, and to the rest that belong to this class repentance is offered;

sinaiticus.text: for they did not become wicked, but rather foolish and without understanding.

verses.text: for they did not become wicked, but rather foolish and without understanding.

sinaiticus.text: If these then shall repent, they shall live unto God;

verses.text: If these then shall repent, they shall live unto God;

sinaiticus.text: but if they repent not, they shall have their abode with the women who work evil against them.

verses.text: but if they repent not, they shall have their abode with the women who work evil against them.

sinaiticus.text: But they that believed from the sixth mountain, which had clefts great and small, and in the clefts herbage withered, are such as these;

verses.text: But they that believed from the sixth mountain, which had clefts great and small, and in the clefts herbage withered, are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: they that have the small clefts, these are they that have aught against one another, and from their backbitings they are withered in the faith;

verses.text: they that have the small clefts, these are they that have aught against one another, and from their backbitings they are withered in the faith;

sinaiticus.text: but many of these repented.

verses.text: but many of these repented.

sinaiticus.text: Yea, and the rest shall repent, when they hear my commandments;

verses.text: Yea, and the rest shall repent, when they hear my commandments;

sinaiticus.text: for their backbitings are but small, and they shall quickly repent.

verses.text: for their backbitings are but small, and they shall quickly repent.

sinaiticus.text: But they that have great clefts, these are persistent in their backbitings and bear grudges, nursing wrath against one another.

verses.text: But they that have great clefts, these are persistent in their backbitings and bear grudges, nursing wrath against one another.

sinaiticus.text: These then were thrown right away from the tower and rejected from its building.

verses.text: These then were thrown right away from the tower and rejected from its building.

sinaiticus.text: Such persons therefore shall with difficulty live.

verses.text: Such persons therefore shall with difficulty live.

sinaiticus.text: If God and our Lord, Who ruleth over all things and hath the authority over all His creation, beareth no grudge against them that confess their sins, but is propitiated,

verses.text: If God and our Lord, Who ruleth over all things and hath the authority over all His creation, beareth no grudge against them that confess their sins, but is propitiated,

sinaiticus.text: doth man, who is mortal and full of sins, bear a grudge against man, as though he were able to destroy or save him?578

verses.text: doth man, who is mortal and full of sins, bear a grudge against man, as though he were able to destroy or save him?578

sinaiticus.text: I say unto you: I, the angel of repentance unto as many as hold this heresy, put it away from you and repent, and the Lord shall heal your former sins, if ye shall purify yourselves from this demon;

verses.text: I say unto you: I, the angel of repentance unto as many as hold this heresy, put it away from you and repent, and the Lord shall heal your former sins, if ye shall purify yourselves from this demon;

sinaiticus.text: but if not, ye shall be delivered unto him to be put to death.

verses.text: but if not, ye shall be delivered unto him to be put to death.

sinaiticus.text: And from the seventh mountain, on which was herbage green and smiling, and the whole mountain thriving,

verses.text: And from the seventh mountain, on which was herbage green and smiling, and the whole mountain thriving,

sinaiticus.text: and cattle of every kind and the fowls of heaven were feeding on the herbage on that mountain, and the green herbage, on which they fed, only grew the more luxuriant, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: and cattle of every kind and the fowls of heaven were feeding on the herbage on that mountain, and the green herbage, on which they fed, only grew the more luxuriant, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: they were ever simple and guileless and blessed, having nothing against one another,

verses.text: they were ever simple and guileless and blessed, having nothing against one another,

sinaiticus.text: but rejoicing always in the servants of God, and clothed in the Holy Spirit of these virgins, and having compassion always on every man, and out of their labours they supplied every mans need without reproach and without misgiving.

verses.text: but rejoicing always in the servants of God, and clothed in the Holy Spirit of these virgins, and having compassion always on every man, and out of their labours they supplied every mans need without reproach and without misgiving.

sinaiticus.text: The Lord then seeing their simplicity and entire childliness made them to abound in the labours of their hands, and bestowed favour on them in all their doings.

verses.text: The Lord then seeing their simplicity and entire childliness made them to abound in the labours of their hands, and bestowed favour on them in all their doings.

sinaiticus.text: But I say unto you that are such-I, the angel of repentance-remain to the end such as ye are, and your seed shall never be blotted out.

verses.text: But I say unto you that are such-I, the angel of repentance-remain to the end such as ye are, and your seed shall never be blotted out.

sinaiticus.text: For the Lord hath put you to the proof, and enrolled you among our number, and your whole seed shall dwell with the Son of God;

verses.text: For the Lord hath put you to the proof, and enrolled you among our number, and your whole seed shall dwell with the Son of God;

sinaiticus.text: for of His Spirit did ye receive.

verses.text: for of His Spirit did ye receive.

sinaiticus.text: And from the eighth mountain, where were the many springs, and all the creatures of the Lord did drink of the springs, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the eighth mountain, where were the many springs, and all the creatures of the Lord did drink of the springs, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: apostles and teachers, who preached unto the whole world, and who taught the word of the Lord in soberness and purity,

verses.text: apostles and teachers, who preached unto the whole world, and who taught the word of the Lord in soberness and purity,

sinaiticus.text: and kept back no part at all for evil desire, but walked always in righteousness and truth, even as also they received the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: and kept back no part at all for evil desire, but walked always in righteousness and truth, even as also they received the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: Such therefore shall have their entrance with the angels.

verses.text: Such therefore shall have their entrance with the angels.

sinaiticus.text: And from the ninth mountain, which was desert, which had reptiles and wild beasts in it which destroy mankind, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the ninth mountain, which was desert, which had reptiles and wild beasts in it which destroy mankind, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: they that have the spots are deacons that exercised their office ill, for themselves from the ministrations which they had received to perform.

verses.text: they that have the spots are deacons that exercised their office ill, for themselves from the ministrations which they had received to perform.

sinaiticus.text: If then they abide in the same evil desire, they are dead and there is no hope of life for them;

verses.text: If then they abide in the same evil desire, they are dead and there is no hope of life for them;

sinaiticus.text: but if they turn again and fulfil their ministrations in purity, it shall be possible for them to live.

verses.text: but if they turn again and fulfil their ministrations in purity, it shall be possible for them to live.

sinaiticus.text: But they that are mildewed, these are they that denied and turned not again unto their Lord, but having become barren and desert, because they cleave not unto the servants of God but remain alone, they destroy their own souls.

verses.text: But they that are mildewed, these are they that denied and turned not again unto their Lord, but having become barren and desert, because they cleave not unto the servants of God but remain alone, they destroy their own souls.

sinaiticus.text: For as a vine left alone in a hedge, if it meet with neglect, is destroyed and wasted by the weeds,

verses.text: For as a vine left alone in a hedge, if it meet with neglect, is destroyed and wasted by the weeds,

sinaiticus.text: and in time becometh wild and is no longer useful to its owner, so also men of this kind have given themselves up in despair and become useless to their Lord, by growing wild.

verses.text: and in time becometh wild and is no longer useful to its owner, so also men of this kind have given themselves up in despair and become useless to their Lord, by growing wild.

sinaiticus.text: To these then repentance cometh, unless they be found to have denied from the heart;

verses.text: To these then repentance cometh, unless they be found to have denied from the heart;

sinaiticus.text: but if a man be found to have denied from the heart, I know not whether it is possible for him to live.

verses.text: but if a man be found to have denied from the heart, I know not whether it is possible for him to live.

sinaiticus.text: And this I say not in reference to these days, that a man after denying should receive repentance;

verses.text: And this I say not in reference to these days, that a man after denying should receive repentance;

sinaiticus.text: for it is impossible for him to be saved who shall now deny his Lord;

verses.text: for it is impossible for him to be saved who shall now deny his Lord;

sinaiticus.text: but for those who denied Him long ago repentance seemeth to be possible.

verses.text: but for those who denied Him long ago repentance seemeth to be possible.

sinaiticus.text: If a man therefore will repent, let him do so speedily before the tower is completed;

verses.text: If a man therefore will repent, let him do so speedily before the tower is completed;

sinaiticus.text: but if not, he shall he destroyed by the women and put to death.

verses.text: but if not, he shall he destroyed by the women and put to death.

sinaiticus.text: And the stunted, these are the treacherous and backbiters;

verses.text: And the stunted, these are the treacherous and backbiters;

sinaiticus.text: and the wild beasts which thou sawest on the mountain are these.

verses.text: and the wild beasts which thou sawest on the mountain are these.

sinaiticus.text: For as wild beasts with their venom poison and kill a man, so also do the words of such men poison and kill a man.

verses.text: For as wild beasts with their venom poison and kill a man, so also do the words of such men poison and kill a man.

sinaiticus.text: These then are broken off short from their faith through the conduct which they have in themselves;

verses.text: These then are broken off short from their faith through the conduct which they have in themselves;

sinaiticus.text: but some of them repented and were saved;

verses.text: but some of them repented and were saved;

sinaiticus.text: and the rest that are of this kind can be saved, if they repent;

verses.text: and the rest that are of this kind can be saved, if they repent;

sinaiticus.text: but if they repent not, they shall meet their death from those women of whose power they are possessed.

verses.text: but if they repent not, they shall meet their death from those women of whose power they are possessed.

sinaiticus.text: And from the tenth mountain, where were trees sheltering certain sheep, they that believed are such as these;580

verses.text: And from the tenth mountain, where were trees sheltering certain sheep, they that believed are such as these;580

sinaiticus.text: bishops, hospitable persons, who gladly received into their houses at all times the servants of God without hypocrisy.

verses.text: bishops, hospitable persons, who gladly received into their houses at all times the servants of God without hypocrisy.

sinaiticus.text: [These bishops] at all times without ceasing sheltered the needy and the widows in their ministration and conducted themselves in purity at all times.

verses.text: [These bishops] at all times without ceasing sheltered the needy and the widows in their ministration and conducted themselves in purity at all times.

sinaiticus.text: These then shall be sheltered by the Lord for ever.

verses.text: These then shall be sheltered by the Lord for ever.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore that have done these things are glorious in the sight of God, and their place is even now with the angels, if they shall continue unto the end serving the Lord.

verses.text: They therefore that have done these things are glorious in the sight of God, and their place is even now with the angels, if they shall continue unto the end serving the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And from the eleventh mountain, where were trees full of fruit, decked with divers kinds of fruits, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the eleventh mountain, where were trees full of fruit, decked with divers kinds of fruits, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: they that suffered for the Name, who also suffered readily with their whole heart, and yielded up their lives.

verses.text: they that suffered for the Name, who also suffered readily with their whole heart, and yielded up their lives.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, have all the trees fruits, but some of their fruits are more beautiful than others?

verses.text: Wherefore then, Sir, say I, have all the trees fruits, but some of their fruits are more beautiful than others?

sinaiticus.text: Listen, saith he;

verses.text: Listen, saith he;

sinaiticus.text: all as many as ever suffered for the Names sake are glorious in the sight of God,

verses.text: all as many as ever suffered for the Names sake are glorious in the sight of God,

sinaiticus.text: and the sins of all these were taken away, because they suffered for the name of the Son of God.

verses.text: and the sins of all these were taken away, because they suffered for the name of the Son of God.

sinaiticus.text: Now hear why their fruits are various, and some surpassing others.

verses.text: Now hear why their fruits are various, and some surpassing others.

sinaiticus.text: As many, saith he, as were tortured and denied not, when brought before the magistracy, but suffered readily, these are the more glorious in the sight of the Lord;

verses.text: As many, saith he, as were tortured and denied not, when brought before the magistracy, but suffered readily, these are the more glorious in the sight of the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: their fruit is that which surpasseth.

verses.text: their fruit is that which surpasseth.

sinaiticus.text: But as many as became cowards, and were lost in uncertainty,

verses.text: But as many as became cowards, and were lost in uncertainty,

sinaiticus.text: and considered in their hearts whether they should deny or confess,

verses.text: and considered in their hearts whether they should deny or confess,

sinaiticus.text: and yet suffered, their fruits are less, because this design entered into their heart for this design is evil, that a servant should deny his own lord.

verses.text: and yet suffered, their fruits are less, because this design entered into their heart for this design is evil, that a servant should deny his own lord.

sinaiticus.text: See to it, therefore, ye who entertain this idea, lest this design remain in your hearts, and ye die unto God.

verses.text: See to it, therefore, ye who entertain this idea, lest this design remain in your hearts, and ye die unto God.

sinaiticus.text: But ye that suffer for the Names sake ought to glorify God, because God deemed you worthy that ye should bear this name, and that all your sins should be healed.

verses.text: But ye that suffer for the Names sake ought to glorify God, because God deemed you worthy that ye should bear this name, and that all your sins should be healed.

sinaiticus.text: Reckon yourselves blessed therefore;

verses.text: Reckon yourselves blessed therefore;

sinaiticus.text: yea, rather think that ye have done a great work, if any of you shall suffer for Gods sake.

verses.text: yea, rather think that ye have done a great work, if any of you shall suffer for Gods sake.

sinaiticus.text: for your sins weighed you down, and if ye had not suffered for the Name [of the Lord], ye had died unto God by reason of your sins.

verses.text: for your sins weighed you down, and if ye had not suffered for the Name [of the Lord], ye had died unto God by reason of your sins.

sinaiticus.text: These things I say unto you that waver as touching denial and confession.

verses.text: These things I say unto you that waver as touching denial and confession.

sinaiticus.text: Confess that ye have the Lord, last denying Him ye be delivered into prison.

verses.text: Confess that ye have the Lord, last denying Him ye be delivered into prison.

sinaiticus.text: If the Gentiles punish their slaves, if any one deny his lord, what think ye the Lord will do unto you, He Who hath the authority over all things?

verses.text: If the Gentiles punish their slaves, if any one deny his lord, what think ye the Lord will do unto you, He Who hath the authority over all things?

sinaiticus.text: Away with these designs from your hearts, that ye may live for ever unto God.

verses.text: Away with these designs from your hearts, that ye may live for ever unto God.

sinaiticus.text: And from the twelfth mountain, which was white, they that believed are such as these;

verses.text: And from the twelfth mountain, which was white, they that believed are such as these;

sinaiticus.text: they are as very babes, into whose heart no guile entereth, neither learnt they what wickedness is, but they remained as babes for ever.

verses.text: they are as very babes, into whose heart no guile entereth, neither learnt they what wickedness is, but they remained as babes for ever.

sinaiticus.text: Such as these then dwell without doubt in the kingdom of God, because they defiled the commandments of God in nothing, but continued as babes all the days of their life in the same mind.

verses.text: Such as these then dwell without doubt in the kingdom of God, because they defiled the commandments of God in nothing, but continued as babes all the days of their life in the same mind.

sinaiticus.text: As many of you therefore as shall so continue, saith he, and shall be as infants not having guile, shall be more glorious [even] than all them that have been mentioned before;

verses.text: As many of you therefore as shall so continue, saith he, and shall be as infants not having guile, shall be more glorious [even] than all them that have been mentioned before;

sinaiticus.text: for all infants are glorious in the sight of God, and stand first in His sight.

verses.text: for all infants are glorious in the sight of God, and stand first in His sight.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed then are ye, as many as have put away wickedness from you, and have clothed yourselves in guilelessness:

verses.text: Blessed then are ye, as many as have put away wickedness from you, and have clothed yourselves in guilelessness:

sinaiticus.text: After he had finished the parables of the mountains, I say unto him,

verses.text: After he had finished the parables of the mountains, I say unto him,

sinaiticus.text: Sir, now explain to me concerning the stones that were taken from the from the tower, and concerning the round (stones) which were placed in the building, and concerning those that were still round.

verses.text: Sir, now explain to me concerning the stones that were taken from the from the tower, and concerning the round (stones) which were placed in the building, and concerning those that were still round.

sinaiticus.text: Hear, saith he, likewise concerning all these things.

verses.text: Hear, saith he, likewise concerning all these things.

sinaiticus.text: The stones which were taken from the plain and placed in the building of the tower in the room of those that were rejected, are the roots of this white mountain.

verses.text: The stones which were taken from the plain and placed in the building of the tower in the room of those that were rejected, are the roots of this white mountain.

sinaiticus.text: When then they that believed from this mountain were all found guileless, the lord of the tower ordered these from the roots of this mountain to be put into the building of the tower.582

verses.text: When then they that believed from this mountain were all found guileless, the lord of the tower ordered these from the roots of this mountain to be put into the building of the tower.582

sinaiticus.text: For He knew that if these stones should go to the building [of the tower], they would remain bright and not one of then would turn black.

verses.text: For He knew that if these stones should go to the building [of the tower], they would remain bright and not one of then would turn black.

sinaiticus.text: But if he had added  from the other mountains, he would have been obliged to visit that tower again, and to purify it.

verses.text: But if he had added  from the other mountains, he would have been obliged to visit that tower again, and to purify it.

sinaiticus.text: Now all these have been found white, who have believed and who shall believe;

verses.text: Now all these have been found white, who have believed and who shall believe;

sinaiticus.text: for they are of the same kind.

verses.text: for they are of the same kind.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed is this kind, for it is innocent! Hear now likewise concerning those round and bright stones.

verses.text: Blessed is this kind, for it is innocent! Hear now likewise concerning those round and bright stones.

sinaiticus.text: All these are from this white mountain.

verses.text: All these are from this white mountain.

sinaiticus.text: Now hear wherefore they have been found round.

verses.text: Now hear wherefore they have been found round.

sinaiticus.text: Their riches have darkened and obscured them a little from the truth, yet they never departed from God, nor did any evil word proceed from their mouth, but all equity and virtue which comes from the truth.

verses.text: Their riches have darkened and obscured them a little from the truth, yet they never departed from God, nor did any evil word proceed from their mouth, but all equity and virtue which comes from the truth.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore the Lord perceived their mind, that they could favour the truth, *and likewise remain good,

verses.text: When therefore the Lord perceived their mind, that they could favour the truth, *and likewise remain good,

sinaiticus.text: He commanded their possessions to be cut from off them, yet not to be taken away altogether, so that they might be able to do some good with that which hath been left to them, and might live unto God, for that they come of a good kind.

verses.text: He commanded their possessions to be cut from off them, yet not to be taken away altogether, so that they might be able to do some good with that which hath been left to them, and might live unto God, for that they come of a good kind.

sinaiticus.text: So therefore they have been cut away a little, and placed in the building of this tower.

verses.text: So therefore they have been cut away a little, and placed in the building of this tower.

sinaiticus.text: But the other , which have remained round and have not been fitted into the building, because they have not yet received the seal, have been replaced in their own position, for they were found very round.

verses.text: But the other , which have remained round and have not been fitted into the building, because they have not yet received the seal, have been replaced in their own position, for they were found very round.

sinaiticus.text: For this world and the vanities of their possessions must be cut from off them, and then they will fit into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: For this world and the vanities of their possessions must be cut from off them, and then they will fit into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: For it is necessary that they should enter into the kingdom of God;

verses.text: For it is necessary that they should enter into the kingdom of God;

sinaiticus.text: because the Lord hath blessed this innocent kind.

verses.text: because the Lord hath blessed this innocent kind.

sinaiticus.text: Of this kind then not one shall perish.

verses.text: Of this kind then not one shall perish.

sinaiticus.text: Yea, even though any one of them being tempted by the most wicked devil have committed any fault, he shall return speedily unto his Lord.

verses.text: Yea, even though any one of them being tempted by the most wicked devil have committed any fault, he shall return speedily unto his Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed I pronounce you all to be-I, the angel of repentance- whoever of you are guileless as infants, because your part is good and honourable in the sight of God.

verses.text: Blessed I pronounce you all to be-I, the angel of repentance- whoever of you are guileless as infants, because your part is good and honourable in the sight of God.

sinaiticus.text: Moreover I bid all of you, whoever have received this seal, keep guilelessness, and bear to grudge, and continue not in your

verses.text: Moreover I bid all of you, whoever have received this seal, keep guilelessness, and bear to grudge, and continue not in your

sinaiticus.text: but become of one spirit, and heal these evil clefts and take them away from among you, that the owner of the flocks may rejoice concerning them.

verses.text: but become of one spirit, and heal these evil clefts and take them away from among you, that the owner of the flocks may rejoice concerning them.

sinaiticus.text: For he will rejoice, if he find all things whole.

verses.text: For he will rejoice, if he find all things whole.

sinaiticus.text: But if he find any part of the flock scattered, woe unto the shepherds.

verses.text: But if he find any part of the flock scattered, woe unto the shepherds.

sinaiticus.text: For if the shepherds themselves shall have been found scattered, how will they answer for the flocks?

verses.text: For if the shepherds themselves shall have been found scattered, how will they answer for the flocks?

sinaiticus.text: Will they say that they were harassed by the flock?

verses.text: Will they say that they were harassed by the flock?

sinaiticus.text: No credence will be given them.

verses.text: No credence will be given them.

sinaiticus.text: For it is an incredible thing that a shepherd should be injured by his flock;

verses.text: For it is an incredible thing that a shepherd should be injured by his flock;

sinaiticus.text: and he will be punished the more because of his falsehood.

verses.text: and he will be punished the more because of his falsehood.

sinaiticus.text: And I am the shepherd, and it behoveth me most strongly to render an account for you.

verses.text: And I am the shepherd, and it behoveth me most strongly to render an account for you.

sinaiticus.text: Amend yourselves therefore, while the tower is still in course of building.

verses.text: Amend yourselves therefore, while the tower is still in course of building.

sinaiticus.text: The Lord dwelleth in men that love peace;

verses.text: The Lord dwelleth in men that love peace;

sinaiticus.text: for to Him peace is dear;

verses.text: for to Him peace is dear;

sinaiticus.text: but from the contentious and them that are given up to wickedness He keepeth afar off.

verses.text: but from the contentious and them that are given up to wickedness He keepeth afar off.

sinaiticus.text: Restore therefore to Him your spirit whole as ye received it.

verses.text: Restore therefore to Him your spirit whole as ye received it.

sinaiticus.text: For suppose thou hast given to a fuller a new garment whole, and desirest to receive it back again whole, but the fuller give it back to thee torn, wilt thou receive it thus?

verses.text: For suppose thou hast given to a fuller a new garment whole, and desirest to receive it back again whole, but the fuller give it back to thee torn, wilt thou receive it thus?

sinaiticus.text: Wilt thou not at once blaze out and attack him with reproaches, saying;

verses.text: Wilt thou not at once blaze out and attack him with reproaches, saying;

sinaiticus.text: “The garment which I gave thee was whole;

verses.text: “The garment which I gave thee was whole;

sinaiticus.text: wherefore hast thou rent it and made it useless?

verses.text: wherefore hast thou rent it and made it useless?

sinaiticus.text: See, by reason of the rent, which thou hast made in it, it cannot be of use.”

verses.text: See, by reason of the rent, which thou hast made in it, it cannot be of use.”

sinaiticus.text: Wilt thou not then say all this to a fuller even about a rent which he has made in thy garment?

verses.text: Wilt thou not then say all this to a fuller even about a rent which he has made in thy garment?

sinaiticus.text: If therefore thou art thus vexed in the matter of thy garment, and complainest because thou receivest it not back whole,

verses.text: If therefore thou art thus vexed in the matter of thy garment, and complainest because thou receivest it not back whole,

sinaiticus.text: what thinkest thou the Lord will do to thee, He, Who gave thee the spirit whole, and thou hast made it absolutely useless, so that it cannot be of any use at all to its Lord?

verses.text: what thinkest thou the Lord will do to thee, He, Who gave thee the spirit whole, and thou hast made it absolutely useless, so that it cannot be of any use at all to its Lord?

sinaiticus.text: For its use began to be useless, when it was corrupted by thee.

verses.text: For its use began to be useless, when it was corrupted by thee.

sinaiticus.text: Will not therefore the Lord of this spirit for this thy deed punish [thee with death]?584

verses.text: Will not therefore the Lord of this spirit for this thy deed punish [thee with death]?584

sinaiticus.text: “Certainly, I said, all those, whomsoever He shall find continuing to bear malice, He will punish.

verses.text: “Certainly, I said, all those, whomsoever He shall find continuing to bear malice, He will punish.

sinaiticus.text: Trample not, said he, upon His mercy, but rather glorify Him, because He is so long-suffering with your sins, and is not like unto you.

verses.text: Trample not, said he, upon His mercy, but rather glorify Him, because He is so long-suffering with your sins, and is not like unto you.

sinaiticus.text: Practise then repentance which is expedient for you.

verses.text: Practise then repentance which is expedient for you.

sinaiticus.text: All these things which are written above I, the shepherd, the angel of repentance, have declared and spoken to the servants of God.

verses.text: All these things which are written above I, the shepherd, the angel of repentance, have declared and spoken to the servants of God.

sinaiticus.text: If then ye shall believe and hear my words, and walk in them, and amend your ways, ye shall be able to live.

verses.text: If then ye shall believe and hear my words, and walk in them, and amend your ways, ye shall be able to live.

sinaiticus.text: But if ye continue in wickedness and in bearing malice, no one of this kind shall live unto God.

verses.text: But if ye continue in wickedness and in bearing malice, no one of this kind shall live unto God.

sinaiticus.text: All things which were to be spoken by me have  been spoken to you.

verses.text: All things which were to be spoken by me have  been spoken to you.

sinaiticus.text: The shepherd said to me, Hast thou asked me all thy questions?

verses.text: The shepherd said to me, Hast thou asked me all thy questions?

sinaiticus.text: And I said, Yes, Sir.

verses.text: And I said, Yes, Sir.

sinaiticus.text: Why then hast thou not enquired of me concerning the shape of the stones placed in the building, in that we filled up their shapes?

verses.text: Why then hast thou not enquired of me concerning the shape of the stones placed in the building, in that we filled up their shapes?

sinaiticus.text: And I said, I forgot, Sir.

verses.text: And I said, I forgot, Sir.

sinaiticus.text: Listen now, said he, concerning them.

verses.text: Listen now, said he, concerning them.

sinaiticus.text: These are they that have heard my commandments now, and have practised repentance with their whole heart.

verses.text: These are they that have heard my commandments now, and have practised repentance with their whole heart.

sinaiticus.text: So when the Lord saw that their repentance was good and pure, and that they could continue therein, he ordered their former sins to be blotted out.

verses.text: So when the Lord saw that their repentance was good and pure, and that they could continue therein, he ordered their former sins to be blotted out.

sinaiticus.text: These shapes then were their former sins, and they have been chiseled away that they might not appear.

verses.text: These shapes then were their former sins, and they have been chiseled away that they might not appear.

sinaiticus.text: PARABLE THE TENTH.

verses.text: PARABLE THE TENTH.

sinaiticus.text: After I had written out this book completely, the angel who had delivered me to the shepherd came to the house where I was, and sat upon a couch, and the shepherd stood at his right hand.

verses.text: After I had written out this book completely, the angel who had delivered me to the shepherd came to the house where I was, and sat upon a couch, and the shepherd stood at his right hand.

sinaiticus.text: Then he called me, and spake thus unto me;

verses.text: Then he called me, and spake thus unto me;

sinaiticus.text: I delivered thee, said he, and thy house to this shepherd, that thou mightest be protected by him.

verses.text: I delivered thee, said he, and thy house to this shepherd, that thou mightest be protected by him.

sinaiticus.text: True, Sir, I said.

verses.text: True, Sir, I said.

sinaiticus.text: If therefore, said he, thou desirest to be protected from all

verses.text: If therefore, said he, thou desirest to be protected from all

sinaiticus.text: to have also success in every good work and word, and all the power of righteousness, walk in his commandments, which I have given thee, and thou shalt be able to get the mastery over all wickedness.

verses.text: to have also success in every good work and word, and all the power of righteousness, walk in his commandments, which I have given thee, and thou shalt be able to get the mastery over all wickedness.

sinaiticus.text: For if thou keep his commandments, all evil desire and the sweetness of this world shall be subject unto thee;

verses.text: For if thou keep his commandments, all evil desire and the sweetness of this world shall be subject unto thee;

sinaiticus.text: moreover success shall attend thee in every good undertaking.

verses.text: moreover success shall attend thee in every good undertaking.

sinaiticus.text: Embrace his gravity and self-restraint, and tell it out unto all men that he is held in great honour and dignity with the Lord, and is a ruler of great authority, and powerful in his office.

verses.text: Embrace his gravity and self-restraint, and tell it out unto all men that he is held in great honour and dignity with the Lord, and is a ruler of great authority, and powerful in his office.

sinaiticus.text: To him alone in the whole world hath authority over repentance been assigned.

verses.text: To him alone in the whole world hath authority over repentance been assigned.

sinaiticus.text: Seemeth he to thee to be powerful?

verses.text: Seemeth he to thee to be powerful?

sinaiticus.text: Yet ye despise the gravity and moderation which he useth towards you.

verses.text: Yet ye despise the gravity and moderation which he useth towards you.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him;

verses.text: I say unto him;

sinaiticus.text: Ask him, Sir, himself, whether from the time that he hath been in my house, I have done ought out of order, whereby I have offended him.

verses.text: Ask him, Sir, himself, whether from the time that he hath been in my house, I have done ought out of order, whereby I have offended him.

sinaiticus.text: I myself know, said he, that thou hast done nothing out of order, nor art about to do so.

verses.text: I myself know, said he, that thou hast done nothing out of order, nor art about to do so.

sinaiticus.text: And so I speak these things unto thee, that thou mayest persevere.

verses.text: And so I speak these things unto thee, that thou mayest persevere.

sinaiticus.text: For he hath given a good account of thee unto me.

verses.text: For he hath given a good account of thee unto me.

sinaiticus.text: Thou therefore shalt speak these words to others, that they too who have practised or shall practise repentance may be of the same mind as thou art;

verses.text: Thou therefore shalt speak these words to others, that they too who have practised or shall practise repentance may be of the same mind as thou art;

sinaiticus.text: and he may give a good report of then to me, and I unto the Lord.

verses.text: and he may give a good report of then to me, and I unto the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: I too, Sir, I say, declare to every man the mighty works of the Lord;

verses.text: I too, Sir, I say, declare to every man the mighty works of the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: for I hope that all who have sinned in the past, if they hear these things, will gladly repent and recover life.

verses.text: for I hope that all who have sinned in the past, if they hear these things, will gladly repent and recover life.

sinaiticus.text: Continue therefore, said he, in this ministry, and complete it unto the end.

verses.text: Continue therefore, said he, in this ministry, and complete it unto the end.

sinaiticus.text: For whosoever fulfil his commandments shall have life;

verses.text: For whosoever fulfil his commandments shall have life;

sinaiticus.text: yea such a man  great honour with the Lord.

verses.text: yea such a man  great honour with the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: But whosoever keep not his commandments, fly from their life, and oppose him, and follow not his commandments, but deliver themselves over to death;

verses.text: But whosoever keep not his commandments, fly from their life, and oppose him, and follow not his commandments, but deliver themselves over to death;

sinaiticus.text: and each one becometh guilty of his own blood.

verses.text: and each one becometh guilty of his own blood.

sinaiticus.text: But I bid thee obey these commandments, and thou shalt have a remedy for thy sins.

verses.text: But I bid thee obey these commandments, and thou shalt have a remedy for thy sins.

sinaiticus.text: Moreover, I have sent these virgins unto thee, that they may dwell with thee;

verses.text: Moreover, I have sent these virgins unto thee, that they may dwell with thee;

sinaiticus.text: for I have seen that they are friendly towards thee.

verses.text: for I have seen that they are friendly towards thee.

sinaiticus.text: Thou hast them therefore as helpers, that thou mayest be the better able to keep his commandments;

verses.text: Thou hast them therefore as helpers, that thou mayest be the better able to keep his commandments;

sinaiticus.text: for it is impossible that these commandments be kept without the help of these virgins.

verses.text: for it is impossible that these commandments be kept without the help of these virgins.

sinaiticus.text: I see too that they are glad to be with thee.

verses.text: I see too that they are glad to be with thee.

sinaiticus.text: But I will charge them that they depart not at all from thy house.

verses.text: But I will charge them that they depart not at all from thy house.

sinaiticus.text: Only do thou purify thy house;

verses.text: Only do thou purify thy house;

sinaiticus.text: for in a clean house they will gladly dwell.

verses.text: for in a clean house they will gladly dwell.

sinaiticus.text: For they are clean and chaste and industrious, and all have favour in the sight of the Lord.

verses.text: For they are clean and chaste and industrious, and all have favour in the sight of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: If, therefore, they shall find thy house pure, they will continue with thee;

verses.text: If, therefore, they shall find thy house pure, they will continue with thee;

sinaiticus.text: but if the slightest pollution arise, they will depart from thy house at once.

verses.text: but if the slightest pollution arise, they will depart from thy house at once.

sinaiticus.text: For these virgins love not pollution in any form.

verses.text: For these virgins love not pollution in any form.

sinaiticus.text: I say unto him, I hope, Sir, that I shall please them, so that they may gladly dwell in my house for ever;

verses.text: I say unto him, I hope, Sir, that I shall please them, so that they may gladly dwell in my house for ever;

sinaiticus.text: and just as he to whom thou didst deliver me maketh no complaint against me, so they likewise shall make no complaint.

verses.text: and just as he to whom thou didst deliver me maketh no complaint against me, so they likewise shall make no complaint.

sinaiticus.text: He saith unto the shepherd, I perceive, saith he, that he wishes to live as the servant of God, and that he will keep these commandments, and will place these virgins in a clean habitation.

verses.text: He saith unto the shepherd, I perceive, saith he, that he wishes to live as the servant of God, and that he will keep these commandments, and will place these virgins in a clean habitation.

sinaiticus.text: With these words he again delivered me over to the shepherd, and called the virgins, and said to them;

verses.text: With these words he again delivered me over to the shepherd, and called the virgins, and said to them;

sinaiticus.text: Inasmuch as I see that ye are glad to dwell in this mans house, I commend to you him and his house, that ye depart not at all from his house.

verses.text: Inasmuch as I see that ye are glad to dwell in this mans house, I commend to you him and his house, that ye depart not at all from his house.

sinaiticus.text: But they heard these words gladly.

verses.text: But they heard these words gladly.

sinaiticus.text: He said then to me, Quit you like a man in this ministry;

verses.text: He said then to me, Quit you like a man in this ministry;

sinaiticus.text: declare to every man the mighty works of the Lord, and thou shalt have favour in this ministry.

verses.text: declare to every man the mighty works of the Lord, and thou shalt have favour in this ministry.

sinaiticus.text: Whosoever therefore shall walk in these commandments, shall live and be happy in his life;

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall walk in these commandments, shall live and be happy in his life;

sinaiticus.text: but whosoever shall neglect them, shall not live, and shall be unhappy in his life.

verses.text: but whosoever shall neglect them, shall not live, and shall be unhappy in his life.

sinaiticus.text: Charge all men who are able to do right, that they cease not to practise good works;

verses.text: Charge all men who are able to do right, that they cease not to practise good works;

sinaiticus.text: I say moreover that every man ought to be rescued from misfortune;

verses.text: I say moreover that every man ought to be rescued from misfortune;

sinaiticus.text: for he that hath need, and suffereth misfortune in his daily life, is in great torment and want.

verses.text: for he that hath need, and suffereth misfortune in his daily life, is in great torment and want.

sinaiticus.text: Whosoever therefore rescueth from penury a life of this kind,

verses.text: Whosoever therefore rescueth from penury a life of this kind,

sinaiticus.text: winneth great joy for himself For he who is harassed by misfortune of this sort is afflicted and tortured with equal torment as one who is in chains.

verses.text: winneth great joy for himself For he who is harassed by misfortune of this sort is afflicted and tortured with equal torment as one who is in chains.

sinaiticus.text: For many men on account of calamities of this kind, because they can bear them no longer, lay violent hands on themselves.

verses.text: For many men on account of calamities of this kind, because they can bear them no longer, lay violent hands on themselves.

sinaiticus.text: He then who knows the calamity of a man of this kind and rescueth him not, committeth great sin, and becometh guilty of the mans blood.

verses.text: He then who knows the calamity of a man of this kind and rescueth him not, committeth great sin, and becometh guilty of the mans blood.

sinaiticus.text: Do therefore good works, whoever of you have received from the Lord, lest, while ye delay to do them, the building of the tower be completed.

verses.text: Do therefore good works, whoever of you have received from the Lord, lest, while ye delay to do them, the building of the tower be completed.

sinaiticus.text: For it is on your account that the work of the building has been interrupted.

verses.text: For it is on your account that the work of the building has been interrupted.

sinaiticus.text: Unless then ye hasten to do right, the tower will be completed, and ye shut out. When then he had finished speaking with me, he rose from the couch and departed, taking with him the shepherd and the virgins. He said however unto me, that he would send the shepherd and the virgins back again to my house.588

verses.text: Unless then ye hasten to do right, the tower will be completed, and ye shut out. When then he had finished speaking with me, he rose from the couch and departed, taking with him the shepherd and the virgins. He said however unto me, that he would send the shepherd and the virgins back again to my house.588
